story:
* 1/12/16 Update: Thanks again to all who have given of their time, talents, and treasure to the Purposeful Design mission.  In addition to the online campaign, we have also received other donations that put us in total at approximately $70,000, compared to our $60,400 goal. Praise the Lord with us and keep spreading the word that the fundraising campaign is on-going. Additional funds will go toward further investment in infrastructure to keep up with today's growing demand and prepare for the future. 

* 12/28/15 Update:  Check out this great video from 12 Stars Media's recent visist to Purposeful Design: 

* 12/15/15 Update: Thank you to all who have given of their time, talents, and treasure to the Purposeful Design mission.  In addition to the online campaign, we have also received other donations that put us over half way to our $60,400 goal. Praise the Lord with us and keep spreading the word to help us get all the way to 100%.

Who We Are

Purposeful Design is a not-for-profit wood shop specializing in handmade furniture made from rough cut, Indiana hardwoods. We are located on the near east side of Indianapolis in a renovated church building. 

We employ men in our city who’ve hit rock bottom and who have been without a home or unable to get or keep a steady job. We help rebuild lives while teaching the craft of woodworking through positive and encouraging mentoring. We are passionate about both building furniture and re-building lives.

However, we are not...

A job preparedness or training enterprise – we actually make jobs.We are not for everyone – the men must be trainable and show up – not on drugs or alcohol, although nearly all recently were struggling.

The Dual Mission Strategy

Through several local strategic partners we are able to outfit our wood shop with the finest Indiana hardwoods around. This allows our products to remain one-of-a-kind while also keeping costs low for our customers.

We design and build a variety of furniture, each handmade by our craftsmen. Much like the wood we use, each piece of furniture is custom made, and offers a unique story of restoration. 

Here's what Purposeful Design's employees have to say:

“I was in such a dark place. I was delivered from that and now I’m making things people can enjoy…it’s pretty awesome.”
“I love to get up and come to work every day.”
“My family loves what’s happening with me. Purposeful Design definitely has been a big part of that. Jesus saved my life and if it wasn’t for Him I would probably still be dead like I was before.”
“If I didn't have this to occupy my time I'd probably be out on the streets running around just looking for drug money and stealing from people.”

Not only are the men's lives being rebuilt - the good spills over into their marriage and children in many hope-giving ways. Purposeful Design is in business to build furniture and rebuild lives.

Our Progress      

Purposeful Design has trained and employed approximately 30 men. Current employees are making at least 1.6x the minimum wage and some as much as nearly 3x the minimum wage. Sales in 3rd quarter 2015 are up nearly 8 times 2014 sales. 

Our financial goal is to generate a profit so that we are a self-sustaining, not-for-profit business and have funds remaining to invest back into the business for growth and training.

We find that much of the change needed by our men has to do with issues inside themselves. So, we strive to address heart issues. We circle up and pray together at the start of the day and read from the Bible to see what God says. 

Community Recognition

  • Winner of the November 2015 Jefferson Award (watch story here)
  • Received the 2015 Recognition of Excellence Award from the Indianapolis Public Safety Foundation
  • Received the 2015 Mayor's Community Service Award
  • Featured in most of the major Indianapolis news outlets over the past year.  See these stories and more here: pdindy.com/highlights

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the good news! (there is no bad news)

We are growing rapidly and we would love your help in obtaining equipment able to handle the larger volume. Equipment such as a planer, a dimensional sander, a table saw, a dust collection system, a band saw, a pipe cutter/threader, a fan for the finishing room and electrical enhancements.

Your donation will go directly to the purchase of new equipment or facility improvement which will allow for more efficient creation of beautiful furniture and employment of some in our city who are most in need.

When you give, you will be acknowledged on our website, pdindy.com.  For donations over $200, you will receive a set of custom, branded Purposeful Design coasters. Your gift will go to Purposeful Design's parent organization, Heart Change Ministries and then be distributed to Purposeful Design. The record of your giving will show "Heart Change Ministries". 


The Impact of Your Investment

We want our furniture in more homes, businesses, restaurants, and schools so we can get the Purposeful Design story out - thus employing more men who may have no other way to support themselves and their family. 

Take a moment now to consider what your investment will be in these lives.

Other Ways To Help     

  • Let your friends, networks, walls, tweets, all be made aware of this opportunity

  • Check out pdindy.com for more info and to shop our handmade products

    • How Will the Money Be Used


    Organizational Details

    Purposeful Design is an initiative within Heart Change Ministries, a 501(c)(3) organization. We utilize a reputable CPA firm, Somerset CPAs and Advisors– which is an Indianapolis-based accounting and tax firm that’s been around for over 50 years.

    If you have any questions, don't hesitate to call David Palmer at 317.919.6045

    Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi there. My name is Kathryn and I'm a Chef, Food Sales Rep and Menu Consultant from Bangor, Maine. I have held every job you can imagine in the restaurant world starting at age 14. I am self taught and self motivated. My most notable positions have been as an Independent Caterer, Pastry Chef, Sous Chef and Pit Boss at a BBQ Restaurant.

 


 My campaign is to launch Bangor's  first chef run supper club. The New Kenduskeag Supper Club will be held once a week near downtown Bangor. The venue will be our 1890's farmhouse we are historically renovating overlooking the Kenduskeag Stream from Lovers Leap. An idyllic setting for fine dining. 


 Food for the NKSC will be provided from our urban gardens on site, our permaculture garden in Northern Maine or from local farmers. Our plan is to only outsource what cannot be grown in Maine (avocado, chocolate, citrus, ect.). We will also focus on native foods frequently.

 


 Service will be held once a week on Friday nights for up to 20 diners. It will be a set menu, 4 course meal with set donation and gratuity not required. Our menu and donation request will be released via our social media site and donor email list Monday mornings. Invitations can be requested through the same platform. Public invitations will be sent Wednesday morning for Friday service at 7pm. 

 It is important for us to provide fresh, local, native produce and grains. Locally and humanely raised proteins will be a focus as well. The way we utilize dining out currently is invasive to our environment and cannot sustain itself with ethical practices.  Along with local and seasonal foods and preserves, we would like to provide a sense of ownership and pride in the way you dine out. Providing an education in how your food is produced and prepared in an intimate and casual family style setting.

 



 Donors will help me achieve my lifelong desire to operate my own dining establishment. Instead of the " Go Big or Go Home" attitude most first time restauranteurs have, I am making small attainable benchmarks. This being the first. The eventual goal for NKSC, is Maine's first agricultural center and ecological retreat that is fully self sustaining with a restaurant. Think Blue Hill at Stone Barns, but smaller scale, and actually approachable to the average Maine residents wallet.

 


 I have figured in the fees associated with using the Indiegogo platform with my goal of $3,000. for the final amount of $3,150. This will provide the ability to finish the dining area for 20, a large two sided room with an open fireplace on both sides. It will also make it possible for us to finish crafting our family style slab tables. Acquire service and flatware for 20. As well as staff and complete our first dinner, a soft launch and perk for our Family tier of donors. This will provide a more intimate dinner  to get to know your chef, farmer and other NKSC Family members. The other perks for the NKSC Family donors is the right of first refusal on all NKSC events, and the menu pre-release a day prior to public publishing. 

 The second tier, Friends of NKSC will get the pre-released menu and right of second refusal on all NKSC events. Other NKSC events will include food retreat weekends, smaller sized picnics atop Lovers Leap and NKSC educational and harvest events. Regardless of the eventual amount raised, it will all go to launching NKSC in November 2015. The more I raise the sooner it happens and the higher quality the immediate experience will be. No matter how much, NKSC will launch.

 

 It is important to all to approach dining out in a more ethical, sustainable and more personal manner. This is my way of fulfilling a dream and helping the Maine farming community by dining better and truly respecting where our food comes from. As a native Maine chef and farmer with a native master gardner and farmer as a partner, our goals and missions are ones we are qualified for. We are very driven to complete this goal, no matter the personal demand. Thank you for your time, consideration and support. Every dollar helps. The recipe is here. Who's hungry for better?

story:
The Strong Badger Project

About Me



My name is Brock Peters. Born in the Yukon but raised in Winnipeg, I'm a lover of books, music, writing, nature, and community. I'd never thought of myself as a business owner, but earlier this year I was convicted when I found myself thinking: "There are lots of good coffee shops in Winnipeg. But for me, none of them really embody the ethos of a 'coffee house.'" And then: "Hey, man, why don't you go ahead and put your money where your mouth is?"

Over the past few months, my dream of opening a coffee shop has changed and grown. I want to create a place where good, ethical coffee can come together with the arts - books, readings, performances, and artwork - and coalesce into a creative, community-oriented space where everyone is welcome. The call to hospitality has always challenged my introverted nature, but I believe that we were created to live in community, to share the challenges and joys of life together, and to learn what it means to love one another.

Though the start-up costs for a coffee shop are relatively small, they can still be daunting to someone starting with little more than a dream. So, when the time came to hunker down and look at the numbers, I decided to turn to my community for help.

That's where you come in!

Our Goals and Your Help

This summer the Strong Badger Coffeehouse was mobile. I wheeled a home-made cart around downtown Winnipeg selling iced coffees and teas, and chatting with people about my ideas. Though opening a storefront shop is a very different animal, I gained heaps of invaluable hands-on experience through my summertime venture.

The Strong Badger Coffeehouse cart in downtown Winnipeg - with a poet on one side and a guitarist on the other!


The major costs in opening a storefront fall into three broad categories: rent, renos, and equipment. In terms of equipment, Strong Badger already has some basics: a solid bulk grinder, drippers, scales, and kettles, and a small commercial coffee maker. Needed are an espresso machine and grinder, as well as a fridge and dishwasher, for a total of roughly $15,000. Many of the furnishings in the shop will be upcycled - see the Sit Down & Read drive below for more about this.

Rent and renos are tougher to approximate before having found a space, but will include living expenses while I steer the shop towards the break-even point. My main goal now is to find an affordable storefront in the West End with a set-up that doesn't require extensive renovations.

Strong Badger is drawing on funding from many different quarters. My personal savings funded the coffee cart project this summer, and everything remaining will be put towards the shop. I will be applying for a $4,000 grant from the MB Young Entrepreneurs Program, as well as a $15,000 loan from the Futurpreneurs program.  A couple of weeks ago we also had a fantastic fundraising social, which was a great success!

Getting involved with The Strong Badger Coffeehouse means more than just neat perks (though there are plenty of those - in exchange for your donation, you can get coffee vouchers, neat literature, mugs, shirts, and more!) - it means contributing to Winnipeg's cultural scene, and supporting a small business that is completely committed to its community.

The Strong Badger Chronicle - your perk for a $30 donation!


Sit Down & Read

Another way I'm drawing on my (phenomenal) community is to ask for help in gathering some basic items for the shop - namely, chairs. If you've got an old wooden chair taking up space in the garage, shoot me a message and I'll be happy to come and take it away.

The Strong Badger Coffeehouse is committed to reading and literacy, and for us that means making good books available at affordable prices. If you have any books on your shelf that you'd like to donate to be sold in the shop, I'd love to have them.

Any chairs or books I can't use will be donated forwards. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT OF THE STRONG BADGER COFFEEHOUSE!

story:
Dear Humans,
With regards to the astounding amount of refugees that have gone through great lengths to get here, me and a few friends have decided to throw a welcoming party at a bowling alley in true Swedish spirit. But, since we are students living on loans we need YOUR help! Therefore we have set up a crowdfunding site where you can go and drop off some spare change. Currently, we have decided to zero in on one of Stockholm's largest refugee camps in Farsta. We have teamed up with Brandbergens Bowlingalley for two "bowling hours". After a very easy negotiation with nice owners we have settled on an amount of 6000SEK. The event requires the money to be funded by the 20th of September. Please help us make this possible and offer families a relaxing day of fun and a break from the anxiety that must come with leaving everything you hold dear. Donate. Share. Help in any way you can. Thank you so much in advance!
--
Kära medmänniskor,
Med tanke på det ökande antalet flyktingar som har gått igenom mycket för att ta sig hit har jag och ett par kompisar bestämt oss för att bjuda de på bowling i sann svensk välkomstanda. Eftersom vi endast är studenter, behöver vi ER hjälp! Vi har därför satt upp en crowdfunding-sajt där ni kan bidra med det ni kan. Vi har bestämt att fokusera på ett av Stockholms största flyktingboende i Farsta och erbjuda barn och familjer en rolig kväll på Brandbergens Bowlinghall. Det hela kommer gå på 6000kr, och vi hoppas att få ihop det innan 20 September. Hjälp oss snälla att möjliggöra denna idé genom att bidra och/eller dela inlägget! Tack!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am TJ Graham an NFL veteran of four years and the CEO and Founder of Imagine Active, LLC.  At Imagine Active, we aid an active lifestyle through innovative products.  In doing so we have Invented the HydroEX pants.
  •  HydroEX pants are the worlds first waterproof disposable waders. 
  • We are about to embark on our manufacturing and intellectual property phase.
  • With your help we can create a quality, durable product to help keep us dry when things get a little wet.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for a donation of $50,000 that will allow us to purchase a custom mold heat press seal machine for the mass production of the HydroEX pants.
  • Have you ever been out camping and you need cross a waste level creek, river, or stream? Next time pull out your wallet size pouch of HydroEX pants and slip them over your clothes and cross through the water, staying dry the whole time. 
  • HydroEX pants are unique and a one of a kind product.

The Impact

  • HydroEX pants have therapy pool uses: MRSA prevention, water conservation, detergent reduction,and chemical reduction.
  • Military and Hunting benefits keep boots and the body dry out out in the wilderness.
  • Through my four years of College football and four years in the NFL I have encountered a number of problems that are asking for Innovation.
  • The story behind the idea: Before every NFL practice we were given 15 minutes to get ready for practice.  This would break down to roughly 5 minutes for a dip in the hot tub to warm up,  5 minutes for Taping (ankle, wrist, etc.) , and 5 minutes to get dressed for practice. The taping station and hot tub were 20 feet apart but the walk between the locker room and the hot tub and taping area was about a 1 - 2 minute walk between each.  As I was sitting on the taping table one day, I had an idea of a way to get in the water and stay dry enough to get my ankles taped without dripping water all over the Athletic Training Room.  This is how the idea for the HydroEX pants came to Life.

Risks & Challenges

Insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • We want to guarantee that every pair of pants are 100% waterproof.  There are a couple areas that are difficult to make seal watertight.  One of which is the inseam area.  This proved to be the hardest area to keep sealed.
  • With the new machine we can double seal the area and ensure the 100% waterproof guarantee.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If a monetary contribution isn't possible for you, you can still help by contributing intellectual ideas toward our manufacturing process and distribution.
  • please use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary  I am TJ Graham an NFL veteran of four years and the CEO and Founder of Imagine Active, LLC.  At Imagine Active, we aid an active lifestyle through innovative products.  In doing so we have Invented the HydroEX pants.
 HydroEX pants are the worlds first waterproof disposable waders.  We are about to embark on our manufacturing and intellectual property phase. With your help we can create a quality, durable product to help keep us dry when things get a little wet.
   What We Need & What You Get  We are asking for a donation of $50,000 that will allow us to purchase a custom mold heat press seal machine for the mass production of the HydroEX pants. Have you ever been out camping and you need cross a waste level creek, river, or stream? Next time pull out your wallet size pouch of HydroEX pants and slip them over your clothes and cross through the water, staying dry the whole time.  HydroEX pants are unique and a one of a kind product.    The Impact  HydroEX pants have therapy pool uses: MRSA prevention, water conservation, detergent reduction,and chemical reduction.
Military and Hunting benefits keep boots and the body dry out out in the wilderness. Through my four years of College football and four years in the NFL I have encountered a number of problems that are asking for Innovation. The story behind the idea: Before every NFL practice we were given 15 minutes to get ready for practice.  This would break down to roughly 5 minutes for a dip in the hot tub to warm up,  5 minutes for Taping (ankle, wrist, etc.) , and 5 minutes to get dressed for practice. The taping station and hot tub were 20 feet apart but the walk between the locker room and the hot tub and taping area was about a 1 - 2 minute walk between each.  As I was sitting on the taping table one day, I had an idea of a way to get in the water and stay dry enough to get my ankles taped without dripping water all over the Athletic Training Room.  This is how the idea for the HydroEX pants came to Life.    Risks & Challenges Insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  We want to guarantee that every pair of pants are 100% waterproof.  There are a couple areas that are difficult to make seal watertight.  One of which is the inseam area.  This proved to be the hardest area to keep sealed. With the new machine we can double seal the area and ensure the 100% waterproof guarantee.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  If a monetary contribution isn't possible for you, you can still help by contributing intellectual ideas toward our manufacturing process and distribution. please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi Everyone!

First off, we would like to thank you for taking the time to visit our Indiegogo page! We highly appreciate everyone taking the time to check out our new start up business!


"Seven Sins Salon is a full-service beauty salon that will be open to doing certain styles of makeup and hair that is rare to find in any other salon currently out there.  Our plan is to break that mold and start a salon where you will get to hang out in an entertaining atmosphere with rock and electronic music, gaming stations, music gear and much more! We are going to master in Goth, Rock, and Punk styles but of course we are also going to service anyone else who loves the atmosphere of our salon with no prejudices against how you look or dress."


We would like to introduce ourselves, for those of you who don’t know us:




Mel:

My name is Melissa O’Connell and I am 22 years old. When I was a little girl, I was introduced to Rock and Roll music at a very young age. Growing up, I wasn’t sure whether I wanted to follow my father's footsteps and pursue a career in the Music Industry or become a Beautician. I have since become a Hairstylist and Makeup Artist for a little over 5 years now. As soon as I graduated high school, I decided to enroll myself in Cosmetology School. I have worked for various different Salons in the past, and have learned a lot from each one. I still have a complete love for music, and I could never imagine my life without it which is why Dro and I have decided to incorporate the two Ideas together!

Although, I have worked for different salons and have learned a lot from each one, I have never felt appreciated in the workplace. Most of you don't know this, but I recently lost my job as a Salon Manager for a Corporation that I will not name, due to the fact that I took paid personal time off to spend time with my sick grandmother (which was approved by corporate). When returning to my job, she passed a week later and I had to go back out of state for the funeral. My district manager was not happy about this and had no sympathy for the loss of a family member who meant a lot to me. Because of this, they were trying to find ANY reason to let me go.  They ended up accusing me of stealing, without proof and suspended me from work and forcing me pay a fee of $500 for something I didn't do. I received a call 2 days later to find out that I had been "let go" and it was corporates decision. After I went to the work place to gather my belongings, I secretly found out that my position was terminated a week before any of this took place and that they just needed a reason to let me go.

Most people who I’ve worked with have never believed in me or have always assumed I was going to fail due to my age or style of dress, which is primarily why I was let go from this company. Many of them have never even given me a chance to prove them wrong. In the past, it has made me feel worthless and incompetent in regards to my work and I’m sure each and every one of you currently working a day job can relate. Today, I am eager to prove them all wrong. So we proudly Introduce you to Seven Sins Salon! Where “Beauty is Only Sin Deep.” We are in the process of creating a Rock and Roll themed Salon, where people like us won’t be judged by our physical appearance and all beauty is excepted! We welcome everyone with open arms to join us in helping us create an atmosphere that most places don’t offer! Seven Sins is a full-service salon dedicated to consistently providing high customer satisfaction by rendering excellent service, high quality products, and furnishing a rock and roll atmosphere at an acceptable price and value relationship. We will also maintain a friendly, fair, creative and unique environment, which respects diversity, ideas, and hard work. Our Mission is to create an environment where our customers are able to be themselves, to supply services and products that will enhance our clients inner beauty as well as their mental enjoyment.


We have already put in about $10,000 of our own hard earned money into this business, but unfortunately things can get expensive and prices for products and equipment stack up quick, which is where you guys come in. But first, here’s Dro’s story!


Dro:

Hi, my name is Dro Simoes. Most of you may know me as “The Dro”, Bassist of the band Deadstar Assembly. I just turned 33 years old a few days ago and Mel and I have been together for almost 5 years now. We decided to open this salon together not only to go into business for ourselves, but also to have a place where friends and fans can come hang out and get their hair or makeup done without the uncomfortable feeling of being out of place in a standard corporate-run salon. I have had so many friends and members of both famous and infamous bands request that Mel help them with their hair or makeup, but they have always refused to enter the salon’s she’s worked for and would rather the job be done in a private setting like a home. Unfortunately, there are some laws against legally operating a cosmetology business out of homes due to sanitation and we figured it would be awesome to have a place where people like us can go, feel like they can fit in, and have fun while getting their beauty on!

Enter Seven Sins Salon!
So what exactly is Seven Sins Salon? Seven Sins Salon is a full-service beauty salon that will be open to doing certain styles of makeup and hair that is rare to find in any other salon currently out there. Sure, there are definitely some salons where you will see stylists that are tattooed with brightly dyed hair, but the rules in those salons usually follow the same rules as other corporate settings where certain things are not allowed or accepted. Our plan is to break that mold and start a salon where you will get to hang out in an entertaining atmosphere with rock and electronic music, gaming stations, music gear and much more! We are going to master in Goth, Rock, and Punk styles but of course we are also going to service anyone else who loves the atmosphere of our salon with no prejudices  against how you look or dress.

So by now you probably get the idea. Sure it’s a rocker salon, but what is going to set us apart from the rest? This is where the Seven Sins comes in. Each section of the salon is going to be named after a sin and we’re also incorporating other play on words. For example, most salons have a coffee bar or some sort of bar where customers can have drinks or snacks as they wait for their turn in the chair. We’re going to do something similar, but it’s going to be a "Coffin Bar”. Our coffin bar is going to serve coffee, teas, non-alcoholic, and alcoholic drinks. We will also occasionally have snacks such as VooDoo Donuts and more!

Here is the current concept for the Seven Sins Salon areas:

Lust: Beauty Area (Hair cutting stations)
Greed: Receptionist Area / Cash Register
Gluttony: Coffin Bar (Coffee, Drinks, and Occasional Snacks)
Sloth: Guest Waiting Area / Gaming Area
Wrath: Color Mixing Area
Envy: Chalkboard Wall (Band Wall)
Pride: Photo Shoot Wall

More about SLOTH:

The guest waiting area is going to be comprised of a couch, a 42in Monitor and video game consoles. some of the consoles that we can currently make available are XBOX, XBOX360, Playstation, Playstation 2, Nintendo, Nintendo 64, Sega Genesis, Gameboy and more! This will be the area where guests can relax and chill while they are waiting for a service or a friend who may be getting a service done at the time.

More about PRIDE & ENVY:

We are also going to give the opportunities for touring bands to use the salon if they want to have a stylist and makeup artist work on them before heading to the show. The way this will work is that bands coming into town can call ahead and schedule a time-slot. They will have the option to have the salon close down for a couple of hours in order to have a private area to get ready in and they can also choose to keep the salon open for meet and greets. This way fans can come in and hang out with the band as they get ready. The PRIDE wall will be the area where we shoot photos of the bands and possible fans after they are ready and we will have them sign the photo or our chalkboard wall in the ENVY section. The only thing we ask is for the bands to help promote the salon by mentioning that they are there getting ready. If it’s a private salon day, they can make the post once they head out to the show. This means bands will have a cool place to hang out and get ready in, get their drink on, and have fans meet up for photos and autographs before the show.

Our Target Customers: We welcome customers of all ages, but are more targeted towards a younger crowd. Our clientele will consist of people who see the more unique side of beauty, (Tattoos, Funky Colored Hair, Artistic personalities, etc.) We will also Target clientele who, very much so, enjoy the music industry and want to be apart of it.

Company Goals:  We are creating a business that will produce and sell animal cruelty free products and in turn hope to attract hundreds of clients and customers monthly. Our marketing goal consists of promoting daily through social media, paper materials such as flyers and physical mailers, business cards, email marketing, google ad and remarketing campaigns, and other online advertising such as banners and link trading with like-companies. In turn this will grow our potential client awareness to our target audience in order to successfully reach our long term goal of having a fully booked daily/monthly clientele. We want all of our clients to be satisfied when receiving a Salon service, purchasing products, or visiting our salon in general. To make sure each guest that enters our door is satisfied with their visit, we will provide a fun, professional and positive atmosphere in our Salon to keep all guests returning for another visit, and so they may refer other potential guests to our location.

The Seven Sins Salon Keys to Success:

  Location: Providing an easy accessible location for our guests.
  Environment: Providing an environment conducive to giving relaxing and professional service.
  Convenience: Offering guests a wide range of services to choose from, with flexible and extended business hours.
  Reputation: Reputations of the Owners and other “Beauticians” as providing superior personal service.

Company Summary: Seven Sins salon will sell a wide range of beauty services and products. We will provide great quality Hair services, along with top lines of beauty products that will ensure customer satisfaction.  What will Seven Sins Salon set apart from the competition is our Unique Salon Design and our Full commitment to providing all of these services in one convenient location.  Seven Sins Salon will be located at 1125. S Union Blvd, Lakewood, CO 80228. The Salon will utilize 1,100 sq. feet, and is strategically situated on one of the busier corners in Lakewood, CO. It is a high profit area, with easy access from all parts of town.

Startup Summary: After spending several weeks searching for a salon to purchase, we have decided to start a salon from the ground up. The start- up capital will be used for the Design, Leasehold Improvements, Products, and Equipment for the Salon.

Services to Offer:  Seven Sins Salon will offer a wide range of services such as the following: HairCut, Child Cuts, Men’s Cuts, Blowdrys, Thermal Iron services, Conditioning Treatments, All over Color, Root Retouch, Highlights, Gloss & Toners, Keratin Treatment, Relaxers, Perms, Color Removal, Color Corrections, Consultations, Makeup Applications, and Updo’s for all occasions.


Management Summary: Seven Sins Salon will be organized and managed in a creative and innovative fashion to generate superb high levels of customer satisfaction, and to create a professional working climate conducive to a high degree of personal development and economic satisfaction for employees. Training classes through Enjoy Hair Care to help improve employee product knowledge and skills will be conducted on a regular basis. As our business grows, we will consider offering an employee benefit package to include health, dental and vision benefits for everyone.


MONEY!

We came up with the idea for seven sins salon a little while back and began putting together the business plan so we can figure out what we have, what we need, and how we can improve on the ideas we already had. We quickly realized that costs began to add up and we shot to the banks in order to start this journey. We opened up a business account, registered the business name, found a building for the salon and so on. We realized that we spent about $10,000 but still needed another loan to get the rest of the products and salon equipment in order to open the doors and begin allowing customers to check out the awesome place we’ve been working so hard for. Unfortunately, the banks took one look at us and probably decided we weren’t very serious and denied helping us with a loan. The funny thing is that Mel has great credit and one of the guys at the bank even said himself that he had no idea why we were denied because we had everything in place needed to secure the rest of the money we needed to open our doors. The loan we asked for was lower than most car loans and we proved that we already had the income to pay off the loan should anything happen.

So now you’re wondering if we already put $10,000 in, why do we need more? We want you guys to see that every last penny you donate is going towards the salon. There are so many shady people on Indiegogo and Kickstarter that you never know if they’re projects are legit. So we decided we were going to list all of the things we are going to purchase with the money along with our projected necessities. When it comes to the design and marketing, we still have a lot of work to do but this is a task we are taking upon ourselves to do. The logo on this page is just a temporary one, and so is the website theme, but as they get updated we will be sure to let you guys know so you can see them and let us know what you think!


SALON FURNISHINGS

Portable Stations: $450 (4)
Salon Mats: $120 (4)
Paint: $120 (3 1 gallon paint)
Salon Chairs: $300 (4 chairs)
Shampoo Bowls: $850 (2 shampoo bowls)
Styling Station: $750
Track Lights: $1100 (8 Tracks)
Salon Booster Seat: $35
Portable Hair Dryer: $109.44
Trash Cans: $26.96 (2)
Mini Trash Cans: $49.41 (3)
Mini Fridge: $161.49
Keruig Carousel: $34.00
Fridge: $500
Monitor Wall Mount: $40

TOTAL: 4,646.30


SALON SUPPLIES NEEDED

Color Tube Keys: $13.95 (5 keys)
Foils: $36.00 (3boxes of Reynolds)
Gloves: $40.00 / Box (2medium, 1 small)
Color Mixers: $7.19 / 10pc
Back Chair Cover: $31.16 / cover
Barbicide Disinfectant Jar: $109.96 / jar
Barbicide: $6.59 / 16oz
ShipShape: $6.99 / box
Clippercide: $8.29 / can
Processing Caps: $3.99 / Bag (30 count)
Cutting Cape: $339.80 / cape (20)
Hair Color Robe: $153 (20)
Hair Towels: $128.99 / 5dozen
Hair Care Retail Products: $700
Hair Color Products: $1225

TOTAL: $2,810.91

Insurance Coverage: $500 per year. Its for general liability 1mil per occurrence, damages $50k, business property up to $10k, records up to $10k (computers, papers, shipments) , business income up to 12 months up to $65k, professional liability, employee dishonesty up to $5k.

TOTAL: $500

Internet: Comcast will be setting up a line for us since that building does not currently have one. They are charging us a one time fee of $199, then $122 a month. This is a total of $321 just to get started.

TOTAL: $321

Electric: We will be splitting the electric with the company next door to ours since our building is connected to a mechanic’s shop. This will come out to roughly $130+ a month depending on what we use up on our side.

TOTAL: $130

Water: Our water bill will also be split where we pay 2/3rds of the bill. This will come out to at least $150 a month since we will need to constantly wash/shampoo hair, wash towels and supplies etc…

TOTAL: $150

Trash: Service will cost roughly about $45 a month and there will also be setup fees for the account.

TOTAL: $45

Rent: Rent in our building is $1300/month with a $1500 security deposit. The rent will raise in the following year to $1300 then to $1500 after the third year.

TOTAL: $2800

(We will also have other costs not listed here such as advertising, website server,  etc… but we left those out of here since we are already paying for those things out of pocket)

TOTAL FOR EVERYTHING: $11,403.21

As you can see, we are asking for exactly what we need to get started. Please help us reach our goal by sharing this page with your friends and family and let's show these corporate assholes that this is a community that helps each other out and let us prove to all the people who have wronged us that we CAN make a career out of something we love and enjoy doing!

We thank you in advance for any donation you give, it will certainly help us get one step closer to making this dream happen. If you're unable to support us by donating, please help us by sharing this! As you can see, we didn’t even list all costs associated with running a business like this so every little bit helps! If you guys have any questions or concerns feel free to hit us up and we’ll do our best to answer all questions you may have. Also be sure to keep an eye on this page because we are going to keep updating you guys as we get closer to our goals.


Here is the building we chose for Seven Sins Salon:


Here are the Salon Chairs We Plan on Purchasing:
Most of the interior colors are going to be red and black with some other accent colors in certain areas.

Here are the awesome shampoo bowls we plan to get:
They look like something Giger would have made!

We want you guys to see that every last penny you donate is going towards the salon. There are so many shady people on Indiegogo and Kickstarter that you never know if they’re projects are legit. So we decided we were going to list all of the things we are going to purchase with the money along with our projected necessities. When it comes to the design and marketing, we still have a lot of work to do but this is a task we are taking upon ourselves to do. The logo on this page is just a temporary one, and so is the website theme, but as they get updated we will be sure to let you guys know so you can see them and let us know what you think!
SALON FURNISHINGS
Portable Stations: $450 (4)Salon Mats: $120 (4)Paint: $120 (3 1 gallon paint)Salon Chairs: $300 (4 chairs)Shampoo Bowls: $850 (2 shampoo bowls)Styling Station: $750Track Lights: $1100 (8 Tracks)Salon Booster Seat: $35Portable Hair Dryer: $109.44Trash Cans: $26.96 (2)Mini Trash Cans: $49.41 (3)Mini Fridge: $161.49Keruig Carousel: $34.00Fridge: $500Monitor Wall Mount: $40
TOTAL: 4,646.30
SALON SUPPLIES NEEDED
Color Tube Keys: $13.95 (5 keys)Foils: $36.00 (3boxes of Reynolds)Gloves: $40.00 / Box (2medium, 1 small)Color Mixers: $7.19 / 10pcBack Chair Cover: $31.16 / coverBarbicide Disinfectant Jar: $109.96 / jarBarbicide: $6.59 / 16ozShipShape: $6.99 / boxClippercide: $8.29 / canProcessing Caps: $3.99 / Bag (30 count)Cutting Cape: $339.80 / cape (20)Hair Color Robe: $153 (20)Hair Towels: $128.99 / 5dozenHair Care Retail Products: $700Hair Color Products: $1225
TOTAL: $2,810.91
Insurance Coverage: $500 per year. Its for general liability 1mil per occurrence, damages $50k, business property up to $10k, records up to $10k (computers, papers, shipments) , business income up to 12 months up to $65k, professional liability, employee dishonesty up to $5k.TOTAL: $500
Internet: Comcast will be setting up a line for us since that building does not currently have one. They are charging us a one time fee of $199, then $122 a month. This is a total of $321 just to get started.TOTAL: $321
Electric: We will be splitting the electric with the company next door to ours since our building is connected to a mechanic’s shop. This will come out to roughly $130+ a month depending on what we use up on our side.TOTAL: $130
Water: Our water bill will also be split where we pay 2/3rds of the bill. This will come out to at least $150 a month since we will need to constantly wash/shampoo hair, wash towels and supplies etc…TOTAL: $150
Trash: Service will cost roughly about $45 a month and there will also be setup fees for the account.TOTAL: $45
Rent: Rent in our building is $1300/month with a $1500 security deposit. The rent will raise in the following year to $1300 then to $1500 after the third year.TOTAL: $2800(We will also have other costs not listed here such as advertising, website server,  etc… but we left those out of here since we are already paying for those things out of pocket)TOTAL FOR EVERYTHING: $11,403.21As you can see, we are asking for exactly what we need to get started. Please help us reach our goal by sharing this page with your friends and family and let's show these corporate assholes that this is a community that helps each other out and let us prove to all the people who have wronged us that we CAN make a career out of something we love and enjoy doing!We thank you in advance for any donation you give, it will certainly help us get one step closer to making this dream happen. If you're unable to support us by donating, please help us by sharing this! As you can see, we didn’t even list all costs associated with running a business like this so every little bit helps! If you guys have any questions or concerns feel free to hit us up and we’ll do our best to answer all questions you may have. Also be sure to keep an eye on this page because we are going to keep updating you guys as we get closer to our goals.Here is the building we chose for Seven Sins Salon:
Here are the Salon Chairs We Plan on Purchasing:Most of the interior colors are going to be red and black with some other accent colors in certain areas. 
Here are the awesome shampoo bowls we plan to get:They look like something Giger would have made!

story:
Why & What

This campaign isn't in the spirit of "please give us your money so we can achieve our dream."  We have worked hard for five years to establish a solid brand and grow the winery from 175 cases to 1,000 cases.

You may think 'bravo', but we are not resting on our grape leaves.  In the wine industry, that size isn't enough to 'escape gravity' as a standalone business. Micro wineries are growing every year, but not as rapidly as micro breweries, in part because of the much higher capital investments required for growth.
We need your help taking our small business to the next level, and are willing to give you fair trade in "Perks" for your investment.

We have embarked on this campaign to "escape gravity" and set us on a 5 year plan of growing Two Shepherds into a ~3,000 case a year winery. Still small, but a volume that allows the winery to self-fund, be more creative, sustainable, and a full time career for William.

In July, we signed a lease for a warehouse facility that was a video production studio, and undertook the conversion into a winery, adding drains, power, cooling etc, working around the clock. As of late August, the winery shifted into production, as Mother Nature waits for no-one. We are operational but lacking lab equipment, sorely need a larger press and other equipment.

The hard work and long hours, nor the day jobs, end with this campaign. Your contribution (which will be justly rewarded with great value Perks) helps us transform an empty warehouse into our own winery. This is the critical step to achieving our goal of being able to focus solely on crafting unique wines, expanding our wine offers, and "escape gravity."


Who is Two Shepherds

Two Shepherds is a micro winery making about 1,000 cases a year of hand crafted, small lot Rhone wines. Fifteen different lots. 1000 cases bottled in 2013.

Principal/winemaker William Allen is known in the wine industry as a passionate advocate of small lot, natural, old world style wines. The wine industry is not one ideally suited for small producers making a living. Thus for 5 years, William has subsidized the growth of Two Shepherds with his day job, spending nights and weekends making wine. A true labor of love.

Chief Shepherdess Karen's foray into wine started early in life. At age 3, she decided to figure out how to walk backwards upstairs while carrying an expensive bottle of wine. Luckily, more recent wine endeavors have been more successful including working for 7 years at a wine importer in NYC. Yearning to be closer to the vines, she moved to Sonoma 5 years ago to work at a large wine company. One day she tasted the Two Shepherds Grenache Blanc and fell heads over heels. Soon after she fell for William.

 After intensive pondering, we have decided to make the challenging leap to grow the next 5 years to ~3,000 cases. This will make it a full time endeavor for William, allowing him to focus his energy, passion, and skill to continue making and expanding our portfolio of interesting wines made from unique varieties and vineyards.

The foundation of this next chapter is having a winery and tasting room of our own to allow us to grow more cost effectively. We were lucky enough to find a great space in an up-and-coming beverage district in Windsor CA - with great neighbors like Tilted Shed Cider, Sonoma Brothers Distilling, Colagrossi Wine, and St Florian Brewery.


What We Need and What Your Dollars Enable

Converting this 3,600 square foot warehouse to a winery entails many things like installing floor drains, a crush pad wet area, basic cooling, as well as buying a myriad of equipment such as a forklift, press, crusher/destemmer, cleaning equipment, tanks, and more. We have bare bones, but not enough.

 Nothing extravagant, just simple and used equipment will get the job done. It's $120,000+ tab nonetheless.


We have the basics, but need assistance with additional items.

Your contribution will help fund a small business expansion and support artisan craftsmanship.

What You Get

We did extensive research on many wine and related crowdfunding ventures, and analyzed various reward structures. We appreciate that your own dollars are hard earned, and have crafted each Perk to deliver value for your investment.

Once your perk is ordered and we are complete, we will gather information like T-shirt sizes, addresses etc. Items can be gifted as well, and we will gather those logistics post funding as well.

Perks range from unique, cool wine merchandise, wine offers, private wine country experiences, to a 1/2 barrel of  your very own wine! Yes, there are many options, but we felt strongly that there is something rewarding and meaningful for every budget. We encourage you to look at them all before deciding.

New  - Create your own Perk! Don't see quite the Perk you would like? Email us and we will create a customized one for you!

Risks

Your investment is secure. Two Shepherds is an established business with an excellent reputation, achieved by word of mouth. We have grown 25%+ each year since we have started, investing all sales, and more, into growth.  We have wine in inventory, reward items have been ordered, and Harvest 2015 is underway.

The more money we raise, the more (and higher quality) equipment we can procure.

Referral Program Rewards

Crowdfunding success relies on wide reach. We'd like to thank you for taking the time to share this with your friends via email and social media. In exchange we'll offer you some wine and cool stuff!

How it works:

  1. Log into your Indiegogo account

  2. Click on the referral links (email, Twitter etc) at the top left of this campaign to share with your friends and/or via social media buttons. Hashtag #EscapeGravity

  3. Make sure your friends use your unique referral link when they buy, so you get credit. (You can check your account to see how many referral dollars you have driven.)

  4. If your friends spend a combined total of $500, we'll give you $100 in wine and/or merchandise. If they spend a combined total of $1000 we'll give you $250.


Thank you,

William, Karen, Austin & Arya (our Australian Shepherds), Dolce (our miniature donkey) and Viognier, Roussane & Marsanne (our chickens)

_________________________________________________

About Two Shepherds

Two Shepherds is the labor of passion by started by William Allen, well known Rhône enthusiast and former wine blogger. William was a garagiste for years before moving into commercial production in 2010. 

Two Shepherds represents “shepherd of the palate” as his palate and recommendations are widely followed on social media, and “shepherd of the grape” which incorporates his minimal intervention, winemaking philosophy, that requires careful oversight, from vineyard to bottle. 

Two Shepherds specializes in Rhone varieties from cool climate vineyards and unique plantings, made with minimal intervention. Core philosophies include use of native yeast, no additions other than minimal S02, neutral barrel and concrete fermentation and aging, whole cluster, and unfined, unfiltered production.

Eighty percent of the wines are sold direct to list, with a handful of selecte.d restaurant and retail partners in California, and a tiny distribution in New York, Minnesota, and Washington DC.

The wines have been featured in the San Francisco Chronicle, Press Democrat, Wine & Spirits Magazine, 7x7 Magazine, Edible, Terroirist, Vinography, and numerous online publications. Two Shepherds was named as a Top Ten Hot Brand by Wine Business Monthly in 2012. Recently, Two Shepherds was one of the 125 wineries profiled in Jon Bonné's new book, “The New California Wine: A Guide to the Producers and Wines Behind a Revolution in Taste.”

William is an active leader and proponent for Rhone wines, serving as a Board Member of the Rhone Rangers and their North Coast Chapter President. He organizes numerous, intimate Rhone Rangers tastings throughout the Bay Area.

Press Examples:

• Featured in Jon Bonné's new book: The New California Wine: A Guide to the Producers and Wines Behind a Revolution in Taste

• Vinography "...a jewel box of small lot wines" The Wines of Two Shepherds

• Garagiste Festival: Get The Dirt from William Allen of Two Shepherds

• Wine Business Monthly Top Ten Hot Brand of the Year

• San Francisco Chronicle: A bright moment for the Rhone-minded

________________________________________________

story:
The M.O.P. Shop

The M.O.P. Shop is a building, a physical location, a collection of tools, and a space to work,  build, and collaborate.  It's a team of dedicated supporters, a community of members, and a place to learn and share skills, where tinkerers, craftspeople, and artists merge and mingle and make. 

Additionally, The M.O.P. Shop is a hub for reclaimed building materials and will feature an outdoor yard for salvaged  and sustainably harvested lumber.

In the span of only a year, The M.O.P. Shop has gone from the vision of a lone maker to the collaborative effort of a dedicated group of members and volunteers; what started as an idea is now an almost finished makerspace in a permanent location, a warehouse on the westside of town.  Matt Forbes, the creator and developer of the M.O.P. Shop, has invested his savings and the last nine months of his life  into the creation of this project, spurred on by the belief that such a space will be a positive, welcomed, and long-lived edition to the Helena community.  

By supporting The M.O.P. Shop, you will be supporting the arts, education, sustainable creativity, and the establishment of small local businesses and collectives. 



What We Need 

We are so close to being able to open The M.O.P. Shop to the public, but we need your help to make the final push.  We've set the goal for this fundraising campaign at $12,000, which will provide the tools and the additions to the space that are necessary to open the doors to the public and bring new members in. 

This is what your donations will provide:

Saw Stop Table Saw - $4700 

Band Saw - $550

Lathe - $450

3-D Printer and accessories - $1000

Key Card System - $250

Industrial Sewing Machine - $550

Various Hand Tools - $1000

Building Materials, Shop Additions, Hardware, Renovations, etc. - $2000

Survival/Emergency Fund - $1500



The Impact 


Making things with your hands and mind is rewarding, whether it's for fun, to provide necessities for yourself and your family, or as a business.  Creating within a community of other makers, opens up entire worlds of possibilities to learn and share and to collaborate and conspire.  Spaces like The M.O.P. Shop aren't just cool ideas and fun places to work on projects, they are an unstoppable manifestation of the desire to create a new and better world of open source ideas, collaborative communities, and the DIY ethic of reusing and re-purposing.  Makerspaces are here to stay and that's a good thing.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Summary


The idea for The U Chef came because I enjoy cooking, but I’m not creative making recipes and I don't like to go grocery shopping. Sometimes when I do go shopping, I end up buying ingredients that I don't use and usually throw away. So after a brainstorming session with some friends we realized that there is a better way.

I believe in eating healthy and have a passion for helping my community and the environment.  That’s why I created a business that reflects these ideals.

We only provide organic food because it is our belief that your body will benefit from a healthy, nutritious diet. And so our main goal became to provide nutritious meals and the education of  people as to the many advantages of a well balanced diet that are easy to prepare along with easy to follow instructions on how to make them yourself. And by using The U Chef unprocessed and healthy meals will help you stay at the weight you are or reach your weight goal, that's just a plus when you eat healthy and exercise. When you eat right you feel better and your body will react better as well.

I’m extremely passionate about helping environment. I have done internships in ecological non-profit organizations. I volunteer to clean at least 4 to 5 beaches a year. I’m very concerned on the amount of waste meal kit companies create. That's the reason why we only want to use biodegradable, compostable, eco-friendly and recycled containers, bags and boxes.  We will always strive to be as sustainable as possible and help our users to recycle and have a more sustainable  way of living.

I want my company to help our community and I believe in sharing our success. That’s why The U Chef will donate one family meal  for  every 300 meals we prepare, package and deliver. We will donate to a family in need or an organization to be determined in the near future.

Your contribution will help me  achieve this dream.  It will not only help me  but you will help many other people in need and reduce the pollution of the environment.





The Service

We will provide you with weakly organic recipes online.  You will chose the meals you like. Modified them if you want and create your own menu. 


The U Chef will send you the right amount of uncooked organic ingredients for the meals.  You don’t have to spend time or think of how to make all the pre-arrangements of a delicious, healthy and organic meal.  At the end you are left with the great exiting experience of cooking, the healthy benefits of the meal and with the extra time you save by not going to the groceries and of figuring out what to cook. 

By us using eco-friendly packaging to send your meals, educating and providing other options for the disposal of the waste we will help you have a more sustainable life.  

And you can feel great to know that by using The U Chef you will be helping the community.  Every meal you cook with us helps us to provide healthy meals for a family in need and their kids. 


What We Need & What You Get

All the funding that we will receive is to help us do the following:

  1. Finalize the web page

  2. Invest in marketing  

  3. Find a place to store the food

  4. Prepare and send our food boxes (U Boxes)

  5. buy all the appliances and tools we need.

  6. Maintain this business for the next six months

  7. Give us the freedom and time to work.

We want to give a piece of The U Chef to everyone that helps us.  That’s why when you help us financially we will give you discounts  or free meal boxes so you  can enjoy our service in the future. And we will always be in contact with you to let you know how our business is growing and the people that are helping.  And to make you feel part of our family we want you to have a The U Chef apron so you can cook all your diners with it.  


How The U Chef will use your financial help.

If for any reason we are not able to meet our goal, the money will be used to keep advancing the project.  Especially finishing the web page and buying some appliances.  That will help us find other investors and achieve our goals.  


Users Experience

We want to make cooking fun for our users.  We want to eliminate all the difficult process and leaving them with the fun and excitement of cooking.  The users will have everything they need for their meals right inside the box and the best thing is that the users know exactly what they receiving because they chose the meal they want.  Also we want a direct connection with our users and that’s why we are providing easy ways for them to cantact us from the web page and app.


The U Chef Promises

Users

We promise great organic products. With new, easy, delicious recipes full of nutrients every week.


Environment

At "The U Chef" all of our ingredients are packaged and shipped in biodegradable, compostable, eco friendly and sustainable packages. We recommend you to recycle or send them back to us, where we will do it for you.


Community

"The U Chef" will donate a full family meal to a low income family per every 300 meals we sale with the help of your purchase.


The Team


Jorge Oquendo

Creator and Business Manager

BA in Marketing and Business

I been bless in having great opportunities in my life. When I was younger I was able to work as a leader in youth movements and in my community. And that gave me a great foundation to lead and help others.  As I grew older I gather experience working as a manager in a family own small business and as assistant manager in Best Buy.  This opportunities help me grow and develop skills in administration and customer service.



Keila Oquendo

Meal Developer Manager

Pursuing a BA in Nutrition

I love cooking and developing recipes. I first got into cooking a couple of years ago when I was overweight and unhealthy.  I realized that eating at home was the solution for a healthier life. I’am currently studying dietetics and enjoy learning how food works in our minds and emotions.  



Will Marquez

Data and Information Manager

BA in Computer Science with a concentration on Software Engineering  Currently pursuing a Master's in Cybersecurity

I’m in charge of the web page development, safety and making sure everything is easy and understandable for our users to use.  


Pedro A. Estopiñan

Marketing Director

Founder of Integritly.com, a Miami-based digital advertising agency specializing in direct response advertising.

I’m in charge of coming up with marketing & advertising strategies involving social media, viral content, organic & paid traffic. It’s my job to make sure we’re reaching our target audience in the most effective ways to convey our core brand values and win them over as happy customers.


The Impact

The success of this company will not only be for us. Our community and the environment will also benefit from our efforts.  Even if we are not the biggest company in the meal-kit delivery service.  We will reduce the amount of carbon food print and the amount of waste that we generate.  By educating and providing different options. And that for us is a very big deal.  

Also the fact that we know  we will  help people and children in need, fills our hearts with gratitude. Knowing that we are providing great food and service to our users, helping the environment and giving something so essential and needed as a good meal to people in need. That’s the real success for us.




Risks & Challenges


Our main challenge is planning how much food to buy and perfect the art of shipping fresh food to our users.  We know that we will succeed in this because we will be listening to our users and learning every week with every box that we send.  The web page and app provides a direct line to us.  So we can intercept and resolve any problem with the quality, freshness and service of our boxes.

Our second challenge is  growth.  We are starting only in Florida.  The reason?  Because we want to learn and get better and with our experience start growing to other markets that we know  are looking to get their meals from a company like us. We know that we will be excellent and experienced with time.  One smaller market  l area will help us adapt and learn.  Once we feel that we are completely capable we will start moving  to other markets and states.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to help us financially.  If you think this is a good idea, there other ways you can help.  You can share this campaign using the indiegogo share tool with your friends and family.  That will help us contact more people and we will be very greatful.



Thank you for everything that you can and will do with us.
story_txt:
SummaryThe idea for The U Chef came because I enjoy cooking, but I’m not creative making recipes and I don't like to go grocery shopping. Sometimes when I do go shopping, I end up buying ingredients that I don't use and usually throw away. So after a brainstorming session with some friends we realized that there is a better way.I believe in eating healthy and have a passion for helping my community and the environment.  That’s why I created a business that reflects these ideals.We only provide organic food because it is our belief that your body will benefit from a healthy, nutritious diet. And so our main goal became to provide nutritious meals and the education of  people as to the many advantages of a well balanced diet that are easy to prepare along with easy to follow instructions on how to make them yourself. And by using The U Chef unprocessed and healthy meals will help you stay at the weight you are or reach your weight goal, that's just a plus when you eat healthy and exercise. When you eat right you feel better and your body will react better as well.I’m extremely passionate about helping environment. I have done internships in ecological non-profit organizations. I volunteer to clean at least 4 to 5 beaches a year. I’m very concerned on the amount of waste meal kit companies create. That's the reason why we only want to use biodegradable, compostable, eco-friendly and recycled containers, bags and boxes.  We will always strive to be as sustainable as possible and help our users to recycle and have a more sustainable  way of living. I want my company to help our community and I believe in sharing our success. That’s why The U Chef will donate one family meal  for  every 300 meals we prepare, package and deliver. We will donate to a family in need or an organization to be determined in the near future. Your contribution will help me  achieve this dream.  It will not only help me  but you will help many other people in need and reduce the pollution of the environment. 
The Service
We will provide you with weakly organic recipes
online.  You will chose the meals you
like. Modified them if you want and create your own menu.  


The U Chef will send you the right amount of
uncooked organic ingredients for the meals. 
You don’t have to spend time or think of how to make all the
pre-arrangements of a delicious, healthy and organic meal.  At the end you are left with the great
exiting experience of cooking, the healthy benefits of the meal and with the extra time you save by not going to the groceries and of figuring out what
to cook. 
By us using eco-friendly packaging to send your meals, educating and providing other options for the disposal of the waste we will help you have a more sustainable life.  
And you can feel great to know that by using The U Chef you will be helping the community.  Every meal you cook with us helps us to provide healthy meals for a family in need and their kids. 
What We Need & What You GetAll the funding that we will receive is to help us do the following:
Finalize the web page
Invest in marketing  
Find a place to store the food
Prepare and send our food boxes (U Boxes)
buy all the appliances and tools we need. 
Maintain this business for the next six months
Give us the freedom and time to work. 
We want to give a piece of The U Chef to everyone that helps us.  That’s why when you help us financially we will give you discounts  or free meal boxes so you  can enjoy our service in the future. And we will always be in contact with you to let you know how our business is growing and the people that are helping.  And to make you feel part of our family we want you to have a The U Chef apron so you can cook all your diners with it.  How The U Chef will use your financial help. If for any reason we are not able to meet our goal, the money will be used to keep advancing the project.  Especially finishing the web page and buying some appliances.  That will help us find other investors and achieve our goals.  Users ExperienceWe want to make cooking fun for our users.  We want to eliminate all the difficult process and leaving them with the fun and excitement of cooking.  The users will have everything they need for their meals right inside the box and the best thing is that the users know exactly what they receiving because they chose the meal they want.  Also we want a direct connection with our users and that’s why we are providing easy ways for them to cantact us from the web page and app. The U Chef PromisesUsersWe promise great organic products. With new, easy, delicious recipes full of nutrients every week.EnvironmentAt "The U Chef" all of our ingredients are packaged and shipped in biodegradable, compostable, eco friendly and sustainable packages. We recommend you to recycle or send them back to us, where we will do it for you. Community"The U Chef" will donate a full family meal to a low income family per every 300 meals we sale with the help of your purchase.The TeamJorge OquendoCreator and Business ManagerBA in Marketing and BusinessI been bless in having great opportunities in my life. When I was younger I was able to work as a leader in youth movements and in my community. And that gave me a great foundation to lead and help others.  As I grew older I gather experience working as a manager in a family own small business and as assistant manager in Best Buy.  This opportunities help me grow and develop skills in administration and customer service. Keila OquendoMeal Developer ManagerPursuing a BA in NutritionI love cooking and developing recipes. I first got into cooking a couple of years ago when I was overweight and unhealthy.  I realized that eating at home was the solution for a healthier life. I’am currently studying dietetics and enjoy learning how food works in our minds and emotions.  Will MarquezData and Information ManagerBA in Computer Science with a concentration on Software Engineering  Currently pursuing a Master's in CybersecurityI’m in charge of the web page development, safety and making sure everything is easy and understandable for our users to use.  Pedro A. EstopiñanMarketing DirectorFounder of Integritly.com, a Miami-based digital advertising agency specializing in direct response advertising.I’m in charge of coming up with marketing & advertising strategies involving social media, viral content, organic & paid traffic. It’s my job to make sure we’re reaching our target audience in the most effective ways to convey our core brand values and win them over as happy customers.The ImpactThe success of this company will not only be for us. Our community and the environment will also benefit from our efforts.  Even if we are not the biggest company in the meal-kit delivery service.  We will reduce the amount of carbon food print and the amount of waste that we generate.  By educating and providing different options. And that for us is a very big deal.  Also the fact that we know  we will  help people and children in need, fills our hearts with gratitude. Knowing that we are providing great food and service to our users, helping the environment and giving something so essential and needed as a good meal to people in need. That’s the real success for us. story:
Hello My name is jarred and i am from Rivers Manitoba, i am 27 and i have lived here all my life. The reason i am campaigning is my goal is to give back to my community, and give back to the golf course. Growing up i became a member at Riverdale Golf and Country Club at 8 years old and i have been one ever since. I am now also on the Club Board. 

Our Course over the past couple years has had a rough couple starts to the year, thanks to the weather and the flooding that occurred has financially hurt us. I am asking for help because i want this golf course to continue to run next year and many ore years after, for the children and people who live in our community, and for the people visiting our community. 

I am asking for 20,000 in funding, and the reason why is i believe this amount can fiscally keep us strong for many years to come and also allow us to upgrade the course a little bit as well. Whether it be signs, new flags, new blocks for the teeboxes, fixing any water lines, etc. If we can't reach our goal of 20,000. Any money raised on here will still go toward the community golf course. 

I believe our Project is extremely valuable as it is very important to our town as it is one of our main draws. Our Course is very affordable for families, and I want to be able to keep prices down so the next generation can enjoy our course as well. I have never done any sort of crowdfunding before. I hope you will not only help back our community golf course, but back our future.

story:
Cricket flour, the protein of the future. Pasta, the world's favorite food. Good match, huh? 

We moved to Thailand, the motherland of edible insects, to produce an innovative super-food: bug-based pasta.

Our pasta is a combination of rice, tapioca, and cricket powder. It's healthy, sustainable, and delicious. Help us spread the word and market it to the world!


THE ANSWER IS RIGHT AT YOUR FEET


Welcome to Earth, the insect planet. Did you know that 80% of the world eats bugs? It's only westerners that have stopped and forgotten that they are the best sources of protein. 

Thailand, the land of smiles, beautiful beaches, and edible insects. Where fried scorpions, meal worms, and crickets are sold as street food. Thailand is where edible insects are a solid, serious business: there are over 20,000 farmers breeding crickets, registered with the Ministry of Agriculture, and supervised by the University of Khon Kaen. The tropical location is also a key advantage: crickets need very warm weather to grow. That's why producing insect-based food makes more sense here than in the west. 

OK, we've got the crickets now, but why eat them? 

  • Food quality. Crickets are made up of mostly protein, up to 70% of their weight in fact. That’s more than double the amount that a cow has. They also contain as much calcium as milk, are rich in Omega-3, and a have as much vitamin B12 as salmon.

  • Sustainability. They need very little food and water (1,000 time less than a cow) and they grow fast. Crickets only require 2 kg of feed to make 1 kg of protein (while a cow needs 10 kg). There is a looooong list of reasons why insects are the green way to proteins, see this article, for example.

  • Food to feed the world. United Nations' FAO agency has been promoting edible insects for years, as they might help undeveloped countries now, and the entire world in 15 years, when the population is expected to be more than 9 billion. See the FAO document here. 

  • Gluten free, antibiotics free. Our pasta is made in a gluten free factory and is certified gluten free. The pasta is also packed with added benefits, such as no cholesterol and zero antibiotics.

You can find more details on our website, including a blog that we update weekly.


Great, we like crickets. But why pasta? 


It would be hard to convince people to start a new nutritional behavior by eating whole crickets. Westerners eat oysters, cow tongue, frogs but not crickets - even if they are closely related to shrimps, which we love. It's a cultural obstacle, but pasta containing cricket flour is a great first step. No whole insects involved and no discerning insect shape. It is mixed with other flours, boiled, and eaten with sauce. 

It's simply the world's favorite food (see link at the bottom). This is a fast, easy, road map towards edible insects. Oh, and our pasta is tasty too.  Here are some photos of our first production run.




The market landscape at the moment:

  • Some insect-based food are already available in the US and some European countries (i.e. energy bars, cookies, burgers, crackers). Surprisingly, we did not find any pasta based on cricket flour, apart from a local project available only in a few shops in Belgium (and with mealworms instead of crickets).

  • Pasta is a product suitable for restaurants, too. Chefs are at the top of our target market. Signature dishes with insects or insect flavors are fashionable.

  • Production cost in Thailand are much lower than in the west. Crickets are as cheap as $4/kg, given the number of farmers breeding them, while very high costs in the US (up to ten times higher) are slowing down this revolution.

  • Edible insects are gaining popularity, thanks to the work of the pioneers and to positive press coverage. According to a recent US survey, roughly one-third of respondents rate themselves likely to buy an insect-based product.

  • Developing expertise in this field is a savvy investment: the United Nations, the European Union and, a number of large companies are exploring the possibilities of farming edible insects, producing flour from them, and of course creating and producing foods.


    A few words from our team:


    The funding will go towards:

    If target is not reached 
    - funds will be used to cover the costs of making the first batch of pasta, and rewards will be sent to backers. Cricket flour constitutes the highest cost for operations, as cricket flour is about 9 time more expensive than standard rice flour. The manufacturers requires a 250 kgs minimum batch order for production. This is a total of about $2,400, and $350 for the packaging. The rest will be spent on shipping costs to fulfill backer rewards.

    If 100% of funding is fulfilled 
    - 50% will go to pasta manufacturing (this includes the cost of flour and packaging) which will cost $9,500 With full funding fulfillment, we can run a larger batch (and by doing that reducing the costs and optimizing the production).

    - 50% to marketing (consumer online marketing 35% trade/B2B marketing online 15%) TOTAL $9,500 Thanks to part of our team having graphical and web development skills, we have been able to save money in that regard so far. In the future, costs associated with corporate image, website updates, and content marketing in English language will have the funding needs fulfilled partly by this funding campaign. We also plan to have more languages for advertising supported, some Facebook post boosting (paid ads) and a little Google keyword advertising. Part of this is aimed at finding distributors, importers, and other potential partners in some selected countries.



Other company's information:

- we're ready to launch. Corporate brand, marketing strategy, team, business plan: everything is ready. We hope you like our logo, too:



- our team is international. A European, a North-American and Thai members, to start with. This is a solid foundation for an international business. We are also skilled in managing an ecommerce platform and logistics (because of previous work experiences). The online shop is ready to go live as soon as the first production batch is made. 

- we are applying for the Thailand government promotion (aka BOI, Board of Investment), which provides a fast track for start-ups. During preliminary meetings at the BOI we've been told that the project matches the requirements. The company will be registered with this qualification. 

- we recently found a very convenient office perfectly located in downtown Bangkok: come visit us! 

Please feel free to contact us anytime, and to be part of our conversation on social media. 


Below, the amazing Ted Talk video with Pat Crowley, another "entopreneur" - as you may see, we are not alone in developing this new market.



Links: 
- our blog: http://www.bugsolutely.com/blog
- our friend blog 4Ento: http://4ento.com/blog
- are we helping the Thailand farmers? See http://business.inquirer.net/177431/edible-inse...
- what people think of eating insect? 
http://www.tiny-farms.com/blog/a-third-of-us-consumers-likely-to-buy-insect-foods
- pasta is really the world's favorite food? Read the BBC article at
http://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-13760559
