story:
FULL TRANSPARENCY: For a detailed list of our purchases from the campaign, click here:
http://humanistssocietyofkenya.co.ke/


Imagine a place where impressionable schoolchildren are being taught religious dogma as fact in Government-run public schools. A place where non-believing students can be expelled from school because it is seen as the equivalent as "devil worship". A country where Government officials brazenly deny atheists and humanists the right to register their organizations with those words in the title, even though that right has been given to them by the Kenyan Constitution.

My name is Innocent Odeny, the President of the first Humanist Society of Kenya. These are the challenges that face my community every day. Some people laugh and say it is impossible to change things. I know this is incorrect. I know that we can do something about it.

First, we must challenge to the Kenyan Government in Court to allow the Humanist Society of Kenya to be registered, which is something all organized groups must do in order to establish bank accounts and other business services. Your contribution would help us with the legal fees necessary to accomplish this goal.

Second, after our group is officially registered, we intend to change a few things. The primary objective of our group will be to call attention and fight to remove religion from being taught as fact to young children in public (government-run) schools. Schoolchildren at public schools are required to attend several hours of religious instruction each week.

Third, we want to rent a building where our members can meet regularly to conduct meetings and business. We'd like to use any remaining donations to purchase a few pieces of furniture and some basic electronics to support our organization.

Finally, we want to reach out to other atheists, humanists, agnostics, free-thinkers and non-believers that live across our country. The best way to achieve this in my country is via printed materials, broadcast radio and television. We'd also love to obtain a reliable vehicle to travel across Kenya and conduct Humanist services such as weddings and funerals.

As you can see, we have a big (but realistic) vision for the Humanist Society of Kenya. We have the drive and determination to make these things happen. We just need a bit of financial support from you to get things started.

We understand that sending money off to some group in Kenya may seem a bit suspicious. But you have our word that we strive for transparency, and will provide a detailed list of all the items purchased in the description field of our promotional video so you can see exactly where the funds are going.

Thank you for taking to time to learn about our challenges and aspirations!

Please donate now.

Regards,

Mr. Innocent Odeny, President, Humanist Society of Kenya

story:
We are a welfare society (Sri Krishna Mandir Welfare Society) and in our numerous visits to our needy and ageing communities, we were inundated with requests for provisions, namely rice. 

We decided on a campaign to raise funds to purchase rice. Rice that would feed 5,000 needy and elderly people daily. 

Rice being the main form of nutrition for these folks, is consumed as porridge for breakfast, rice(with vegetable +meat) for lunch, dinner being leftover rice. 

Rice is ideal as it is soft and easy to chew and digest.

Our Campaign - to raise funds to purchase 1,000 kilograms of rice that would be distributed to our beneficiaries twice a month for up to six months.

Help us in this campaign to keep our elderly & needy fed, help them retain their dignity so that we save them the need to beg to live.

Help us to help them! God Bless!
story_txt: We are a welfare society (Sri Krishna Mandir Welfare Society) and in our numerous visits to our needy and ageing communities, we were inundated with requests for provisions, namely rice. We decided on a campaign to raise funds to purchase rice. Rice that would feed 5,000 needy and elderly people daily. Rice being the main form of nutrition for these folks, is consumed as porridge for breakfast, rice(with vegetable +meat) for lunch, dinner being leftover rice. Rice is ideal as it is soft and easy to chew and digest.Our Campaign - to raise funds to purchase 1,000 kilograms of rice that would be distributed to our beneficiaries twice a month for up to six months.Help us in this campaign to keep our elderly & needy fed, help them retain their dignity so that we save them the need to beg to live.Help us to help them! God Bless!

story:
About the new solar technology

„IT IS A NEW SOLAR TECHNOLOGY THAT GLOBALLY SOLVES ENERGETICS AND CLEANLINESS OF THE ATMOSPHERE ON THE WHOLE EARTH“ said Mr Jan Sehnoutek, the author and the inventor of the new Solar Technology.

1 / Patent Pub. No.: WO/2012/167759, International Application No..: PCT/CZ2011/000063 solves significantly enhance performance of solar energy, many times. The new system is able to respond to the movement of the sun, the curved surfaces , mobile and scrollable / storable - his performance should be even greater – has to be proven by tests.

2 / The new technology is based on very simple - cheap and available components such as lenses of various shapes and materials, and their supporting structures, whether in the form of foil, mesh or plates or plates of different materials. Also, production is based on the simplest tools and aids. The system can provide electricity and heat for entire cities or neighborhoods, both old buildings and new construction.

3 / When the new system is used across the board, the situation may occur that the clean energy power thus obtained from the sun will replace the thermal power and nuclear power plants (hydroelectric power as well, of course).

4 / The new system can be applied to already implemented solar arrays, which are simply mounted on mobile and static already placed solar panels with minimal technical addition.

5 / The system deals not only with electricity but also with hot water and heating. In combination with photovoltaic solar system leads to the situation that the object becomes a truly independent operating at full capacity and can supply energy and heat as well to objects in their surroundings (also heated in the winter roads and public lighting). The system is suitable for increasing its efficiency, add a suitable storage unit that the current surplus of electricity and heat can preserve for the time when needed - winter climate, large and long clouds, etc.

6 / When using the new system it will save, except the risk of nuclear disasters, vast economic resources.

7 / With undemanding application of the new system is not only getting uncompromising economic savings in the billions of dollars a year, but also create jobs in a huge amount especially for ordinary citizens.

8 / The system makes use for its efficiency solar energy, which is always available, everywhere, for free and in needed quantity. It is ecological and malleable. So there is a new technology that will save humanity not only themselves but also the planet from pollution and ecological self-destruction.

For more information see: http://sunjan.webmium.com


About the author

The whole of my life I have been interested in varies technologies and designs (this year it is my 40th year of my practice). I work alone.

I always design or project products that can help people in their needs or can fulfill their dreams.

I love to start where all others have ended.

And here are some more information about myself:

EDUCATION:
1.    Education in carpentry (3 years)
2.    Secondary Arts and Craft Schools - carpenter, construction of furniture (4 years)
3.    Technical University of Zvolen – Faculty of Wood Sciences and Technology (3 years)

PROFESSION:    
Inventer of solar power system. Designer, Constructer, Architect of interiors, inside lay-outs and selected types of constructions, Builder, Analyst and Developer of new systems, Author of more than 50 patents,  Utility and industry models – patents in Czech Republic and abroad in field of wooden/metal constructions and other technologies in construction field and design, System and Project Manager, Provider of licences on the world basis,

SPECIALIZATION:    
solar power system provider, solution of construct items and design – aimed on interiors, setting-up strategy of sales for specific fields – elimination of commercial effects: financially demanding, fasion, etc.; setting-up an application of new technologies – in field of wooden goods and constructions; new constructions and technologies for long-term usage; productin of system complex – its application with effect on social field and elimination of risk.

Problem with the location, realised projects & the drawer

My problem is that I live in conditions that do not allow me to fully finance my ideas, products which are recognized and valued all over the world. Most of them have been realised (for example: gradual construction of a house for young people, small nursery for small villages, small house for old people from small villages - so that they do not have to move from their villages, universal wooden bookshelf for young people - by this can be furnished the whole flat, etc.

The only thing I want is not to project and design and then put it all into a drawer...

Payment of the development and sim.

I myself pay the development, simple prothotypes and registration and keeping the validity of the patents in my country.

The goal of the new Solar Technology

The goal of the solar patent is for minimal costs increase effect of solar radiation and to provide source of electricity, hot water and heating even for the most poor people anywhere on the world.

Ambitions of the new Solar Technology

My patent has ambitions to put aside even the newest and most advance solar technology into a shadow.

What we need now in steps

Now we need to finance a patent registration in the selected countries such as USA, Europe, Africa, Asia etc. (costs already approx. 80 thousand Pounds). This is the first step.

Another step is to finance production of the new solar panel, which solves photovoltaics, thermics and focal ration at once (production will have been realised by one of good quality university in Czech Republic; costs approx. 135 thousand Pounds).

At the same time a production of other prothotypes into agricultare (gardens´ and fields´warming foils, yearlong greenhouses, etc.), construction field (inteligent plastering, providing of energetically full independent small objects - one nursery has been already builded) can be started. Costs approx. 50 th. till 1 mil. Pounds.


Some more about the author

SOME OF THE SUCCESSES:
1. Author of solar patent No. 302600CZ; system increasing force of photovoltaic and thermic energy – replacement for classic and nuclear power plant – preparation of recognition of possibility of nomination of Nobel Prize – Dr. Luk Robinson as a consultant; BG – one of the biggest worldwide capacities of solar technology
2. Invitation by goverment organisation of Nigeria to apply solar patent for seizure of drinking water in Nigeria country
3. December 2012 – solar patent accredited by Switzerland International Patent Offices as a worldwide unique WO 2012 167759
4. Author of a Project of Sale of furniture in risk-district markets in countries of unstable commercial situation
5. Author of a Project „JANSE house“- global and concrete solution of housing question in selected places of world (natural disasters, social programmes, etc.), ability of creating new agglomerations and renewing village and suburban areas in large scales for an acceptable amount of money (built about 250 family houses, for about 350 mill. CZK), highly avaluated in Geneva Salon of Patents in 1998 – Silver medal
6. Author of world patent registration „Window kit NELA “ - new light system replasing heavy construction parst by a simple construction based on principle of constructive-carpenters goods
7. Shelve wood system „TOM“ - licenced production in Central America
8. Author of project OSN NAPAN – system for usage and reconstruction of roof area on sectional constructions, solving function and urbanistiky
9. Holder of trade-mark JANSE, ProMerit, „Čekves“, etc.
10. Author of international patent application: „Face glazing„
11. Light and variable construction system of wood constraction for gardens „BARA“
12. Goods of my own proposals, produced in amount of 1/2 mld.CZK
13. The best carpenter of the year; my product appeared in few national competitions
14. Author of industrial model of Mansion (French roman style), type project – may alternate castle
15. Author of original castle parquets „Agnes“ (ÚPV 33531)
16. Author of new system of little mansions „NELLY“; new technology, classic crafts (ÚPV34710)
17. Holder of Gold-silver medal for a wooden shelves system „TOM“, international registration, presented in Geneva Salon of Patents in 1993 (one of the most all-purpose wooden shelves systems in the world)
18. Author of a single-room family house „1“, with complete appliences for young people – variable parition walls
19. Author of original little pension for old people (so they don´t have to move to towns)
20. Author of small kindergarten in small villages – being realised
21. Apprised personally by Mr Tomas Bata (Czech well-known enterpreneur – production of shoes) for application of his philosophy into my own enterpreneurship
22. Author supermodern lower-cost system of constructions GERTRUDA, aimed on „zero“ energetic usage of electricity, warm water and heating
23.  Holder of a Silver medal, Geneva Salon of Patents, metal shelves system „PETRA“ (interest of production in Oman)
24. Constructer and Provider of a special construct item, used for increase of sale of hanging goods (marketing Nestlé CZ, in Czech and Slovak market), produced in the content of about 1 mill. USD

SEMINARS AND ARTICLES:
Team Technologie, Project Design Course, Logical Framework Methodology U.S.A., other popular magazines in Czech Republic and Germany

ATTENDANCE IN EXHIBITIONS ABROAD:
1. 21e salon international des inventions GENEVE 93 / Switzerland
2. EXPO CENTRE SHARJAH , FOOD FAIR 94 / U.A.E. (from Europe invited only three subjects: myself and two multinational concerns
3. INTERSHOP OLYMPIA LONDON 95 / Great Britain
4. 26e salon international des inventions GENEVE 98 / Switzerland

story:
Red Leg Brewing Company is a veteran ran and operated organization that is ready to expand! Todd Baldwin ( President/Founder and Army Veteran), made it his personal goal from the start to establish his brewery as a staple within the Colorado Springs community for our local veterans and service men and women, and he is well on his way to accomplishing his goal! 

In the short time since it opened its doors in July of 2013,  RLBC has already become well-known for bringing veterans together and providing them a relaxed atmosphere to interact with their partnered veteran assistance organization such as Mt. Carmel Center of Excellence (Veteran Integration Program), The Home Front Cares, Homes for All Veterans, Crawford House and Team Red White Blue/Rubicon. With some help from you and other supporters, Red Leg Brewing Company will be able to increase its production capabilities and, in turn, continue to increase its capabilities to supports our veterans and troops!

In order to expand, RLBC is in need of a new canning line. Currently, RLBC distributes to 61 different locations around the Colorado Springs area in hopes of expanding that number to 150 all around Souther Colorado by the end of the year! Their current canning line is on its last leg, which not only devastates the potential to increase production capabilities in order to meet demands, but threatens their distribution capabilities all together. This also threatens our community losing a great veteran supporting organization that has made a difference in the lives of many of our service men and women.

Please help Todd and the Red Leg Brewing Company team continue to do great things in our community, and more!

story:
Ramshackle Brewing Company

We are more than being about beer, we are about creating a community.

In 2009, we came across some brewing equipment, and that was the start of more than a hobby, it became a passion. Zack Bigelow started brewing after a few weeks of research to make his first beer. The first beer became a success and attracted attention of some friends. Zack asked his friend, Joe Kesselring, to come out and brew on a Sunday and learn about the brewing process. From that day forward, Zack and Joe have brewed in the back yard of Zack and Jessy's home on every Sunday that weather allowed.

It is hard to accept praise from others. When people began to say,"When are you making the Brown Ale again?", "Can I come get a six pack of that beer you made?", and "What will it take to get you to do this professionally?", we decided it was time that we turn our passionate hobby into a passionate brewery to share with everyone.

Ramshackle Brewing Company will be in Jonesville, MI.  Located directly on US 12, Jonesville is in Hillsdale County; in the center of southern Michigan. The growing community, that recently became a city, is seeking a place to attract locals and tourists alike. With the nearest brewery being a 35 minute drive away, we decided it was time to put our brewery here to give everyone a new reason to enjoy our awesome county. We reached out to the City of Jonesville in 2014, asking if we could build there and they have welcomed us with open arms.

Community is an important part of the brewery world, and what better way to show our appreciation to our community than to open a brewery to provide that great, hoppy, after-work beverage, or the malty sweetness you crave on a Saturday afternoon? We aren't just about the beer, though. We believe that it takes a community to build a successful business and a thriving city. By providing employment opportunities, a community meeting place, and feed for livestock Ramshackle Brewing Company will give back to the county that is helping us out. We plan to promote what we call "Pints for a Purpose" which will help out the non-profit organizations in Hillsdale county. Without the community, Ramshackle wouldn't exists, and we would be one of the few counties without a brewery... something no community wants to see. 

Currently Ramshackle focuses on what are called "Dead Ales"; specializing in the Beir De Garde and the Kentucky Common. These beers have peeked interest in several potential customers in Hillsdale county.  With your help we want to bring these rare and delicious beers back before they go extinct. 

For more information about us follow our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/ramshacklebrewing

The Used Car Salesman Pitch, because we have to. 

For Ramshackle to become the Jonesville's brewery, we need help... from you... our community.

We are asking for $250,000 which will unlock our SBA loan. We are currently approved by the bank to get our loan, but we must reach $250,000 to get the Small Business Association to finalize it. We know that sounds like a whole lot of money, but once our loan is finalized we will be able buy our 5-bbl brew system, purchase our  realestate, and cover all of our construction costs.  The sooner we reach our $250,000 goal, the sooner we can become the brewery you want us to be.

Of course we wouldn't ask you for something without giving you something in return... How in the hell would that be fair?? We will assume you are reading the perks we already have listed... basically you can be as adventurous as you want to be... just need some nice words said about you? Donate a dollar. Need some sweet swag to wear around town? Get a t-shirt. Want to impress all of your friends? Get a painting to hang in your house. Want to have folklore passed down by generations on how sweet Uncle Mike is? Brew your own beer at Ramshackle to serve at your next family reunion. Needless to say, we can go on and on about how awesome you are for giving us a shot at opening your brewery. Yes, yours... didn't you read that paragraph about community?

If we do not reach our goal, which we know you are thinking... how wouldn't they get their goal, they kick ass.... we have to tell you that no matter what, you get your perks... and we might have to change our brewing system to something a little smaller... but you will get your brewery... mark our words.

The Roll of the Dice

We the co-founders of Ramshackle know that Rome wasn't built over night. We have brewed our beers to perfection. We know what we are good at, and that is making great beer. However, we know that just doesn't cut it... we need to assemble a team behind us that will compliment great business. We are currently clients of the Brewers Professional Alliance, located in Grand Rapids Michigan. When we decided that a brewery will be in our future, we knew it will take a lot of hard work. The BPA has helped us learn the business side of the brewery industry. They are helping us create a successful business and giving us the tools to grow. This means that we will spend a little more getting the help we need to build a business, but we will make fewer mistakes and be a stronger business.

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't want to be those guys asking for a hand out... that just isn't the Ramshackle way. We know that help comes in many forms. If you don't have a way to help us monetarily, there are several other ways you can help. Shouting Ramshackle Brewing Company from the roof top, sharing our Facebook page, and sharing our Indiegogo campaign. Got talent? We are always looking for artists to assist with decorating, playing music, or just making noise when it's time to build.
Make sure you tell your mom, dad, uncle, brother, next door neighbor, boss, pet goat, that guy that keeps giving you the stink eye, and everyone else that you think would like a good beer, good company, and a place of community about us!

you? Donate a dollar. Need some sweet swag to wear around  town? Get a 
t-shirt. Want to impress all of your friends? Get a painting to hang in 
your house. Want to have folklore passed down by generations on how 
sweet Uncle Mike is? Brew your own beer at Ramshackle to serve  at your 
next family reunion. Needless to say, we can go on and on about  how 
awesome you are for giving us a shot at opening your brewery. Yes,  
yours... didn't you read that paragraph about community? 
If 
we do not reach our goal, which we know you are thinking... how  
wouldn't they get their goal, they kick ass.... we have to tell you that
 no matter what, you get your perks... and we might have to change our  
brewing system to something a little smaller... but you will get your  
brewery... mark our words. 
The Roll of the Dice
We
 the co-founders of Ramshackle know that Rome wasn't built over  night. 
We have brewed our beers to perfection. We know what we are good  at, 
and that is making great beer. However, we 
know that just doesn't cut  it... we need to assemble a team behind us 
that will compliment great  business. We are currently clients of the 
Brewers Professional  Alliance, located in Grand Rapids Michigan. When 
we decided that a brewery  will be in our future, we knew it will take a
 lot of hard work. The BPA has  helped us learn the business side of the
 brewery industry. They are  helping us create a successful business and
 giving us the tools to grow. This means that we will spend a little 
more getting  the help we need to build a business, but we will make 
fewer mistakes and be a stronger business.
Other Ways You Can Help We don't want to be  those guys asking 
for a hand out... that just isn't the Ramshackle way.  We know that help
 comes in many forms. If you don't have a way to  help us monetarily, 
there are several other ways you can help.  Shouting Ramshackle Brewing 
Company from the roof top, sharing our  Facebook page, and sharing
 our Indiegogo campaign. Got talent? We are  always looking for artists 
to assist with decorating, playing music, or  just making noise when 
it's time to build. 
Make
 sure you tell your  mom, dad, uncle, brother, next door neighbor, boss,
 pet goat, that guy  that keeps giving you the stink eye, and everyone 
else that you think  would like a good beer, good company, and a place 
of community about us!

story:
Last year, four friends devised an adventure to bike from Key West to Tallahassee, Florida in the beginning of May. Within the span of a few months, we were hit by a string of tragedies that gave our adventure purpose. Our friend and motorcyclist Anthony Branca was killed by a distracted driver. Riders With Reason (RWR) videographer Rillan Dasalla was in two accidents with different distracted drivers (and is undergoing physical therapy). RWR member Michael Heron was cycling when he became the victim of a hit and run. We knew there was something to address. We founded Riders with Reason, a nonprofit advocacy group promoting safe and responsible driving by creating an awareness of the dangers of distracted driving.

Establishing RWR was the start of something much larger than a single tour across Florida, and that is why we need your help to reach our fundraising goal. Establishing ourselves as a force and reaching as many people as possible requires resources we do not yet have. This money will goes toward promotion, merchandise, and travel expenses of RWR as an organization, so that we may continue to serve the public. Our tour across Florida is funded out of pocket, with the exception of approximately $250 that will go toward PB&Js between the four of us. To be clear, $5000 is NOT about the Florida cycle tour but about making RWR a successful nonprofit. We have a vision for effective community outreach, and our trip across Florida is only the start.

Taking bicycles a thousand miles across the state of Florida raises eyebrows, and we’re using that to initiate a dialogue with the public about road safety. We’re taking a familiar message- the importance of minimizing deadly road behavior- and embracing it with a new and successful platform. RWR prizes personal human connection, physical action, and real results. We have more cycling tours in our future that will focus on reaching legislation, schools, and communities across the nation. We are confident that this is the way to reach people. We give people something to talk about, four crazy guys on bikes bent on eliminating distracted driving. Our hope is to make a real impact on deadly road behavior and save lives.

We all have a stake in this problem and we are all part of the solution. With your donation we can make safe driving a new priority, invigorate the public, strengthen laws and enforcement efforts, and make our roads safer for everyone.

Join our mission by sharing this page.

Thank you!


~RWR~

story:
We have great cafe in town called Bialystok (White Hill :) in Poland. 

After long time of using off the shelf, standard, mass produced paper cups, we decided to try to create unique, fun, smile placing on people faces, our own cups.
Something cool, so nobody would be ashamed to carry coffee around ;) 

Unfortunately, designing and production of personalised paper cups isn't cheap enough for us to afford it. That's why we are asking you to help us make our town a better place. 

Designs of those cups are already made. And we have competition ongoing at this moment on www.kafejeto.pl and two (or three) of those cups will go into production with your help. We would like to make three sizes of cups with three different designs on them.


We prepared exciting perks to reward you for your help. 

They are going to be realised even if goal will not to be reached. !!!


Best Regards
and thank you for your support

story:
I'm feeling led to do something of true value to celebrate turning 40 this year!! I'm a singer, a songwriter, session vocalist, and vocal coach...currently being pulled in a new direction of ministry. Global Missions. 

On April 19, 2015, I'm traveling to Guatemala with the founder of "Purchase Effect" and a small team from "Ingage Movement". The cause for this particular Mission specifically focuses on underprivileged kids and orphans...those which are not recognized by the Guatemalan government because they legally DON'T EXIST. They weren't born in hospitals and don't have birth certificates. This makes them ineligible for government sanctioned schools, subsequently leaving them embraced by gangs, and at the mercy of the sex-trafficking world. Many of these children are born drug-addicted, and simply left to the streets due to poverty, or the death of their parents.

We will be spending our time there spreading love, assisting teachers in a school for these "forgotten" kids, preparing meals, helping to expose these "street kids" to the school, and more. We hope to help the children see that "the school" is a better way, and that they don't totally have to fend for themselves in the streets. 

The trip cost is $750 plus airfare (which can run up to $500 r/t depending on when booked). The total I am requesting will cover my stay in the hostel for the week, the supplies I'll needs, my meals, airfare, etc. 

Help me start off FABULOUS FORTY,  doing good for those less fortunate than all of us!

story:
The Baby Buddies "All-In-One Diaper" is a new convenient design created in the basement of my home in Alabama. 

Baby Buddies

MY NAME IS DARRYL RICHARDSON and I have created a new complete diaper, This company National Baby Care, Inc and product was started in my home basement. The Baby Buddies "All-In-One Diaper" was an idea that came about with a heavy thought process to make baby care more affordable. We had a baby girl and we were starting our family and the grocery store experience was overwhelming in the baby section. I can recall rolling my cart to the check out counter and spending more money on baby supplies than food. I could not believe how expensive it was.  I knew there has to be others that was experiencing the same shock. The average family spends about $1,500 a year in baby diapering supplies for 1 child, but with Baby Buddies"All-In-One Diaper" you will see a 25 to 45% reduction in that cost. So I set out to think of how I could make baby care more affordable for young parents' like my self. I was blessed with the vision of how to combine 3 proven products in today's market into the "Baby Buddies"All-In-One Diaper" . With the letter from Walmart recommending the diaper to commercialization has help to validate the new diaper design. We are in continual talks with other retailers as we look forward to the panel test results. 

How It Functions + Benefit + How You Can Help

 The All-In-One Diaper will have the following functions: A built in powder dispensing system in the lining to allow powder to be applied at parents discretion. Next it will have a leak proof resealable pouch for 3 hypo-allergenic baby wipes and last but not least an extendable option to the next diaper size. This is giving the parents two disposable diapers in one.The benefits of the design is the convenient's of having all that is needed to care for the child available; no extra bags needed beyond the  purse or jacket pocket and the reduction in cost of not having to buy items separately. After 15 years of working on the design and securing a patent, we're finally ready to put it up on its feet... and so we need YOUR HELP! We need money to help fund 3 panel testing phases that will take place over several months in the following states: Alabama, Georgia and Texas. It's an opportunity to really see how parents' will like the concept in a big way. Your money will go towards: 

  • Prototypes (50,000 per state )
  • Marketing feedback monitoring
  • Web page setup 
  • Short Infomercial
  • Press material (posters, logo design etc.)

Thank you. Thank you. THANK YOU! 

Please know how much this design means to us, we have poured our blood, sweat, and tears into this and can't wait for everyone to experience it with us. We can't thank you enough for choosing to support us as we take the next step in The Baby Buddies" All-In-One Diaper"journey. Every donation - big, small, really big, really small - gets us one step closer to our goal of sharing this product with as many people as we can. 

XOXO

Team Baby Buddies

story:
A program to support, connect and skill community workers in Sri Lanka

NOTE: Venesa is Sinhala for ‘change’. Matram is Tamil for ‘change’.

The Venesa Matram Symposium is a networking, skill-building, cultural exchange and collaboration-supporting event held annually in Sri Lanka for community workers who use arts, cultural and ecological practice as their primary community development tools.

In 2012 Ferment Collaborate delivered the first Venesa Matram Symposium in Hatton, Sri Lanka thanks to the fundraising efforts of people just like you! Now we embark on our third delivery of this important event, creating a space over 7 days for Sri Lankan community workers to network, train, learn and share skills, hosted by the Jayawaboda Kendraya, a cultural and social conscientisation organisation based in Negombo and managed by Ferment Collaborate, a cultural development agency based in Australia.

We’re fundraising for 75 community workers to come together in Negombo, Sri Lanka between the 27th April and 4th May 2015. Help us create a learning, sharing and collaboration building space for community workers from all around the island, representing Sri Lanka’s cultural, geographic, religious, gender, age and creative diversity.



Our fundraising goals

While the Australian team who will be traveling to Sri Lanka for the event are busy fundraising their own travel costs separately, this crowdfunding campaign aims to directly cover 50% of the overall costs of holding the Symposium, and providing free access for up to 75 people to attend the event.

The other 50% is being fundraised through fundraising activities happening in Brisbane and Perth Australia.

Our initial target is to raise $3,000 in funds we will use for:

  • Venue hire $500

  • Accommodation contribution $1,000  

  • Catering contribution $500

  • Transport costs including fuel $300

  • Translators (trilingual) contribution $700

  • TOTAL - $3,000


Our secondary goal is $5,000, with the additional $2,000 raised to be used for:

  • Remaining expenses contributions including Equipment hire ($200), materials including paper and stationary ($400), printing of participant information and resources ($400)

  • A participant handbook including text and photos of those who attended, the Symposium itself and information shared through the workshop program, cultural activities and discussions.

  • Expanding the Cultural Program to include hire of a public bus for all participants to experience important locations around Negombo, while networking with local arts, cultural and community organisations


About the Symposium

Building from 2012

The 2012 Venesa Matram Symposium was a significant event in many ways for Sri Lankan community workers. With over 50 people attending from all areas of the island, the event provided a space for people to not only network and learn about each others work, but also created multiple opportunities for participants to break down misconceptions and stigma barriers that make collaboration and networking difficult in Sri Lanka.

The second Symposium took place in Jaffna in 2014, hosted by Kaveri Kala Manram cultural organisation based in Chulipuram, near Jaffna. Again over 50 community workers and internationals participated in 6 days of sharing practice, culture, professional experiences and personal beliefs toward generating greater collaboration and understanding in the arts, cultural and community sectors in Sri Lanka.

Ferment Collaborate first developed the Symposium concept in 2012 following 18 months of engagement with practitioners from around Sri Lanka throughout 2010 and 2011. A regular event that could encourage active participation, build networks and strengthen local capacity and self confidence emerged as a key to building a stronger cultural development network in Sri Lanka.

The event, now in its third year, brings together community workers from a diverse range of specialisations, including health, education, agriculture, culture, creative arts, economic and community development and more. The Symposium is guided by a 5 year vision which aims to grow the event into an ongoing program and national network of creative community builders who acknowledge culture and place as being foundational to development.  


The program: A blend of Open Space, training and presentations

The Symposium uses a mix of curated programming (keynote and plenary discussions) and Open Space organising. Open Space is an organising tool that prioritises the skills and knowledge of participants as the basis for forming a conference or symposium program. By encouraging participants to engage with what skills, experiences and even questions about their work that they can share, and supporting them to host discussions or presentations by delivering facilitation training, the Symposium becomes a social change space not just in terms of its outcomes, but also through its delivery. Open Space empowers participants to understand the Symposium as a space for both learning and sharing.

The program is delivered to inspire community workers to recognise the value of their own knowledge and skills, while strengthening cross-sectoral networks and breaking down geographic, cultural and religious boundaries that have been reinforced through over 30 years of conflict and over 500 years of colonisation. We aim to create an event structure and space for Sri Lankan community workers to empower themselves and each other by supporting them to share their stories and skills, personal, professional and cultural, toward developing more effective, collaborative and inclusive networks and approaches to community development.

In keeping with this, the event’s program is based upon the use of Open Space Technology, a form of program organising that relies on the participants themselves to prepare and present workshops, discussions and presentations based on their own work or areas of their work they’d like to explore with other participants.

The program will include event production, documentation, workshop facilitation, non-violent communication and cultural development training (Days 1 and 2), the Open Space workshop program (Days 3, 4, 5 and 6), a cultural program (throughout) and a day to draw together outcomes, evaluate the event and strategise ongoing collaborations, projects and the next Symposium (Day 7).



Building a platform for change

The Symposium is a significant opportunity to build stronger community development networks in Sri Lanka and for Australian community workers and the community development sector to contribute skills, experiences and resources to Sri Lankans. One of our major goals in facilitating the Symposium this year is to explore opportunities for networks, collaboration and shared projects beyond the Symposium, not just between Sri Lankan agencies, but also with Australian agencies and practitioners also.

The Symposium itself embodies the type of creative social change processes we support participants to deliver with their communities. We work with participants to create agreement to co-manage the event spaces so they are safe, inclusive, encouraging, collaborative and empowering.


The Young Producers Group

At the 2014 event we partnered with the Centre for Peace Building and Reconciliation (CPBR) who supported members of their Voice of Image (VOI) program for disadvantaged young people to attend . They became our Young Producers Group (YPG) and received dedicated training in event production, multimedia documentation and facilitation support. The group captured all photographs for the 2014 Symposium and a fresh group of young people will again be trained by us to help document and produce this years event.


Cultural exchange

The Symposium also creates space for intercultural exchange, awareness raising and cross cultural collaboration opportunities.

The 2014 event featured a day tour of significant cultural locations around Jaffna, meeting local arts and cultural development practitioners, as well as a special

"koothu" or street theatre performance, sharing of dance and music techniques and discussions between participants who often have not collaborated professionally with community workers from different cultural backgrounds. 


Coordination

Our Symposium Management Committee includes volunteers from Sri Lanka:

  • Roy Rodrigo - Janawaboda Kendraya

  • Trudy Juriansz - Belipola Sustainability Education Center and Ecovillage Network Oceania & Asia (GENOA)

  • Rani Singaraja - Society for Welfare, Educational and Awareness Training (SWEAT) 

As well as volunteers from Australia:

  • Steph Vajda - Ferment Collaborate

  • Kitsiri de Silva - independent community artist

 Roy Rodrigo (left), Rani Singaraja (centre) and Trudy Juriansz (right)

Kitsiri de Silva (left) and Steph Vajda (right)


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on social media, by email, or word of mouth

Suggest other people we should promote the campaign to including people or agencies you feel would be inclined to support our work

Directly approach someone you think might like to know about and support our fundraising

 Roy Rodrigo (left), Rani Singaraja (centre) and Trudy Juriansz (right)

Kitsiri de Silva (left) and Steph Vajda (right)

    Other Ways You Can Help 
Share this campaign on social media, by email, or word of mouth
Suggest other people we should promote the campaign to including people or agencies you feel would be inclined to support our work
Directly approach someone you think might like to know about and support our fundraising

story:
Who we are?
_________________________________________________  

TASAAGA is a local grass roots non-profit organization stationed in Entebbe, Uganda. Since 1995 TASAAGA has been working to improve the lives of disadvantaged youth, refugees and rural communities affected by HIV/AIDS and extreme poverty. Currently we run a school in Sitabaale village for orphans, refugee youth and other children considered vulnerable. TASAAGA also hosts soccer programs annually at Nakivale Refugee Camp for at risk youth, has a medical clinic in remote Ssese Islands and has recently opened up a youth center equipped with computers for training Ugandan's youth. Throughout all of our work, we promote healthy living, individual empowerment, and HIV/AIDS education.

(Me and TASAAGAS director Bruhan)
 

Where we are working?__________________________________________________

We will be working in Nakivale Refugee settlement camp which is the eighth largest refugee settlement in the world and home to nearly 70,000 refugees. Nakivale is Uganda’s oldest and largest refugee settlement. 

Refugee families have been forced to flee violent conflicts and political oppression  in neighboring countries Rwanda, Burundi, Congo, Somalia, Ethiopia and Eritrea and have come to the Nakivale with dreams that they will be resettled or be able to return home in the future. While Nakivale is usually safer than where the refugees are coming from, it is still a hostile place and resources are very scarce. 

(Young Children collecting water from the borehole, Nakivale Refugee Camp)


(Female Youth participating in TASAAGA's 2014 Kick HIV/AIDS soccer tournament in Nakivale Refugee Camp)

What are we doing? 


PROJECT: Refugee Empowerment through Skills Training and Income Generating Activities
___________________________________________________


While here I will be fundraising for and co-coordinating a program that is designed to empower refugee women within the camp. The women will be given opportunities to learn new skills that can be used to generate an income and therefore sustain a healthy livelihood.

Desperation and poverty are stark realities in Nakivale for women. On average a refugee's situation can last up to 17 years and people must constantly devise different strategies to survive. Because majority of the families in the camp are headed by single mothers, it is usually the younger women's responsibility to go out and find food for their families each day. It has been well documented in UNHCR reports that women often have little option but to use their bodies as part of the sex industry to earn an income. Sadly, situations of human trafficking and sexual exploitation are a daily part of refugee women’s life.

This project will empower women by offering options and alternative ways to earn an income. Women will be trained with the vocational skills needed to  make different crafts in the form of beaded purses, bags and leather sandals. Project participants  will then take these items to be sold collectively at regional markets and tourist centres in Western Uganda.  

TASAAGA will build on existing relationships within the camp and collaborate with young women whom participated in TASAAGA's annual KICK HIV/AIDS soccer tournament in 2014/13

In addition, to ensure that the projects works towards reducing hostilities and enhancing unity between the different nationalities living in the camp, TASAAGA will select a mixture of ethnic groups to join the program. 

Once the program is established TASAAGA will look at expanding the skills training to include jewelry, clothing etc

(Leather Sandals the women will be trained to make) 

(Beaded Purse women will also learn how to make)


What We Need?
___________________________________________________

We want to ensure that this program is successful and in order to do that we need your help. We need to raise $2,000 AUD by May 17 2015. Your donations will help us purchase: 
  • Raw training materials to make bags, purses and sandals (Leather, beads, fabric, glue, string, tools etc)
  • 1 x Sewing machine to sew purse and bag linings 
  • 1 x Leather cutting machine for sandals 
  • 1x Trainer (to show women how to make beaded purses and bags)
  • 1 x Trainer (to make leather sandals) 
  • 1 x Business skills consultant to teach the women about negotiating prices and targeting places to sell their finished products

The Impact
___________________________________________________
With your help, refugees at Nakivale will have increased access to vocational, technical and business skills training. This will allow the refugees of Nakivale the opportunity to build their professional skills and ultimately build better lives for their families. It is also much more sustainable means than direct aid.  
Your donation will go directly into expanding, building and developing the implementation of project, Refugee Empowerment through Skills training & Income generating activities.
  Thank you for your donation!

Other Ways You Can Help
___________________________________________________

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help out the cause. We would greatly appreciate it if you could please share this link on your personal Facebook page or any other social media accounts you have. Please help us spread the word and improve our chances of reaching our target goal of $2,000 AUD. 

TASAAGA also has many other on going projects throughout Uganda that you can learn more about. Visit the website http://www.tasaaga.org for more information. Otherwise please send an e-mail with any questions to info@tasaaga.org

story:
Range: help youth find food

and a safe place this summer


Last year we launched Range, a free mobile app that shows where free meals are served to youth during the summer. We built it for trusted adults who work with youth--librarians, camp counselors, street outreach workers, church group leaders-- to refer families to free meal sites in communities nationwide. Last summer Range showed 42,000 meal sites across the US.

This year, we want to add safe places to Range, starting with the 17,000 libraries located around the country.

This campaign will help us do the work of adding libraries to Range.


Why add libraries to Range?

The stories last fall in Ferguson, MO and coming out of Baltimore, MD as we prepare this campaign are evidence that libraries are vital community institutions, providing a safe place when other spaces may not be accessible. 

Libraries keep their doors open when a community is in crisis, after a disaster, and during an ordinary August day when there aren't a lot of adult-supervised free places to spend time.

Libraries offer a space anyone can enter, where money isn't exchanged, and documentation doesn't have to be shown. Free access to resources, knowledge, and solace is an everyday occurrence.

The value of these places for youth cannot be underestimated.

What does my contribution support?

Your tax-deductible donation supports adding the names, address and the hours of operation of all libraries to Range. The Institute of Museum and Library Services publishes an open data catalog which is the source we'll use for the names and the addresses of the nation's libraries. However, there isn't a listing of the days and hours of operation for all libraries in the US. We are going to track down the hours of operation for all 17,000 libraries and make that information available -- in Range and for other developers who may want to use it.

Who are we?

We are the team at Caravan Studios, a division of TechSoup Global. We're a 501(c)(3) nonprofit located in San Francisco, CA. We've been helping nonprofits with their technology for more than 25 years.

We care about issues like childhood hunger, domestic violence, human trafficking, and rescue and relief efforts. We work closely with experts in those fields to create apps useful to them.  And, we hope, the technology makes the world a little better.

Where do we get our funding?

TechSoup Global is a social enterprise.  We help large corporations donate their technology to nonprofits around the world.  We manage services, like NGOsource, that build on the deep experience we have in finding nonprofits and getting them vital resources.

At Caravan Studios, we've received grants from Microsoft Citizenship, Vodafone Americas Foundation, Humanity United, Blue Shield of California Foundation and Full Circle Fund.

Corporations like Microsoft, Socrata, Twilio and SendGrid have also made their technology available to use for use in this effort.

story:
Kate's 50th Birthday

 I want to give back to my community as I celebrate this big mid-life marker. As I was considering what to fund raise for, I read an article about how difficult it is each month for homeless women to have their menstrual cycle. This prompted me to start this birthday fundraising campaign.  As I (hopefully) say goodbye to my period, my goal is to raise 50,000 tampons or pads for homeless women.  I estimate it will take about $5000 to reach my 50,000 goal.  

I've tried to make donating as easy as possible.   There is an Amazon wish list here.  The items you buy from the wish list can be sent directly to YouthCare.  You can make financial donations here or directly to YouthCare or Mary's Place.  Please let me know if you donate to either organization!

Another option is to buy feminine hygiene products at your favorite store and I'll happily pick them up and deliver them to Mary's Place or YouthCare.

Be sure to like my Facebook Page!

Together, we can do this!

story:
Short Summary

No one has come: Nepal villagers wait for aid to flow beyond the capital. But with Gatlang Village, Rasuwa District no one CAN come. 

The huge landslides in various places from Kalikasthan till Dhunche has blocked the roads completely. We tried to send the basic requirements through four wheelers and two wheelers but our attempt failed as there is no way to get to even Dhunche, let Gatlang be away. 

Gatlang is almost last village of Nepal in Northern Nepal. We need to send tents, medicines, basic food and water supplies to Gatlang. 

This is a place of humble people and with the government aid taking time to reach out, we are attempting to take things in our hand to the best and possible extent. 

We know nothing, and nobody knows about us expect the few tourists and travelers as Gatlang Village remained a most visited spot by tourists for it's ethnic touch and architectural look saved over hundreds of years. 

Homeless urgently need tents; death toll above 6,200 all over and 304 numbering from Rasuwa. There are 748 injured seeking immediate care. [drrportal.gov.np] 

Gatlang is highly affected. All the houses here are made of stones with wooded roof. All the infrastructures are terribly demolished. They need us. 

What We Need 

We will be providing the basic food, tents, blankets, clothes, medicines and doctors to the location, all by helicopter as roads are blocked. Many other organizations and volunteers have been trying to reach out to Gatlang, but because of the remoteness and the landslides, they are not being able to reach out, so we are taking this initiative to reach them through air.

The Impact

More than 6000 people will be benefiting with the basics and medicines. There are many kids and elders seeking immediate care. We intend to supply the basic care. 

Risks & Challenges

The roads are blocked and with the landslides at various locations until Dhunche, Gatlang is way impossible to reach out neither via four wheeler nor two wheeler. 

The remoteness of the location is also affecting the number of health workers to serve the injured locals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to support our campaign by donating us other than money, then you can contact +9779841077291/+9779851137763 to donate blankets, tents, food supplies, and medicines. 

Where is Gatlang Village?

Gatlang is a village development committee in Rasuwa District in the Bagmati Zone of northern Nepal. At the time of the 1991 Nepal census it had a population of 1533 people living in 328 individual households.

Who are We?

We are Nepal Family Development Foundation, an NGO dedicated to serve, develop and conduct the programs of community with their participation and responsibility including the concerned state and non-state at all level in the field of health, education, livelihood and humanitarian works.

story:
YouBDay.com

Every year around your birthday you are flooded with advertisements and discounts and you find yourself not knowing, where to go, where to be and, what to eat for this special day.

For these reasons we created YouBDay, an app that will send you reminders, recommendations once a year, just for you on your special day.

It is free, the only requirement is to have a birthday, subscribe today  at youbday.com. We promise to only send you suggestions and information on your birthday. We are waiting for you.

If you own a restaurant, bar, boutique or any retail store and you want to promote it with your costumers on their birthdays, you can choose one of our plans. be a Backer.

How it works?

More info?


Advertisements just in your birthday!


Support Us!

WWW.YOUBDAY.COM

story:
Hello all,

        my name is Kandice and I reside in Central Texas. Growing up I have always been hands on, and productive making objects and crafts come to life! I watched my dad as he handled three businesses he owned and operated on his own with a handful of loyal workers. It has inspired me, and I plan to make him very proud. An adult now, I have accomplished self-publishing a children's book, by the name of The Gumdrop Fairies (available on Amazon.com), and I am now an alumni of the University of Phoenix with my Associate of Arts degree in Business Foundations. Obtaining the degree is only more motivation to pursue my dream of owning my own business(es).

     Kandi Kreationz is currently an online business for local prospects. I currently provide services for special events, including but not limited to: birthdays, graduations, banquets, baby showers, etc. After the completion of my business degree program and the overall vision of my business plan, it is time for my business to expand into a walk-in event center.

   The vision is to open a facility that is pre-setup to the customers choosing with whichever theme is available. The Kostumed Kharacter would be there to match and have a photo session with the party goers. The main activities would be the ball pit and jump house, with a side activity of face painting before/after the photo session. Music would be allowed as long as there is no profanity or explicit language. Outside approved food is allowed. (i.e. veggie trays, sandwich trays, pizza)

Check the FAQs for more Q&A!

The plan is to bring something new and exciting to the city. Yearly events for kids' birthdays, banquets for athletes, etc. with an annual FREE event for the entire community.

What We Need 

Use of Goal Amount:

  • First 3 Months
  • Purchase of 5 more costumes
  • Purchase of Ball Pit accessories
  • Purchase of some inventory including: tables, chairs, party accessories

What You Get

  1. Parents will not have to rush for last minute items when throwing a party at Kandi Kreationz Eventz
  2. The complete set-up of party utensils, balloons, entertainment, and music will all be ready when booking an event with Kandi Kreationz Eventz
  3. A SMILE & HUG :) from your child(ren)

The Impact

This would be a great business to bring to the area kids and parents would love it! It would also bring more jobs to some who may be having trouble finding it, which would take the unemployment rate down.

It would also help a young aspiring and ambitious entrepreneur reach her goal!

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • If goal is not met through Indiegogo I will continue to save and raise funds through my online business. Either way Kandi Kreationz Eventz will come alive. :)
  • Some consumers may not agree with rules and guidelines, these can be changed and updated by customer feedback. The goal is to meet 100% customer satisfaction.
  • The first 3 months are always critical in business. If/When business becomes tough a different approach will be made, whether it be advertising or anything business savvy to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you're unable to contribute that is certainly fine! However, there are other ways to help out make this happen!

  • Word of Mouth
  • Share on any social site! i.e. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

story:
Short Summary

Jana Banker was a professional model from the age of 18 walking the runways in Europe and Asia and was signed with Ford Models and Elite Model Management upon her arrival in LA.

Jenny Benedicto’s creativity comes from an immensely cultured upbringing in NYC, and facing any challenge head on, her unique combination as a producer and cinematographer has her highly sought out in the independent film world. 

As regular working professionals in the industry, we know all the challenges a production can face.  We want to provide studio space for any sized budget while keeping the same quality of those other high end studios.  It’s hard enough to break into the entertainment industry, and even harder to stay afloat.  We want to be able to share the wealth of knowledge we have learned with our peers and colleagues.  We both know the importance of having a home base that we can go to regularly, where our creativity is nurtured and encouraged.  We aim to become a one-stop-shop where you can find crew, special talent, or even equipment to give your production that special something to get completed.

Successfully funding this campaign will make our dreams a reality of opening up a studio where we can hold photo shoots, film shoots and professional audio sessions simultaneously.

Your donations will help us secure a building location and the few renovations needed to make sure our studios are “camera ready” when the doors open.


What We Need & What You Get

So we collected all the couch change we could and even emptied our piggy banks, and found ourselves to be a little short.

We are looking to raise $75,000.00.  A majority of this money will go to securing a location in West LA, located blocks from the 405 freeway with shops and restaurants all within walking distance.  

The rest of the funds will go to renovations within the building.

We plan to have exposed ceilings with a lighting grid so a production can have the option to light it themselves or use what we have pre-lit.

The front room of the building we are looking at is large enough to divide into 6 separate photo studios, which we plan to do with mobile “walls”  This allows you to customize and combine the studios to make one larger studio to fit your shoot.

The sound-proof audio booth fits perfectly in the back corner of the photo studios, but it will need to be built.

The extremely quiet back room is where our sound stage will be located.  With it’s own separate entrance a production can pull their grip truck into our parking lot and unload equipment straight into the stage. 

We have already begun to see the support and belief in our campaign through our wonderful perk donors.  Take a look at the full list, it’s a long one!  We have various industry services offered as well as original artwork from 2 LA Based Artists.  Even if we don’t reach our goal, any money raised in this campaign will still go to opening up JB Studios.  


The Impact

Jenny and I both come from big families which molded us into the mindset early on to share and help the younger ones.  Everyday a new person arrives in Los Angeles seeking the fame and fortune, leaving a life behind in a small town.  Most come here with the wrong mindset, thinking they just need an agent and once they get one they are set.  Very few realize the actual work it takes to make a career in the entertainment business.  That's where we step in.  Jana runs KMT Models which gives new faces the opportunity to work with established professional photographers, makeup artists, and stylists all while networking and gaining the right tools to start their career.  Jenny is behind the scenes helping with budgets, script writing. cinematography and post production.  We are coming into a time in this industry where you have to take matters into your own hands with all the web series, selfies, vine videos, followers, likes, etc....We want to keep our craft alive and give the true creators a home to grow and learn. 



Risks & Challenges

Starting a small business is hard, especially when you’re offering services rather than a tangible product.  We know that there are other photo studios and sound stages out there, but none offering the services and options we will have in that area.  We also aren’t opening up just another photo/film studio.  Our main challenges will be getting the word out to everyone that we have joined the game and are ready for business.  Good marketing is also important to show people that they should give us a chance as a studio space.  As mentioned before, we want to create a community of artists to come and use our space to see their visions come to life.  We are confident that once you shoot your production at our studios, you’ll keep coming back to shoot others, or even when you’re not on a shoot.  Our plans to be active and give back to the community will raise awareness of the importance of supporting the arts and spotlight Sawtelle-Japantown as the hidden gem it is.  As two independent and strong women, we accept any and all challenges that are to come, and know we will get to our goals with the incredible support of our friends.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone who visits our campaign will be able to contribute monetarily, and it’s ok, we totally understand. There are other ways you can help though.  Word of mouth is a lot more effective than you think, so if you could share this with your friends, family, and even that guy sitting next to you writing his screenplay (it’s ok, he needs the break from his writer’s block anyway) we would greatly appreciate it.  We also know that you have internet access, since you’ve made it to our page, so go ahead and post this on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook! Indiegogo even has a handy-dandy "SHARE" button if you are a rebel and don't have any social media handles.

story:
Hi everyone,


My name is Marie, I am a young 23 years old woman and this summer, I will dedicate my energy and sweat to bike from Portland (Oregon) to Bellingham (Washington) to collect money and bring greater awareness to the Affordable Housing cause with the non-profit organization Bike & Build. 

All along the 1000 miles journey, I will switch my bike for a hammer and help build houses in 5 cities for organizations such as Habitat for Humanity and Rebuilding Together.

But to achieve this goal and start biking with the group, I have to raise 2000 dollars before July 15. Half of this money will be distributed to several non-profit organizations fighting against affordable housing inequalities throughout the U.S. Those organizations apply to Bike & Build through a grant process, and the projects which are most in need will be selected to receive the funds.

The other half will help the group of bikers organize five Affordable Housing building sites in five cities on the Pacific Coast: Aberdeen (WA), Neah Bay (WA), Bremerton (WA), Seattle (WA), San Juan Island (WA). The money will be used to buy the tools and equipment the team will need to build the Affordable Houses. 

Every year, thanks to the generosity of millions of donors, Bike & Build positively impact the Affordable Housing cause in hundreds of American communities. Since the founding of Bike & Build in 2003, 2600 young adults have pedaled 8.5 million miles, donated over $5.1 million to affordable housing organizations across the United States, and volunteered 185,000 build hours.

I am very excited to be part of this great challenge and I am sure you don't want to miss the chance to support this adventure! Don't wait, click on a perk!

To know more about Bike & Build and the cause we are riding for, visit this page! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mmSN7J38Xg#t=145

If you can't donate, no biggie, spread the word, make noise about my project and use the Indiegogo share tool :)

story:
Short Summary

We are Maya & Odalys, who share a passion for healing. Since meeting each other 6 years ago, we have dreamed of creating a healing, arts, and research space. Our mission is to create a space to share our therapies of Sound & Touch that integrate the power of music and the healing compassion of human touch. We also invite the community of natural healers to join us!

We each have a long history of studying and practicing the art of healing in our individual frameworks- music & bodywork. 

Odalys Villanueva, from Puerto Rico, has a BA in Psychology  and is a NY licensed massage therapist who has created an eclectic approach to body work which fuses eastern and western techniques of massage with her studies of nature-science, angel work, tarot/oracle readings and chakra frequency balancing. 

Maya Martinez, from Colombia, is a music therapist, who has dedicated her entire life to various studies of music such as performance (former Pacha Massive and Nacional Records Artist), production, therapy and currently is researching vibrational systems of wellbeing. She is currently furthering her studies in sound therapy, vibro-acoustic music therapy, and pursuing an internship in the music therapy department of a psychiatric facility. 

We recently found a space in Crown Heights Brooklyn, New York, that would be ideal for our therapeutic practices and for furthering our exploration of healing and the arts. Your involvement will help us to develop and equip the space as well as contribute to helping others in their individual paths through our therapies. We feel a need to create a space of well being where we can come together and create endless possibilities of healing, creating and exploring our communities and the force of togetherness. 

Our main goal is to research and develop a cutting-edge systematic method of sound and body therapy to help heal and balance clients of all different walks of life. We will be developing Sound & Body healing therapies and ceremonies to expose the body and soul to both sound and touch. 

Our mission is to guide others to engage with their own bliss. This will be developed by creating a multidisciplinary therapy which will work through the individual Chakras. This work will integrate: music and sound therapy/frequency resonating (massage table with integrated sound), chakra balancing, sacred geometry, angel work, oracle readings, shiatsu, polarity/four elements therapy, art, and simple touch tissue manipulation. 

Together, we dream of having a space to offer the community the opportunity to explore our therapies and the healing properties of sound and touch. We also hope to provide this space for the collective to host healing and well-being activities and for other healers to join us and bring their work. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 13,000 dollars to complete our workspace.  

Our list of priorities includes:

-Liquidating the space loan: (Offered by an investor). We have already paid 3/4 of our initial loan, just 1/4 away!!!

-Website: 

-Purchesing a sound & body massage table

-Creating a sound proof enclosed space

-Additional equipment for sound therapy & bodywork

-Art & healing supplies

-We will also work to create a space as beautiful, complete and harmonious as possible by investing in all amenities needed to do so such as: mural, plants, lighting, healing décor for indoor & outdoor spaces.

If we surpass our goal, we will utilize the funds to purse educational courses in Sound Therapy and Angelical Reiki.

In return for your support you will get to experience our work in action and   contribute not only to the development of cutting edge therapy research but also will be a part of a community healing process. 

The Impact

In this moment of Planetary change, it is crucial that each individual contribute their unique attributes to the world. In order for there to be balance in society we must all take responsibility to find balance in ourselves, to activate our bodies and explore the vibrations that creates our existence. This process can be facilitated by finding tools and inspiration through others. Our goal is to provide individuals with a variety of tools to do so. In this way each individual can find a place to cocreate their ideal reality, where you can find who you truly are at your fullest potential. In this way we all come together, to heal, integrate and contribute to the process of connecting with the home that we all share, Planet Earth. 

We as individuals can cocreate a sustainable abundance and peaceful world!

We invite you to be part of this endeavor. Help us meet our goal. We believe there's no better time to start a Natural Healing Collective where we can all meet for the purpose of healing. We need you, we need each other and The Planet need us!

Risks & Challenges

 It may be a challenge to grow a significant amount of users to maintain the space with the necessary needed flow.  

  • Having appropriate multi-platforms (website, word of mouth, press, collaborations and exchanges with local business) that can educate the public of our research and work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but you can help us by:

  • Spreading the word through Facebook, Indiegogo or your preferred social media tool to make some noise about our campaingn. 
  • Provide the service that you specialize in to help make it all work!! 
  • Your creative service of: Painting, Murals, Design, Restaurant Vouchers...etc Anything that can help inspire the Dream!!!

story:
Why Lyle Lovett Is Supporting MD Anderson


"My dad, William Pearce Lovett, was treated by Dr. Christopher Logothetis at MD Anderson in the late ’90s, so I have a deep personal respect and admiration for what MD Anderson does.  It’s incredible to see how devoted people are to MD Anderson and how much they care about one another. That’s essentially what it boils down to–people showing they love one another by supporting MD Anderson."–Lyle Lovett

 

(For more on Lyle Lovett, and to watch him perform to support MD Anderson, go to esquire.com.)


What is MD Anderson?

The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center is one of the world’s most respected centers devoted exclusively to cancer patient care, research, education and prevention. The cancer center is located in central Houston in the Texas Medical Center.

Created in 1941, MD Anderson is one of the nation’s original three comprehensive cancer centers designated by the National Cancer Act of 1971. It’s one of 68 National Cancer Institute-designated comprehensive cancer centers today.

U.S. News & World Report’s “Best Hospitals” survey has ranked MD Anderson the nation’s leading cancer care hospital for 10 of the past 13 years. The institution has been named one of the nation’s top two cancer centers every year since the survey began in 1990.


What They're Doing

By 2030, annual cancer deaths are projected to rise to 13 million worldwide. That’s up from 8.2 million in 2012. Now is the time to make rapid and substantial progress against this terrible disease. 

MD Anderson’s Moon Shots Program is an unprecedented, comprehensive assault to significantly reduce deaths from cancer. It was inspired by America’s drive to place a man on the moon a generation ago. MD Anderson’s program comprises six teams of researchers and clinicians who are initially focused on eight cancers:

•Acute myeloid leukemia/myelodysplastic syndromes

•Chronic lymphocytic leukemia

•Melanoma

•Lung cancer

•Prostate cancer

•Triple-negative breast (TNBC) and high-grade serous ovarian cancers

Each moon shot team is pursuing innovative projects prioritized for greatest patient impact. Specialized platforms provide infrastructure, systems and expertise for the moon shots. The ultimate goal is to apply knowledge gained from this process to all cancers.


Where Your Donation Goes

No one is immune to cancer. Everyone is at risk of facing some form of the disease in their lifetime. In the U.S., men have a 1-in-2 chance of developing cancer. For women, the odds are 1 in 3.

Your gift to MD Anderson will help make a tremendous difference in the lives of cancer patients now; including the more than 120,000 patients seen each year, as well as in the lives of those who will be spared from cancer through breakthroughs in cancer prevention and early detection. 

The Moon Shots Program is MD Anderson’s largest and most aggressive cancer fighting effort to date. Past efforts have helped inform new legislation that bans youth access to tanning beds–a major boon to melanoma prevention. MD Anderson also launched a first-of-its-kind clinical trial ultimately aimed at making early detection of lung cancer a reliable, widespread reality. 

Much more can be done. But MD Anderson needs your support.

The end of cancer is in sight. Join MD Anderson’s mission of Making Cancer History®.
