story:
Why now?

As we enter the month of Elul (אלול), we are reminded of the month’s famous pneumonic: אני לדודי ודודי לי (I am for friend and my friend is for me). But what exactly is it about the month of Elul that evokes such a feeling of companionship? The month of Elul is a time of Teshuva, of returning a path of righteousness and a life of virtue. Our sages wisely stress the importance of introspection as well as the necessity for continual engagement with those around us. Adding this extra element allows for people to be able to look past themselves and consider the greater good in the world. As Elul enters, it is thus our responsibility take on such a model, in which we not only correct for our own personal misdemeanors, but also look towards the other, to our דודי, and make sure we are creating a consciousness of אני לדודי ודודי לי  .

Maaser

Deeply related to the awareness of the other and a consciousness of companionship is the Torah’s idea of maaser. Maaser, giving one tenth of one's income to the poor, the Levi, and Jerusalem, creates a community in which everyone is collectively thinking about each other’s well-being and needs.

The #ipledgechb Campaign

With this in mind, the CHB Students would like to present  the #ipledgechb campaign, in which each student is given the opportunity to help create the beautiful community desired by the Torah by giving back in whatever way possible. We would like to run our first ever campaign that is entirely by the students and for the students. But what exactly does that mean?

In the past, every time we students have been asked to be part of a charity fundraiser or attend a charity event, we turn to others for help. However, many students have expressed how they do not feel comfortable asking others to give charity on their behalf.  

Not this time! This time, students have earned their own money from working hard over the summer and now have the privileged opportunity to give back to the CHB community with their proud work.

Every dollar given to CHB will be matched up to $50k, giving this campaign tremendous potential. Every dollar you, the student, gives will be doubled! Furthermore, there will be prizes for certain levels of money given. Starting from CHB swag all the way up to a special meal cooked by our very own and loved, Chef Jazzy.

Spread The Word

Please spread the word to friends, even those who attended a night activity or a Shabbos meal just one time. This is a great opportunity for both frequent and non-frequent Chabad goers to give back for all that Chabad has done for them.

So, what are you waiting for? Take the pledge!  

Share the campaign with your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter! Don't forget to #ipledgechb http://igg.me/at/ipledgechb
story_txt: Why now?As we enter the month of Elul (אלול), we are reminded of the month’s famous pneumonic: אני לדודי ודודי לי (I am for friend and my friend is for me). But what exactly is it about the month of Elul that evokes such a feeling of companionship? The month of Elul is a time of Teshuva, of returning a path of righteousness and a life of virtue. Our sages wisely stress the importance of introspection as well as the necessity for continual engagement with those around us. Adding this extra element allows for people to be able to look past themselves and consider the greater good in the world. As Elul enters, it is thus our responsibility take on such a model, in which we not only correct for our own personal misdemeanors, but also look towards the other, to our דודי, and make sure we are creating a consciousness of אני לדודי ודודי לי  .MaaserDeeply related to the awareness of the other and a consciousness of companionship is the Torah’s idea of maaser. Maaser, giving one tenth of one's income to the poor, the Levi, and Jerusalem, creates a community in which everyone is collectively thinking about each other’s well-being and needs. The #ipledgechb CampaignWith this in mind, the CHB Students would like to present  the #ipledgechb campaign, in which each student is given the opportunity to help create the beautiful community desired by the Torah by giving back in whatever way possible. We would like to run our first ever campaign that is entirely by the students and for the students. But what exactly does that mean?In the past, every time we students have been asked to be part of a charity fundraiser or attend a charity event, we turn to others for help. However, many students have expressed how they do not feel comfortable asking others to give charity on their behalf.  Not this time! This time, students have earned their own money from working hard over the summer and now have the privileged opportunity to give back to the CHB community with their proud work. Every dollar given to CHB will be matched up to $50k, giving this campaign tremendous potential. Every dollar you, the student, gives will be doubled! Furthermore, there will be prizes for certain levels of money given. Starting from CHB swag all the way up to a special meal cooked by our very own and loved, Chef Jazzy.Spread The WordPlease spread the word to friends, even those who attended a night activity or a Shabbos meal just one time. This is a great opportunity for both frequent and non-frequent Chabad goers to give back for all that Chabad has done for them.So, what are you waiting for? Take the pledge!  Share the campaign with your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter! Don't forget to #ipledgechb http://igg.me/at/ipledgechb

story:
Click on the image of the logo at the top of the page to watch our video.

The intention behind this wellness center is to remove the barrier between people that need treatment and their ability to afford it.  Source Empowered Wellness will offer quality acupuncture in a community setting to lower the cost of treatment.  We will proudly provide the community with:

  • $30 Community Acupuncture
  • $30 Chiropractic Adjustments
  • Facial Rejuvenation
  • Handcrafted Herbal Elixirs and Sodas
  • A variety of workshops and events
  • Massage
  • Retreats

The center is located at 4666 Cass Street, Pacific Beach; it is currently being remodeled and will be ready soon! We are actively cultivating a warm, inviting ambiance that makes you feel at home and relaxed.  Our knowledgeable, experienced therapists will explain treatments and guide you into a vital state of health.  Join our wellness community and benefit from these greatly discounted offerings, only available through this campaign! All contributions are helpful.  


What's the Money for?

All funds raised will be used for improvements at the Wellness Center.  Here are things you can expect based on how much we raise. 

  • $7,000 - Funds the remodel costs that include flooring, painting, demo-work and construction as well as marketing costs for print and web.  A full herbal elixir and soda bar is added!
  • $10,000 - The main treatment room has deluxe treatment chairs, dimmable lighting, and a sound system for healing ambient music.
  • $15,000 - We offer sound healing ceremonies with crystal bowls, drums, tuning forks, and other instruments.  Artistic enhancements such as paintings are added.  Padded cushions, chairs, and presentation materials are available for our workshops.
  • $20,000 - We kick off a community outreach program that includes a party at the center with local musicians, performing artists, and free herbal drinks.

For those of you who live out of town and  would like to gift your perk to someone, please email us at info@sourceempoweredwellness.com with the recipient's name and email address.  We would also like to offer the option to share your perk package.  If you are sharing the perk, we only ask that you come together to the center with your printed receipt when you are ready to redeem your perk.  Open date is projected for mid-September and we'll update you again throughout all the fun progress.

Who is The Founder?

Simone Ressner is a certified acupuncturist, graduate of Pacific College of Oriental Medicine currently pursuing her doctorate.  She skillfully incorporates acupuncture, herbal medicine, and massage. Testimonials from some of her patients can be read on Yelp. She has effectively treated over a thousand people for intestinal conditions, emotional trauma, addictions, facial rejuvenation, reproductive issues, musculo-skeletal dysfunction, and pain. Simone also has experience treating patients facing issues as serious as Cancer and HIV. Now Simone is starting a wellness center to create a community source for holistic healing and to aid people on their path to establishing health as a lifestyle. 


How Can I Help?

  • Contribute! Check out our awesome perk rewards to the right, there are some great deals, many won't be available again.
  • Spread the word. Share this campaign on social media. 
  • To share, sign-in to your Indiegogo account and click the buttons next to the video at the top of the page. That way when a person contributes we'll know you referred them.  The person who refers the most contributors will get 5 free acupuncture sessions!

story:
Now in its 32nd year, Leap’s Sandcastle Contest is the largest sand sculpture contest in Northern California. Every year Leap orchestrates this spectacular competition as its major fundraising event, helping to ensure that the organization can continue to keep the arts alive in Bay Area schools. As part of the event, Leap organizes one Community Sandcastle to be built on the spot by spectators and attendees of the competition. This gives a hands-on opportunity for spectators to participate in the building of a sand sculpture, making them an integral part of a unique art event.

In order to keep the Community Sandcastle tradition alive, we need your support!

In a Sandcastle Galaxy Far, Far Away: A Community Collaboration

On October 10, 2015 Leap’s 32nd annual contest will spring to life at San Francisco's Ocean Beach. This year’s theme is “Sand Cinema,” and the Community Castle is taking on a classic: Star Wars. The public will be invited to create a life-sized Jabba the Hutt, using nothing but sand and water.

While the other sites are sponsored by local architecture, design, and building firms and built in collaboration with San Francisco elementary school students, the Community Sandcastle site depends upon a team of strangers who are brought together to create a sand masterpiece in the span of only four hours. Led by a team of volunteers who will guide the design and creation of the sand sculpture, Spectators and attendees are invited to take a hands-on role in the construction of the Community Sandcastle, requiring creativity and collaboration. 

Participation in building the Community Castle is free to the community, with no one turned away for lack of funds. All are invited – kids and adults of all abilities will work together to complete the sculpture. In 2014, over 50 participants helped to build the Community Sandcastle.

Donation Details

This year Building Robotics has generously agreed to sponsor the Community Castle and will match any donations made though Indiegogo, up to $4,000. That means any donation you make will have twice the impact!

Donations to this Indiegogo campaign and all matching funds from Building Robotics will go to support Leap’s arts education programs, benefiting thousands of Bay Area students each year. The first $1000 raised will be allocated towards funding the Community Castle including payment for shovels, buckets, water sprayers, canopy rentals, and chairs. 

Donors to the Indiegogo campaign will have the opportunity to be the first in line to help build the Community Castle at our event!


About the Sandcastle Contest

Leap's Sandcastle Contest began in 1983 and quickly became hugely popular. While the first 15 competitions were held at Aquatic Park in San Francisco, over the years the Sandcastle Contest became so large that it was moved to the more expansive Ocean Beach. Each year, thousands of spectators enjoy this unique competition featuring 30 one-of-a-kind creations built in 400sq/ft plots along the beach. Teams and sponsors involved in Leap's 2014 Sandcastle Contest raised over $262,000! These funds make it possible for Leap to serve approximately 7,000 students in over 25 schools across the Bay Area with hands-on learning experiences in the arts. 

Leap hosts this spirited competition between teams of architects, designers, contractors, corporations, engineers and local elementary school students each October on Ocean Beach. Before the event, teams meet with students in the classroom to develop ideas, shape clay models, and assign tasks, all in preparation for the big day. During the competition the teams and students have just four hours to create their castles, using nothing but sand and water, transforming the beach into a land of magical creatures and fantastical structures. The teamwork involved provides an intense learning experience for both the students and the many sponsors who participate. Through this event, Leap provides a unique opportunity to create a collaborative artwork to those who otherwise would not have access. 

The event is free to the public and easily accessible. The contest will take place on October 10 between 10:30 am and 4:30 pm. The public is welcomed to the beach throughout the day. At the completion of the event the sand sculptures are returned to their natural state when the tides return the sand to the landscape.


Support Leap, Support Arts Education

Leap envisions a world where art is a fundamental part of every child’s education and success. Leap provides quality arts education programs that help students build skills to reach their fullest potential.

Most public schools lack the resources to provide their students with a high quality education that includes the arts. Inadequate funding, pressure to improve academic test scores, lack of instructional time, lack of arts expertise, and shortages of materials are common but significant barriers to arts education. When school budgets are cut, the arts are often the first item on the chopping block. Leap exists for a simple reason: children need art. Studies show that students who are engaged in the arts are more likely to succeed academically, to stay in school, and to engage in their community.

Leap targets under-resourced Bay Area elementary schools, helping to reduce the achievement gap in these schools by providing equitable access to multidisciplinary arts education. Often, children’s experience with Leap is the only exposure to the arts they will have during the entire school year. Leap gives children the learning experience that they need and deserve in order to thrive. Each program helps them discover their creativity and build critical thinking, problem solving, and social skills which will help them to reach success in school, work, and life.

story:
Short Summary

  • The Earthquake of 2010, a catastrophic event in Haiti, ripped through Port-Au-Prince destroying homes, families, businesses, infrastructure, etc. Even now, 5 years later, Port-Au-Prince is still rebuilding. 


    • Rather than simply donating food, money  or used clothes to the victims, Indigo comitted to create jobs for Haitians who can earn wages, take care of their families and have the opportunity to live a dignified life.

    We strongly believe in the old adage:

    "Feed a man  a fish, he will eat for a day. TEACH him to fish and he will eat for a lifetime.  " 

    • While many NGO's do great, amazing work in Haiti, we took the next step, we created jobs.  Jobs that support both employees and their families.  Since 2011 we  created 300 jobs. We need your help to sustain those jobs and create more. 
    • Your help in funding the project will save these 300 jobs plus the additional 2500 children, spouses, parents who depend on these employees for support and sustenance.
    • It allows the young children to go to school and stay in school.  Millions of dollars are donated to orphanages in Haiti. Creating jobs is a great way to reduce orphan population and allow the young to benefit from the love and care of their parents.  Something many of us take for granted in the US and other developed countries. 


    Indigo employment supports our team of workers and their families.  Our team of 300 workers hold their heads high; providing clean clothes, food, and shelter for their children and aging parents. 

    We need your help to sustain these jobs.  The factory is fully functional and we have invested our own funds for machinery, training and all required to run a professional business in Haiti.  

    Your support will help maintain these 300 jobs and  support for 2800 Haitians.    While Indigo is  "For Profit", Your support will allow us to make Indigo a self-sufficient and sustainable business that will increase jobs in Haiti year after year.  

    • We thank you in anticipation for your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $200,000 USD.   

  • The funds will solely be used to provide additional training to workers while getting a salary,  salaries for the skilled Haitian workers, rent, drinking water, utilities .  We plan to use some of the funds to give a fair bonus during Christmas holidays that will allow the workers to have a decent holiday season and even presents for their loved ones.  
Irrespective of the amount funded,  partially, fully or over funded,  all the funds will be used solely for the purpose mentioned above.   Primarily making sure that the workers get to maintain their jobs and get a bonus for Christmas and above all a job waiting for them when they come back from Holidays.  

The Impact

Many NGO's do great work in Haiti.  It truly is amazing.  Indigo has taken a step further.  Rather than just give once,  Indigo through the creation of jobs has created a sustainable approach.   

The impact is simple, having a job creates 

Self Respect, 

Self Dependence

Happiness

Relief of ones ability to provide for ones family.   

Knowing that tomorrow too you can eat

Opportunity to provide schooling and a decent family lifestyle for the children

For the last four years we have sustained this unit and have seen a world of difference in their outlook towards life.    This has given them HOPE.   

Anyone wishing to visit Haiti is most welcome to visit the factory and see how clean and self respecting environment we have created.  

  • Risks & Challenges

While all business have risks and challenges,  we have survived the various challenges one faces doing business in Haiti.   While this does not make us risk averse, we have all of the proper licenses in place along with a staff that is trained to deal with the daily rigors of business in Haiti.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount is not too small for you to donate.  We understand that not all people have the flexibility to give more,  we would greatly appreciate if you would pass this on to all your close and distant friends around the world, on Face-book and other social media.    

Thank you again for taking the time and we appreciate your help.

story: Thank You.
story_txt: Thank You.

story:
What is CarPartner?

CarPartner is a new revolutionary service that is designed to empower car customers with new innovative services that will aim to alleviate anxiety.  Buying a new car is either the first or second largest investment a family can make.  And the process has been largely unchanged since its inception.  CarPartner was created by its founders Carey Gammon and Jermaine Brown to address this glaring need that has been largely ignored.  Our service aims to attract customers who are tired of the status quo, when they have a need to purchase a new car.  They are making a huge monetary investment and not receiving the expected level of service that would warrant a happy customer experience.  CarPartner will enter into this space and provide dealerships with a comprehensive plan to achieve a higher level of customer experience.   Consumers who visit the CarPartner site prior to visiting the dealership will have the ability to choose the sales person they want deal with prior to visiting the dealership.  Once they have selected the sales person of their choice our consumers will have several innovative features available.  These enhancements were designed to empower the consumer with choices and options that were previously unavailable to car buyers. 

About the Founders:

Carey and Jermaine have been friends for over 17 years - originally meeting in 1997 in the US Army while stationed in Panama. Both began their careers in the US Army in the Telecommunications field, however, it was Jermaine that remained in the field upon exiting the service. Jermaine now touts 18 years of experience in the satellite communications industry, with an emphasis on project management and engineering.  The bulk of this experience coming from Intelsat, the global leader in satellite communications.  “I started my journey at Panamsat, a startup turned industry leader, and I was instilled with the drive and passion to accomplish the goals at hand with the resources available”. He continued, "I was fortunate to further my skills with Intelsat and the team there provided me with the means to hone my skill sets on several high-profile projects, programs and services". Jermaine has been able to translate his project management applications and process creation skills into bringing a new customer experience service that will change the face of automotive sales.

Carey started his career in sales in 2002 as sales person at First Team Auto Mall after exiting the service.  After spending his first three years in sales, he soon earned the opportunity to move into management as a Finance Manager.  He ended up spending the majority of his sales career on the retail side as a Finance Manager and in 2009 he was promoted to Finance Director. In October of 2011, Carey decided to explore the corporate side of the Automotive Industry as a District Sales Manager for Hyundai Motor America.  Carey states that "all of these experiences provided me with a robust understanding of how customers can be serviced better in the automotive industry".  Thus Beyond Sales, LLC was born.  



Beyond Sales is the company that will introduce CarPartner to the automotive industry. We are a modern innovative company that focuses on bridging the gap between consumers and car dealerships.   

The Questions……

  1. Have you ever meet a car salesman that gave you outstanding customer service, however, when you went back to the dealership to purchase another vehicle or to give a referral, you found that he/she no longer works there?

  2. Have you ever went to a dealership and before you could exit your vehicle there were 3-4 sales people standing around your car, just waiting to pounce as soon as you opened your door?

  3. Are you a first-time buyer or have anxiety when purchasing a car, with the expectation to be "sweet-talked" or pushed towards a vehicle that was not to your liking or expectations?

  4. Have you been to the dealership with the expectation of completing your purchase in a few hours, only to look at your watch and notice you have been at the dealership for far longer than you intended?

If you identified with any of the scenarios above, we have the solution for you!!

The Solution…..

In today’s society consumers are continually expecting more out of the businesses they deal with.  In the Automotive industry consumers have been subjected to the same set of business practices and processes over the last few decades. American consumers love cars but hate the process to buy them.  Almost 60% of Americans state that they hate the car buying process and experience, and most also have a very low opinion of car sales people. According to multiple surveys, car sales professionals are looked on as the least trusted professionals in the country (only members of congress have a lower score).  

Enter Beyond Sales.  Our company’s goal is to position our website (CarPartner) as the number one tool that consumers use before heading to a dealership to purchase their next vehicle.  We intend to do this by providing a robust website that will empower our consumers with the ability to choose the time, dealership, and sales professional of their choice.

Our consumers will have multiple tools necessary to make their next car purchase as smooth and memorable as possible.  Our emphasis will be on making sure our consumers experience the highest level of customer service at the dealership when they use our website to book their next appointment.

Services Provided….


Search for your Sales Partner | This gives consumers the ability to browse through sales people in their immediate area, or for a specific sales person if you already know their name.  Dealerships that sign up with our service will have their sales staff listed on our website for consumers to choose from and book their appointment.  Each Sales Partner will have their 30 second bio video about themselves as well as their own calendar available on the website for consumers to book an appointment with the Sales Partner of their choice.

Search By Dealership | Don’t know what dealership you want to visit in your area?  Just go to the search by dealership or manufacturer tab and it will bring up the list of Car Partner dealerships near you.  Once you choose a dealership you will be able to choose your sales person from that dealership to schedule your appointment.

Disability Assistance | Some of our consumers may have special needs.  From here they can search to see if there are Sales Partners near them that can assist.

Search By Language | It is important that our dealerships become diverse and this feature will give our consumers the ability to search for a sales person who speaks their language, literally.

Express Service | In a hurry?  Don't want to spend your whole day at the dealership?  By using this option our consumers will be out of the dealership in less than 3 hours.  Dealerships that are express sale certified will have a noticeable distinction on our site to alert customers.  In order for dealerships to be express sale certified they must maintain a 90% or higher express sale completion percentage.

Schedule A Test Drive | Let’s face it, there are many choices available when you are purchasing your next vehicle.  Using this service allows the consumer to schedule a test drive of the model they are interested in, with the Sales Partner of their choice.

What We Are Seeking….

We are seeking to raise $500,000.00 to design, build and market our business product - CarPartner.  Below is a complete breakdown on how these funds will be used to help launch our business.




Website Design & Build is one of the key segments that our funding will be used for. The website - www.aCarPartner.com - will require several features to meet “Live” status.


CarPartner - Website Features

Customer view

  • Search for “SalesPartner” with specified criteria

    • Name, Location, Dealership, Languages, Disability Assistance, Overall Experience

  • Unique “SalesPartner” profile page

    • Ability to schedule appointment with partner of choice to move the sales process forward

    • Contact made with SalePartner via customer preferred medium - phone relay (VoIP), chat in browser (based on availability of SalesPartner), text, email - actual, not automated

    • Express-Sale availability

  • Customer registration - signup, login, security questions and assistance

  • Check-in ability, allowing for customer to start Quality Assurance process; starts the clock for express sale or basis of total time spent for service experience

  • Check-out with review ability

  • Request Express-Sale option

  • Mobile-friendly page design(s)

  • Ability to upload text and / or video testimonials & reviews

  • Location awareness for analytics, search and check-in features


“SalesPartner” View

  • Dashboard page, showing all available information, views, appointments and conversations

  • Customizable view for each SalesPartner page

  • Ability to upload video and photos, advertising their services and skills to the potential customer

    • 15 - 20 second video advertising their experience and ability to provide the service a CarPartner customer will be expecting

  • Listing of professional information: basic biography, expertise

  • Dealership information and associations

    • Link to dealership home page and information

  • Links to social media sites - Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Google+

  • Express-Sale availability

  • User registration (sign up, login, security assistance)

  • Mobile-friendly page design(s)


Advertisement

  • Ad display integration


Notifications

  • Scheduled appointments

  • Dealership notification of “SalesPartner” association

  • Customer notifications, according to preferences set by customer

    • minimum 1 medium for notification purposes

  • (backend) CarPartner core team notifications for situational awareness


Backend and Administration

  • Google Calendar integration for scheduled appointments

  • Click to call routing (VoIP)

  • Dealership administration functions


Analytics

  • Google Analytics for goal tracking and metrics

  • Check-in / out times

  • “SalesPartner” page views and conversions metrics


SEO

  • Page titles, meta, headers for each page, sales profile

End features



Product Marketing & Rollout is second on our funding list, with resources going toward producing marketing material - digital and analog - to promote and sell the CarPartner product to dealerships, including traveling to and meeting with local and regional dealerships within our targeted markets.


Not just any dealership will be invited to join our network, but only the dealership teams committed to superior customer service and experience. Recently, at the Auto News World Congress in Detroit, Michigan, many of today’s top automotive executives spoke on the future of the industry and how their model lineups and brand will be answering the call.

Of these executives - BMW, Fiat, Porsche, Tesla - Customer Experience was valued the highest. A select few manufacturers choosing to remain true and loyal to their customer base by putting customer service first and foremost. While this sounds strange at first, it makes the most sense when factoring in the resource most important to the car buying experience, the customer.

Customers hold all the keys and the power in the buying process.  The statistics provided at the Auto News World Congress Convention, revealed that the top two factors that determine customer retention are vehicle reliability and customer service satisfaction.


Operations Expenses:

  • Information Technology team

  • Website Hosting Fees

  • Utility Costs

  • Office Supplies

  • Sales Material Costs


Legal Fees are accounted for in the startup budget to cover the creation and review of the various contracts required between Beyond Sales, LLC - and the respective dealerships agreeing to join the CarPartner network of dealerships. Terms and conditions will be reviewed and agreed upon by all parties involved.

Insurance speaks to business insurance fees.


Why Car Partner?

Our goal is to revolutionize the way customers purchase their new cars, as well as how the dealerships will now interact with their customers.  Consumers have been buying cars in this country dating back to the 1890’s; and it was in 1896 that the first companies to produce vehicles for the public were formed.  As more consumers started to materialize these automobile dealerships began to market their vehicles to help increase sales.  This would lead to growth within the automotive infrastructure which forced dealerships to hire salesmen to service the public.  Over the past decades there have been many changes within the automotive industry, the vehicles have become more technically advanced, the dealerships have been upgraded to look more sophisticated and unique, marketing techniques have become more intuitive, even how you connect to a customer via phone, text, and email have made the car buying process easier for dealerships.  All these processes have either been added or upgraded over the years.  However, one of the most important areas of the purchase has yet to be addressed, and that area is the actual consumer.  Our service aims to address that void.  Consumers are the automotive industry’s greatest asset because without them there is no automotive industry.  We live in a society where our consumers deserve more.  CarPartner is designed to empower the automotive consumer while also providing an upgraded customer service experience.

Your Contribution……

By contributing to our campaign you will be intimately involved with helping us get our company and service up and running.  We want each person that contributes to our campaign to know that every dollar you give will be used to bring this innovative service to the public.  Our goal is to raise $500,000 to help cover costs for the design of the website, assist with marketing, operational costs, legal fees, travel costs and insurance.  Studies have shown that automotive customers are generally not satisfied with the current level of service they are receiving from dealerships.  With your help we can change how automotive customers buy their next car by empowering the consumer.  We hope to give our consumers this advantage going forward.  We hope you will join us in reaching our fundraising goal.  A simple donation can be made right here online!


Risks & Challenges

  • A risk and challenge with this service is that it's going against the grain, focusing on the people making the process work rather than the bottom-line pricing of an automobile.  Our intention is to align with dealerships to deliver better customer service which will lead to a better customer experience.  

  • Our economy dictates the frequency in which automobiles are purchased, as well as who has the ability to purchases them.  This could potentially have a negative affect on CarPartner.

  • Pricing is key to any automobile sale, but It’s more than just pricing that creates customer retention.  It’s the way the Sales professional and their team(s) work to provide the customer with a high quality customer service experience.  The dealership will be investing in our product and therefore investing in you, their customers!  Their focus will be on increasing customer retention by offering a better customer experience.

  • There are existing web-based platforms and applications selling vehicles, that currently use the existing processes of having the customer agree to being contacted.  The customer expects to get a knowledgeable, experienced and committed sales associate in order to complete the sale. CarPartner aims to meet or exceed the customer's expectations, and will enhance the process by allowing the customer to choose who they want to complete their vehicle sale with,  their “SalesPartner”. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please take 2-3 minutes our of your day and help us spread the word.  Please share our campaign with your friends and family.  Share the link for our campaign through email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and text.  We thank you in advance for your help!

  • Just another reminder you can use the Indiegogo share tool it simple and really easy to use.
story_txt:
What is CarPartner?
CarPartner is a new revolutionary service that is designed
to empower car customers with new innovative services that will aim to alleviate
anxiety.  Buying a new car is either the
first or second largest investment a family can make.  And the process has been largely unchanged
since its inception.  CarPartner was
created by its founders Carey Gammon and Jermaine Brown to address this glaring
need that has been largely ignored.  Our
service aims to attract customers who are tired of the status quo, when they
have a need to purchase a new car.  They
are making a huge monetary investment and not receiving the expected level of
service that would warrant a happy customer experience.  CarPartner will enter into this space and
provide dealerships with a comprehensive plan to achieve a higher level of
customer experience.   Consumers who visit the CarPartner site prior
to visiting the dealership will have the ability to choose the sales person
they want deal with prior to visiting the dealership.  Once they have selected the sales person of their
choice our consumers will have several innovative features available.  These enhancements were designed to empower
the consumer with choices and options that were previously unavailable to car
buyers.  
About the Founders:
Carey and Jermaine have been friends for over 17 years - originally
meeting in 1997 in the US Army while stationed in Panama. Both began their careers in the US Army in the Telecommunications field, however, it was Jermaine that remained in the
field upon exiting the service. Jermaine
now touts 18 years of experience in the satellite communications
industry, with an emphasis on project management and engineering.  The bulk of this experience
coming from Intelsat, the global leader in satellite communications.  “I started my journey at Panamsat, a startup turned industry leader, and I was instilled with the drive and
passion to accomplish the goals at hand with the resources available”. He continued, "I was fortunate to further my skills with Intelsat and the team there provided me with the means to hone my skill sets on several high-profile projects, programs and services". Jermaine has been able to
translate his project management applications and process creation skills into
bringing a new customer experience service that will change the face of
automotive sales.

Carey started his career in sales in 2002 as sales person at
First Team Auto Mall after exiting the service. 
After
spending his first three years in sales, he soon earned the opportunity to move
into management as a Finance Manager.  He ended up spending the majority
of his sales career on the retail side as a Finance Manager and in 2009 he
was promoted to Finance Director. In October of 2011, Carey decided to
explore the corporate side of the Automotive Industry as a District Sales Manager
for Hyundai Motor America.  Carey states
that "all of these experiences provided me with a robust understanding of how
customers can be serviced better in the automotive industry".  Thus Beyond Sales, LLC was born.  



Beyond Sales is the company that will introduce CarPartner to the automotive industry. We are a modern innovative company that focuses on bridging the gap between consumers and car dealerships.   
The Questions……

Have you ever meet a car salesman that gave you outstanding customer service, however, when you went back to the dealership to purchase another vehicle or to give a referral, you found that he/she no longer works there?
Have you ever went to a dealership and before you could exit your vehicle there were 3-4 sales people standing around your car, just waiting to pounce as soon as you opened your door? 
Are you a first-time buyer or have anxiety when purchasing a car, with the expectation to be "sweet-talked" or pushed towards a vehicle that was not to your liking or expectations?
Have you been to the dealership with the expectation of completing your purchase in a few hours, only to look at your watch and notice you have been at the dealership for far longer than you intended?
If you identified with any of the scenarios above, we have the solution for you!!
The Solution…..In today’s society consumers are continually expecting more out of the businesses they deal with.  In the Automotive industry consumers have been subjected to the same set of business practices and processes over the last few decades. American consumers love cars but hate the process to buy them.  Almost 60% of Americans state that they hate the car buying process and experience, and most also have a very low opinion of car sales people. According to multiple surveys, car sales professionals are looked on as the least trusted professionals in the country (only members of congress have a lower score).  Enter Beyond Sales.  Our company’s goal is to position our website (CarPartner) as the number one tool that consumers use before heading to a dealership to purchase their next vehicle.  We intend to do this by providing a robust website that will empower our consumers with the ability to choose the time, dealership, and sales professional of their choice. Schedule A Test Drive | Let’s face it, there are many choices
  available when you are purchasing your next vehicle.  Using this service allows the consumer to
  schedule a test drive of the model they are interested in, with the Sales
  Partner of their choice.

story:
Hi I’m Kenneth Betts and this is my family.  


We live in Jordan.   


And this is the aquaponics farm that we have built.  



Jordan is facing a water crisis.  Over the last decade Jordan has received about half the normal seasonal rain fall, making it the thirteenth poorest country in terms of renewable fresh water per capita.  That comes to  106 m3 per person  per year.  


Across the globe it takes an average 15 m3 of water to produce one kg of beef, 10 m3 of water to produce one kg of sheep and 3 m3 for one kg of farmed tilapias.  But on our farm we produce tilapia at about 5% of that.  Oh, and because we use aquaponics that 5% includes the water needed to grow the fruits and vegetables.

Our farm is the first of its kind in Jordan. We’ve spent the last fourteen years doing research and development on a prototype sustainable small business farm that can one day be reproduced locally.

We breed our own stock and raise them to saleable size in specialized tanks.  Aquaponics means we organically grow fruit and vegetable plants as the filter system for the fish.

Research and development can be hard, and takes a lot of time. We’ve suffered some major setbacks over the years. And then recently, using everything we have learned, we re-envisioned, re-structured, re-engineered, and rebuilt the farm to its current state.  At the moment, we are running at half of full capacity while we iron out the details of fruit and vegetable crops and their rotations. 

During this development, we have received financial assistance from several sources.  Without that, we would never have gotten this far.  And we are very thankful for it.

Now we are ready to take the next step forward.  Our objective is to operate a fully functioning prototype that is economically and environmentally sustainable.  Our farm is attracting local interest in its methods and technologies.  We already have the main structure and systems in place and working.  Now we need to work out profitable crop rotations to finish the prototype.  This could take a couple more years. 

To keep progressing to our goal of a fully functioning economically and environmentally sustainable model farm, we need your help.  We need 9000 dollars to cover operational costs.  We can do this so cheaply because my son and I are volunteering our time to this critical water saving project.   

Your help will move the farm toward its goal so that we can continue to provide solutions to sustainable organic food production.  Every dollar helps. 

If you know anyone who might be interested in our project, feel free to share a link to this page with them.

Join us in developing water efficient sustainable agriculture. By donating you are helping us take the next step.  And you are helping to provide sustainable solutions to food production. Thank you for taking the time to watch this video. And thank you for any donations you make.

Stretch Goal #1: Bring the Farm to Full Capacity

If we reach 17,000 dollars, the additional 8,000 dollars will enable us to bring the farm to full capacity; to be that fully functioning prototype that can inspire change in the community.  The 8,000 dollars will complete the construction of three more grow out tanks for fish,  2 more grow beds for fruits and vegetables, an additional sump reservoir for those new grow beds, and expansion of the air blower capacity. The additional operating cost will be offset by the increased fish production.


Progress Toward Our Stretch Goal


Future Goals :  Greater Impact On The Community

Our ultimate goal is to maximize the transformational impact of this technology on local society by increasing the direct contact members of the community have with the technology and so inspiring and promoting adoption of the concepts and technologies in use.

Although the 17,000 dollars will help us complete the prototype farm, ultimately, it is our plan to extend the impact of the technology into the community in three ways.

1) Development and production of a family sized kit, a tactile learning experience, that will be suitable for operation inside a home or on a balcony; and provide some tasty vegetables and fish for the family.

2) Raise the community status of aquaponics technologies through education by : development of our existing contacts with the local University of Science and Technology to include field trips for the students to the farm, and have my son obtain a certificate in aquaponics from the University of the Virgin Islands.

3) Promote and undertake turnkey projects for sustainable, water saving, aquaponics farms.  These farms could include a variety of objectives such as food production, education, entertainment, and food services, supply of fingerlings to other farms.

story:
Conceptual design by Darby  Hale Design

Independence Brewing has seen a lot of growth and changes since we started in 2004. We could not have grown the brewery and continued to do what we love without the support of the community. 

As we enter this next chapter, we want to involve the community even more in achieving our goals. We’ve reached our major goal of installing a new brewing system, but we still have much to do. First and foremost, we want to make our tasting room a more comfortable environment for our friends and community to enjoy beer. Our goals are to increase the number of taps, improve the bar and tables, and most importantly, we want to recognize our supporters through this fundraising effort.

Independence is about community. It’s about the brewery supporting the community and providing a space to foster community.

Why We Need Your Support

The recent brewing production expansion was very expensive. We could get by without improving the tasting room but we want to create a positive space. 

We’re not extravagant people. We’ll be doing most of the work ourselves, but we do need help. Right now, all of our resources are going into brewing the best beer we can. 

Here's where we will use the funds:

  • Install walk-in cooler and more taps
  • Build new bar including bar and merchandise storage
  • Relocate Skagen mural and sticker tin wall
  • Build new tables, fix benches
  • Resurface floor
  • Install new rollup doors
  • Install new lighting
  • Purchase bar stools

Mural by local artist Rory Skagen

Stretch goals 

What if we exceed $35K? If we can reach $50K, then we can fund other items on our wish list including:

  • Install HVAC for better climate control
  • Installation of dividing wall between tasting room and production facility
  • Upgrade bathrooms
  • Purchase industrial dishwasher

What You Get

Our extreme gratitude and a special thank you on our website.

  • $15 Glass + sticker (pick up)
  • $20 Glass + Sticker (shipped)
  • $25 “Locals” t-shirt for first 200 (free shipping), then $30
  • $50 “Founders” Mug Club (includes all Mug Club benefits annual)
  • $100  Party with the Stars - Tasting Room Re-opening Private Reception with our Founders and Stars
  • $250 “Stars” - be the first to see your own custom star on display during our Tasting Room Re-opening Private Reception (includes Mug Club)
  • $500 Private Brewery Tour & Tasting for up to 30 people (includes glass & beer)
  • $1000 “Stammtisch Table” Chair qty 10 (includes Mug Club)
  • $5000 Pilot Brew with Brannon Radicke (qty: 3 which will be allocated per quarter), plus your own large star on display.
 If we exceed $35K, we will add other perks to our backers as an extra thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on Facebook
  • Spread the word the next time you're having a beer!

story:
Hello friends!

My name is Nick and I'm a 4th year university student at the University of Alberta. I'm currently studying English and German, and I'll transfer to Education after finishing my current degree in 2016. One day I'll be a teacher somewhere in this awesome world, and I hope to encourage students to think creatively and to inspire them to be the best they can be.

I have started this campaign in the hopes of funding a year of studying abroad in Germany at the Freie Universität Berlin, in order to better learn the language and learn about history, art, culture and people. I can't fully express what this would mean for me, other than by saying that I would be forever grateful, so let me introduce you to the German philosopher Gotthold Ephraim Lessing:

"The best way to learn about art is to go and see it"

Lessing was speaking of his voyage to Greece in 1765, during which time a massive revival of interest in Ancient Greece and Rome was under way, otherwise known as the Renaissance Period. Lessing traveled to see the legendary Laocoon statue in oder to view it first-hand, and later wrote his book "Laocoon: An Essay on the Limits of Painting and Poetry."

By funding my year of studies, you will help me to achieve this and more: I will be able to learn not from a textbook or from a professor's notes, but rather direct from the people and culture itself!

Let me be honest with you.

I need $5000. I've already saved a lot more ($10 000), but I'm still short on what the University deems an acceptable level of funds. And that's why I'm here! The funds will be used for the following: 

  • Airfare
  • Accommodation
  • Tuition
  • Textbooks
  • Food

The most expensive and important thing, of course, is the tuition. 

So far so good on paperwork though!

And let me assure you that should I not reach my goal the money will still be used for its intended purpose, but I will engage in a student loan to cover the difference.

The Impact

Let's go back to Lessing. Had philosophers not engaged in novel thinking during the Enlightenment, there would have been no Renaissance, no Davinci, no Dante, no free thought, rare democracy. We owe our entire way of life to these enlightened thinkers! 

Now, I'm not going so say that your donation will fund the next Plato's education. Although I've maintained a 3.3 GPA over my undergraduate career at the University of Alberta, I do still study diligently for exams. Life isn't easy and neither is an education. So at least you know that I will still work hard abroad to ensure nothing is put to waste!

There are teachers all over the world, both good and bad. I've had my share of both and I've been determined to be a good one. Help me be the best I can be. Help me make a difference.

Any donation is gratefully accepted. Even $10 would be enough! If you can't donate, I understand, but please share this page with your friends and family to get my message out there! Perks start at $50, but everyone will receive a form of thanks.

story:
BACKGROUND

Bonnie Gelberg, the founder of SuperStar Shower Caps, has been a hairdresser for over 30 years and has worked in New York, Los Angeles, and Palm Beach.  She is an expert in hair styling, coloring, and cutting.  She also creates and designs custom upscale hairpieces for women.

IMPORTANCE

These shower caps are made:

  • Large enough to fully protect the hairstyle from moisture and steam
  • To retain the shape that the user needs for protecting her/his hair
  • To not require long, silky hair to be tied up while showering and bathing
  • To not flatten a hairstyle

WHAT WILL WE ACHIEVE

The shower caps will fill a need to keep all your hair dry and hairstyle in place.  People, especially those with big and/or long hair, have been looking for a shower cap that really works and now we have one which is perfect.

It is also versatile because it can be used if you have dreadlocks, extensions or hairpieces, wigs, rollers, or even in the rain to protect your hair; it can be used as a hands free umbrella.

FUNDING NEEDED

We are asking for $20,000 to assist with marketing and production expenses.

PRODUCT VALUE

The shower caps come in two sizes:  large and extra large.

They are made with a clear moldable plastic and are manufactured to be strong and durable so that it keeps its shape and does not even touch your hair.

A soft, silky fabric is used around the face and neck area.

The patented drawstring and clasp can be made tighter or looser for comfort and to ensure it is watertight.

CHALLENGES

There are other similar looking shower caps on the market, but SuperStar shower caps are designed better and have higher quality due to features like the patented drawstring and clasp, materials used in construction, and the size.

The challenge is to create a strong market for this product via media "buzz" by discussing how well these shower caps are made and function.  The end result will be good product placement and a successful launch.

Your contribution will help speed up the process to get everyone in a SuperStar shower cap.  Thank you for your pledge and contribution.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US

Like US on Facebook.

Email:  hairpieces@aol.com  (until we get a new website started).

Share your thoughts on this product.

Provide supportive advice for marketing and product placement.

story:
What an amazing show of support!

By last night, our online campaign yielded almost $12,000, which goes a long way toward paying our monthly bills over the next three months.  We also received almost $3000 yesterday in additional donations that people wanted to contribute directly.  While the campaign is closed, people can still contribute to Community Legal by mail, or through our website: www.communitylegal.net. 

More importantly, we received a huge burst of support from our community.  We have 5 new attorney volunteers; we have lots of great connections with members of our community wanting to offer everything from office equipment to fundraising support.  And, our Community Legal team is ready to take on our next stage:  OPENING!  We thank all who contributed in any way for your support and for sharing our vision:  that with basic legal support for all, our community is a safer, happier, and stronger community, and a better place to live.  We have kept our story on this site, below, in case you want to learn more. 


We need you, because community matters. We are only as strong as our weakest link.

Community Legal is here to empower, serve, and inspire low-income clients by meeting three needs:  the need for a less alienating alternative to an always-adversarial approach to legal issues and conflict;   the need for legal services to be affordable for lower income people and non-profit ventures; and the need for legal services that empower the people they serve to really change the problems that bring them to an attorney, not only to avoid short-term consequences.  

To accomplish this, we will work with the Nevada County Bar Association to create a model pro-bono program, in which Community Legal provides training for working effectively with diverse people in need of legal help; and in which attorneys step up to take a small part in providing legal education and representation to people who need it the most. We help place the power in the hands of our clients, and to create a game-changing, collaborative approach to legal services, while still serving traditional legal and conflict resolution needs. 

We do this by providing collaborative informational and representational legal services including:  

  • Group legal clinics that answer the questions: Do I need an attorney? Can I use a form?  If so, which form do I use?
  • Legal mediation, a relationship- and capacity-buidling  way of helping clients to resolve conflicts,  negotiate agreements, and work together to solve problems.
  • Direct, limited scope legal services including legal research and drafting, limited advocacy, and legal problem-solving, particularly in the areas of housing (including landlord tenant, neighborhood disputes, County code enforcement) and serving low income  people and non-profits. 
  • Access to power through informal coffees and meeting with decision-makers and providing workshops on effective issue advocacy. 

How your funding will support Community Legal becoming a reality. 

We will be opening doors to our clinic across from the Nevada County Superior Court in August of 2015.  Attorneys associated with Community Legal have been holding a legal clinic since August of 2014 in North San Juan, geared toward helping low income people.  We have conducted mediations, kept families in their homes, provided legal information, and supported people in negotiating with County agencies.  We want to provide more of this service, including opening and staffing our office across from the Courthouse; providing legal clinics on location at our 3 nonprofit partners--Community Recovery Resources (CoRR); FREED Independent Living Center; and at Nevada County Works! (which services CalWORKS recipients in Nevada County). 

  • Your funding will support an attorney and paralegal serving 25-30 clients a month at our on location clinics, and another 50-100 people at our main office.  
  • Your funding will help make our office a comforting, caring location for clients to get help, without being intimidated. 
  • Your funding will allow us to provide needed training to pro-bono attorney volunteers, to our local bar, and to our staff.  
  • Your funding will help keep people in their homes; will give a voice to low income people who lack the ability to communicate with people in positions of power; and will reduce conflict in our community, for families and individuals. 

Our goal is to open our doors funded by direct support from the community.  We need a total of $85,000 to be able to operate with full staffing on a part-time basis between now and January, 2016. We have just received a grant for $16,500, so we are part of the way there. We also hope that you will be willing to become an ongoing ally by supporting us on an ongoing, monthly basis.   

  • Give at the basic Advocate level, $75, and attend one Legal Clinic on the topic of your choice sometime this year.  Topics will include Estate Planning, Employment and Labor Law, and Family Law. 
  • Give at the Collaborator level, $100, and get one hour of legal or mediation services a year. 
  • Give at the Game Changer level and make this project happen.  Donations of $500 or more give you any of the above services, and guarantee that these services will go to many more people in need. 
  • Give what you want, just for fun, and know that you are helping to make important change!  

Your gift changes lives, by building community instead of dividing people who are in conflict. 

Community Legal  will provide essential tools to people in need of basic legal services, but also creates a model for an inspiring and collaborative client-based approach to solving legal problems. We all know that we can deal with polarizing conflict in our society and lives in a better way, and our clinic is here to provide the tools to accomplish that. Conflict can result in discouraging or even violent divisions between neighbors and families; but at its core, conflict is the place where we can recognize and embrace our differences and build agreements that serve all parties. What makes that difference is the level of support parties receive in the process of conflict and resolving conflict.  We provide that support, in collaboration with many other social service and government agencies that also offer support.  

Our directors, staff, and advisors have the combination of knowhow and care for our community to make this a reality.  Erin Noel, who will serve as the first Facilitating Director of the center, is an 15-year attorney and mediator who has worked in the non-profit sector and for individual clients.  Her practice has included environmental, land use, property, landlord/tenant law and dispute resolution, as well as legislative drafting, community organizing, and mediation. Her volunteer experience ranges from serving on and mediating with the Conflict Resolution Center board of directors (CRC provides volunteer mediation in the Nevada County Superior Court), volunteering for the Hospitality House, volunteering for organizations ranging from the San Juan Ridge Taxpayers Association to the South Yuba River Citizen's League, and serving as a founding member and board member for organizations including the Sierra Nevada Alliance and Sierra Nevada Forest Protection Campaign.  She presently provides free legal service in a monthly legal clinic in North San Juan, with other volunteer attorneys.

Board members include Paul Johnson, President, a local attorney who has worked in various role serving the public, including his current role as attorney for DCSS, and previous work in criminal defense, dependency and juvenile law, serving small public agencies in water rights and environmental issues, and a past member of the Executive Committee of the Nevada County Bar Association;  Serge Aronow, former Director of Family Court Mediation Services; and  Monica Senter, trained as an attorney, who now provides project management and contract management services for Wells Fargo Bank. 

Advisors include Judge Carl Bryan (ret.), and Judge Albert Dover (ret.), former Judges of the Nevada County Superior Court. Judge Dover is an accomplished mediator now in private practice; Joseph Bell, the attorney who ran Nevada County Legal aid starting in the early 1980s, and who has served on a number of State Bar committees; Kimberly Milligan, an inactive attorney who, when active, worked representing victims of domestic violence, and contributed to CA. Judicial Council policies in this area. She presently serves on the Board of Directors of American Rivers; Dr. Irving Baran, a psychiatrist who served as a psychiatrist for Yuba County Behavioral Health Services, and Caleb Dardick, Executive Director of the South Yuba River Citizens League.  

    Starting a new organization is risky business; we need your support to address this challenging gap in service. 

    Simply put, we are working toward creating a new organization and a new way of providing legal services.  We are taking this approach because we really do not have legal service that is affordable to low income people in Nevada County. Creating a new approach is inherently risky.  Part of our model is that community support is critical to a collaborative approach.  The support of our community, not only as funders but as partners, reduces risk and allows us the support needed to take the risks we need to take to really make change and to make a difference in the lives of people we serve.

    Because we have support from a wide range of leaders both in our legal community, local government, and in mediation practice, we have the collective wisdom to create something that meets our high standards in each practice area. 

    By actively partnering with organizations who might see us as competitors, we have been able to better define the work we want to do without stepping on toes, but with a detailed awareness of the legal work that is already being done and the help that is clearly missing. 

    Our staff and board have organizing, legal, and mediation experience needed to be successful at this stage of organizational development.  And, we are people who are deeply connected to this community.  

    That said, our biggest strategy for addressing the inherent risks and strategies in this endeavor is to really listen to feedback, and to be open to whatever outcome seems needed.  We have a clear sense of the needs that we want to meet, but we want to know from you whether you share the sense that we are on the right path.  Your funding is a way of communicating your support in a way that has meaning in our society, that speaks volumes to other potential funders, and that will get us off the ground knowing that the community has our back. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Money is needed to open our doors, but in the long run it is our collective effort that is needed to provide our neighbors with effective legal support. Here are a few more ideas about how you can help: 

    • If you have legal expertise, volunteer to teach a class, provide prop-bono help to a monthly clinic, or agree to take on an individual case. 
    • Help us communicate to more folks in this community who may want to become supporters. 
    • Communicate with legal professionals and mediation professionals outside of this area who may be inspired by this project. 
    • Let us know if you have quality office furniture we might be able to use. 
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 
    • Reach out to other funders, and let us know about these opportunities. 

    And that's all there is to it.

Our directors, staff, and advisors have the combination of knowhow and care for our community to make this a reality.  Erin Noel, who will serve as the first Facilitating Director of the center, is an 15-year attorney and mediator who has worked in the non-profit sector and for individual clients.  Her practice has included environmental, land use, property, landlord/tenant law and dispute resolution, as well as legislative drafting, community organizing, and mediation. Her volunteer experience ranges from serving on and mediating with the Conflict Resolution Center board of directors (CRC provides volunteer mediation in the Nevada County Superior Court), volunteering for the Hospitality House, volunteering for organizations ranging from the San Juan Ridge Taxpayers Association to the South Yuba River Citizen's League, and serving as a founding member and board member for organizations including the Sierra Nevada Alliance and Sierra Nevada Forest Protection Campaign.  She presently provides free legal service in a monthly legal clinic in North San Juan, with other volunteer attorneys.
Board members include Paul Johnson, President, a local attorney who has worked in various role serving the public, including his current role as attorney for DCSS, and previous work in criminal defense, dependency and juvenile law, serving small public agencies in water rights and environmental issues, and a past member of the Executive Committee of the Nevada County Bar Association;  Serge Aronow, former Director of Family Court Mediation Services; and  Monica Senter, trained as an attorney, who now provides project management and contract management services for Wells Fargo Bank. 
Advisors include Judge Carl Bryan (ret.), and Judge Albert Dover (ret.), former Judges of the Nevada County Superior Court. Judge Dover is an accomplished mediator now in private practice; Joseph Bell, the attorney who ran Nevada County Legal aid starting in the early 1980s, and who has served on a number of State Bar committees; Kimberly Milligan, an inactive attorney who, when active, worked representing victims of domestic violence, and contributed to CA. Judicial Council policies in this area. She presently serves on the Board of Directors of American Rivers; Dr. Irving Baran, a psychiatrist who served as a psychiatrist for Yuba County Behavioral Health Services, and Caleb Dardick, Executive Director of the South Yuba River Citizens League.  

  Starting a new organization is risky business; we need your support to address this challenging gap in service.  Simply put, we are working toward creating a new organization and a new way of providing legal services.  We are taking this approach because we really do not have legal service that is affordable to low income people in Nevada County. Creating a new approach is inherently risky.  Part of our model is that community support is critical to a collaborative approach.  The support of our community, not only as funders but as partners, reduces risk and allows us the support needed to take the risks we need to take to really make change and to make a difference in the lives of people we serve.
Because we have support from a wide range of leaders both in our legal community, local government, and in mediation practice, we have the collective wisdom to create something that meets our high standards in each practice area. 
By actively partnering with organizations who might see us as competitors, we have been able to better define the work we want to do without stepping on toes, but with a detailed awareness of the legal work that is already being done and the help that is clearly missing. 
Our staff and board have organizing, legal, and mediation experience needed to be successful at this stage of organizational development.  And, we are people who are deeply connected to this community.  
That said, our biggest strategy for addressing the inherent risks and strategies in this endeavor is to really listen to feedback, and to be open to whatever outcome seems needed.  We have a clear sense of the needs that we want to meet, but we want to know from you whether you share the sense that we are on the right path.  Your funding is a way of communicating your support in a way that has meaning in our society, that speaks volumes to other potential funders, and that will get us off the ground knowing that the community has our back. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 Money is needed to open our doors, but in the long run it is our collective effort that is needed to provide our neighbors with effective legal support. Here are a few more ideas about how you can help:  
If you have legal expertise, volunteer to teach a class, provide prop-bono help to a monthly clinic, or agree to take on an individual case. 
Help us communicate to more folks in this community who may want to become supporters. 
Communicate with legal professionals and mediation professionals outside of this area who may be inspired by this project.  Let us know if you have quality office furniture we might be able to use. 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 
Reach out to other funders, and let us know about these opportunities.  
 And that's all there is to it.

story:
YU for YU?


There are lots of reasons why you should help us reach our goals, but let’s start with these:

1. Clothing with a PURPOSE. Locally made. Globally inspired. As part of Yebies University, our collegiate-themed clothing helps provide educational experience projects including playgrounds, sports and art equipment, technologically advanced resources and more to the students attending our domestic and foreign partner schools.

2. 100% Made in America. Our products are designed and crafted in the U.S. by our team and associates.

3. Authentic. By making our clothing here, we can create clothing that is created and inspired by those of our local community and our supporters.

4. Inclusive. We want you to join our story! By owning YU Clothing, you become a model for philanthropy and social development. By wearing our collegiate-themed clothing, you demonstrate your commitment to and value for educational advancement.

5. Fair Trade. When you buy anything from us, you are not just buying a product - you are buying into a better world. YU respects and follows the principles of the fair trade movement. Through YU, we at YEBies have pledged to help reach The 8 Millennium Development Goals set by the United Nations.



YU Clothing:

Starting with the YU “Campus Basics” which includes t-shirts, crewnecks sweatshirts, hoodies, and accessories, YU offers our personal take on traditional collegiate  apparel that spreads the feeling of solidarity and uniqueness fostered by the university experience. Each piece of clothing is made with the goal of uplifting young scholars across the globe.

Consumer Involvement: Other companies try to guess what their customers want – we let you decide. After our initial run, we’ll design subsequent collections based on what you want. Your input will be used on what ultimately gets produced.


Why Indiegogo?

For those of you not familiar with Indiegogo, this campaign is not just about contributing money to a great product and cause; rather, you will be joining us on our journey of social entrepreneurship! Based in Washington D.C., our team is currently made up of local residents who truly enjoy creating a locally made and globally conscious product.

Living as citizens of the global community, we are moved and empowered by helping people who want to study and work their way out of their current conditions. Our clothing collections impact the lives of students at our partner schools and communities, and provide employment for local residents. By supporting us, you're helping to spread the message that education, along with social entrepreneurship are keys to global, economic and societal development.


How We Work:





The Breakdown:

When we've raised $10K,  we will launch new projects at our partner schools and start planning for the project in Liberia. Our “YU Campus Basics” will go live on our website.

At $25K, we will be able to add two additional schools and projects. The next to cities for projects will be Baltimore, Md and Atlanta, GA. We will also add other colorway options and kids sizes of our campus basics. 

At $50K, we will be able to hire more staff and begin the production of our next collection which you will help create. We will also be able to give every backer a YU tank top which will be released to the general public in the spring/summer of 2015.



Rewards:














Risks and challenges

Our approach is new, but the process behind it isn't. We know exactly how to get our products made and shipped. It isn't with fancy technology. It's time honored, high-end quality screen printing done here in America.

This amazing process will all work once our  campaign is successfully funded. If we exceed our goal, we will continue to add more stretch goal items. We will also be able to add additional partner schools and accelerate the introduction of the other products from us.

We guarantee anyone pledging that once the project is funded, we will deliver our clothing in a timely fashion and ship your rewards on time. If for any reason things get delayed, we will continue to keep you all informed with details.

story:
During his 25 year obsession with the renaissance festivals and lifestyle, Thorin quickly realized he was not satisfied with the quality of mass produced meads offered in the American market.  From the beginning, the core company values as agreed on by the founding members, have been: education, quality of product, and ultimately the happiness of our patrons.  Having brewed for the last 20 years and using family recipes, he has offered up some 12 different meads (three of which he is currently producing.)  Using only American sourced and lab tested honeys, he strongly believes that a quality product is important.  Thorin’s focus is a decent price for his friends for a great product.  With the high production cost and a cheaply priced product comes an immediate problem: expansion.  As we are currently renting space, and constantly having to double production, there is no money to expand the company.  This is where the campaign comes in.  Creating a new facility will allow “Thorin’s Viking Mead” to flourish with the support of patrons like you.

     If you ever get a chance to see him at an event, and read the runes on Thorin’s belt, the motto of the company and the mead are written there.  “For the honor of my family, and the glory of my patrons.”  The family is Thorin’s Norse forefathers, and his patrons of course are you.  We have always been about word of mouth and historically accurate imagery from Scandinavian history, which allows Thorin to really get out and spend time with his patrons.  For him, this is the most important part of this whole business.  “I still believe that the greatest part of the mead making experience, is not in the creation, but when you finally get to sit back and watch people smiling, laughing, and spending quality time with their friends.”-Thorin

     Some of the main objectives of having our own meadery will be the ability to have classes, dinners, and the capacity to brew different meads and ciders.  Furthermore, Thorin will use his new location to grow fruit trees for his meads.  As the fruit trees grow, we will be adding in our own hives for an estate. One of the goals of building this new meadery that we are most excited about will be going green.  Thorin and his team are enthusiastic about implementing new measures to ensure that rainwater and grey water are recycled for the production of an orchard attached to the vineyard.  Thorin believes in providing for the land, just as the land has provided him this opportunity.  

To sum it up: we who have an incredible product and some truly once in a lifetime experiences to share with you, are excited to offer these gifts and our heartfelt thanks for helping us make the dream come true.
