story:
So Who or What is Weavealicious?

My name is Jeseca and I am Weavealicious. I'm 27 years old and have been passionate about hairdressing from a young age - I realised that it was my calling at the tender age of 9 when I would unravel my own hair, after it had been styled by my aunty. I would do this on the way to school every morning and re-style it how i liked it just to keep up with the latest trends.

Being born in Jamaica into a strict family, hairdressing as a career was always frowned upon -  my elders thought that it was something that I would struggle to make a living from, but quickly changed their minds after seeing what I could do. 

What Does Weavealicious Do?

 I have always been excited about the transformations that I have created (whether it be physical or psychological) and smiles that it puts on my client's faces. I chose Indiegogo because of their strong community focus and the similar smiles that they leave on their client's faces! I currently rent a chair in a local barbershop and here I have managed to build a strong local client-base consisting of over 400 individuals. I have already received an incredible amount of support from my customers and want to spread my project's message as far as possible.

I am in the process of opening my own hair extension boutique specialising in techniques such as weaves, nano-rings, pre-bonds and micro-loops among many others. Owning my own salon is my greatest career dream.

What Does Weavalicious Need?

I have been fortunate enough to run two successful salons in the past and feel that  now is the right time to forge my own path. I currently work two days a week renting a chair and the demand for my services has become too much to manage here. My new boutique is located opposite my current chair meaning an effortless transition, for my clients.  

I'm looking for £2,000 to finish this project - so far I've already managed to pay the three months deposit and application fees. I've also sourced salon chairs, a back wash unit, upgraded the bathroom, installed styling units and put in a waiting area. Your contributions will help me with:

  • Signage: The property is semi-detached so I'll need signs for each board. I will use the funds to purchase these along with window decals. The cost for this will be £1,240.

 

 

  • Flooring: At the moment the flooring is carpeted and this isn't really the best fit for a hair boutique. I intend to laminate the floor throughout - this will help to keep the space tidy and make it much easier clean. This will cost a total of £480 which will include all the necessary fixtures and fittings. 
  • Reception Desk: One of the final things that I'll need before I can open up my boutique is a partitioned area. This will double up as a reception area to take bookings and storage space for my 'Weavealicious' accessories, and products. It'll cost £320 to get this done.

To date I've managed to raise £5,500 and your generous contributions will help me to reach my goal of £7,500 - with this I'd be able to open up the Weavealicious Hair Extensions boutique. 

I appreciate any and all contributions and love that you've taken the time, to read through my campaign. There are some fantastic perks on offer; everything from a 'Thank You' card, to your own VIP Pamper Evening. Even in the unfortunate event that I don't meet my entire funding goal any funds that are raised will be a massive help, and will go towards the sign-age for the boutique. 'Weavealicious' in lights!! What could be better :)

My boutique will provide a hair haven for women and men of all ages to come and feel welcome, in the knowledge that their hair is in great hands!  Having my own professional environment will not only increase my productivity - the service quality will also improve as I will be able to implement more of my own ideas.

The Perks:

 

£7 - 'Thank You' wall entry - For your contribution you will have your name added to the Weavealicious feature wall within the salon.

£12 - Charitable thank you wall - Same as above but with a £5 donation to Cancer Research UK}

£15 - Launch Night VIP - Special invitation to the Weavealicious Hair Boutique launch night.

£25 - Weavealicious custom t-shirt - comes in black or white in sizes Small, Medium, Large or Extra Large.

£30 - 30% discount on any length Brazilian hair extensions.

£55 - Hall of Fame - Your contribution will mean that your name will be entered onto the Weavealicious 'Thank You' wall, along with a photo of you. Maximum Exposure!.

£250 - VIP Pamper Evening - The salon will be open only to you and a friend for the afternoon and I will be at your full beck & call. 

£500 - Opportunity to use the Weavealicious salon space for an event of your choosing.

AND FINALLY... 

Thank you for reading through my campaign - even if you can't contribute financially, you can still do it socially by sharing this with your friends and family.

Jeseca Robinson

story:
HOW WE GROW

We know this country’s current food systems are built around profit instead of nutrition and that the average American is unfamiliar with the origin of their food. We also know fresh, organically grown foods are often too expensive for many people. This is a story of a community of farmers, ranchers, and chefs in Western Colorado actively building their local food economy for everyone to enjoy.

The average age of farmers in the United States is 58 years, but there is a rapidly expanding interest and action among the millennial generation in local farming throughout the country. According to a report from the National Young Farmers' Coalition, communities can lead the change by: 

• Expanding Marketing Opportunities

• Revising zoning to protect farmland from development

• Supporting local farms through purchasing choices

Our community has one of the highest levels of income inequality in the nation, according to the U.S. Census Bureau. And yet it is truly unique in its support of farmers with everything from educational opportunities in gardening and market farming through FAT CITY FARMERS, to zero-interest loan programs like 2 FORKS CLUB, the only non-profit club under SLOW MONEY which invests in the careers of beginning farmers. 

This is an epic food movie for a new generation.



OUR TEAM

We are Haley Thompson and Tomas Zuccareno, long-time locals of the Roaring Fork Valley inspired to document this powerful food movement and the people behind it. 

From Haley: This film is something I've long been inspired to do after getting to know the many farmers, ranchers, chefs and educators my father Michael Thompson, has worked with over the years. I am biased in this sense, but anyone who visits our community and has tasted the many foods of this Valley, knows this story is one to be shared.

From Tomas: I am most inspired by how dedicated the young farmers are to bringing great tasting, healthy, sustainably produced food to their community. They are leading the charge in the local food movement, reconnecting us to our food. As a journalist, I can't help but want to tell that story.



GIFT ECONOMY

All donations towards this film are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE through our fiscal non-profit sponsor, FAT CITY FARMERS. By supporting this film, you are also investing in the famers and ranchers of our community. Many of our gifts, as a thank you for your donation, will be sourced locally from the Roaring Fork Valley. Examples include signed copies of Jerome Ostentowski's Permaculture Handbook, The Forest Garden Greenhouse, as well as local seed packets and beautiful products from our friends at Dynamic Roots, to name a few.

Our goal is to complete the film by Summer of 2017, but in order to do so we need to raise at least $35,000. While this will only cover a portion of our total film budget, it will help to cover some of the production costs including but not limited to: renting additional equipment, music licensing, motion graphics, Indiegogo platform fees, audio mixing, color correction, etc. The following diagram shows where the donated funds will be disbursed:


YOUR IMPACT

You have the power to make a difference. Not only by helping to fund this project but also in your own community. By supporting local farms over corporate food suppliers, you are investing in your future and that of your community by keeping the dollars within your local economy, all while enjoying the best food possible. Bringing food back home ensures that everyone has access to affordable, organic, sustainably raised, delicious food.

This Indiegogo campaign is only intended to get the ball rolling.  Would you like to join our team? We welcome any and all levels of interest from Production Assistants to Executive Producers.  Every penny of this campaign will be spent on production costs regardless of whether or not we reach our fundraising goals here. 


THE CHALLENGE

This film is an immense project, with many moving parts. We are a two-person filmmaking team and we need your help!

Our greatest asset in completing this film is our ability to tell an inspiring story that will empower other communities to follow suit.  Collectively, we have over 35 years experience in marketing and film advertising, but it is the young farmers who make this story compelling. The challenge will be taking this story to higher platforms, to share and learn and grow with other communities around the globe.


JOIN THE FOOD REVOLUTION

Please donate what you can to our campaign. With every dollar raised we are investing in the land and the farmers who are rebuilding our community by taking us back to our agricultural roots. 

Another way to help is to join the food revolution and spread the word!

• Share this campaign on all your social media pages.

•  Follow us on Instagram and Facebook!

• Check out www.howwegrowmovie.com as well as the links to our awesome community below!


YOUNG FARMERS/RANCHERS/CHEFS:

ROARING FORK FARMERS AND RANCHERS

TWO ROOTS FARM

WILD MOUNTAIN SEEDS

HERITAGE FRUIT TREE PROJECT

CEDAR RIDGE RANCH

ERIN'S ACRES

ROARING GARDENS

ASPEN T.R.E.E.

COLORADO SOIL SYSTEMS

FIELD 2 FORK KITCHEN

OPEN FIRE CATERING

SILO


MENTORS:

FAT CITY FARMERS

2 FORKS CLUB

SLOW MONEY

CRMPI

ECOSYSTEMS DESIGN

SUSTAINABLE SETTINGS

SPRADLEY FARMS


THANK YOU!

Many thanks to Scott Ainslie for letting us use his song in our trailer. You can hear more of his amazing musical talents at www.cattailmusic.com.

story:
Mauritius Conscious Guide

Sometimes people feel that its difficult to make the right choices. We believe that making the right choices is the way forward to benefit you, our island - Mauritius, and the world in which we all live. With Mauritius Conscious Guide, we aim to make it easier for travellers to make the right decisions on: where to stay, where to eat, how to move around, which excursion to choose and much more. We want them to enjoy Mauritius as one of us: the conscious way.

The #IslandLife Pass

We love authentic experiences and we want to make them more accessible to conscious travellers. Mauritius Conscious #IslandLife pass is all about that - taking travellers off the beaten track to immerse them into authentic experiences of Mauritius Island. 

The card offers a selection of curated places to discover & things to do (with some hidden gems only known by locals), excursions and activities in Mauritius that give the real feel of the island life. While enjoying all those experiences travellers get 20% discount by presenting the #IslandLife pass with all our conscious collaborators.
Welcome to your #IslandLife in Mauritius

On a suggested 7-days itinerary packed with excursions on land & sea, discovery of Mauritius nature, history and culture (and some rhum drinking along the way too!) you save on average $150 with a card of market value of $49. The more you explore, the more you save!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5000 to finance the production of the first batch of the #IslandLife pass cards.  This will cover:

  • Production costs
  • Marketing
  • Distribution

 

Your Reward

  • Contribute $5 to give your support to our initiative!
  • Contribute $10, receive our conscious map of suggested itineraries 
  • Contribute $25, receive a 10-days #IslandLife pass
  • Contribute $45, receive a 30-days #IslandLife pass
  • Contribute $150, receive 10 days accommodation in Mauritius plus a 10 Days #IslandLife pass to explore the island
Your card validity starts on the day you pick it up here in Mauritius. 


How Your Contribution Helps The Community

We support local initiatives and eco-conscious operators, making sure that your travel dollar contributes to sustain the community you are visiting. By helping us with the #IslandLife pass project you too bring your contribution to make Mauritius a sustainable destination.

Check out our Sustainability Assessment for more information.


Risk & Challenges

Even though our cards prototype has been validated and we plan the launch of the first batch end of September, production and shipping time may vary by few days. This might impact on our "start selling date".
We have already pre-contracted a comprehensive list of collaborators to be part of our eco-conscious business, though for now this pool of collaborators is not enormous we trust that with time more and more partners will join the network offering greater savings value to the cardholder.

Other Ways You Can Help

You will also greatly help us if you can spread the word about our initiative. Share our website www.mauritiusconscious.com with your family and friends. Follow us on facebook, instagram, pinterest and Google+

Even though our cards prototype has been validated and we plan the launch of the first batch end of September, production and shipping time may vary by few days. This might impact on our "start selling date".
We have already pre-contracted a comprehensive list of collaborators to be part of our eco-conscious business, though for now this pool of collaborators is not enormous we trust that with time more and more partners will join the network offering greater savings value to the cardholder.


Other Ways You Can Help

You will also greatly help us if you can spread the word about our initiative. Share our website www.mauritiusconscious.com with your family and friends. Follow us on facebook, instagram, pinterest and Google+

story:
The Background

We are parents to two young boys that are full of energy. Our older son is three and enjoys practicing yoga -- at daycare, at home, and at local studios with offerings for kids. We looked for a mat for him and were disappointed with the options on the market. Too small, too big, badly designed, overly designed, or made of cheap PVC. We thought we could offer something better, and SweetLime was born.

The Vision

Our vision for the design of the mats, shown in the renderings here, is based around yoga poses. We think these are relatable and fun for kids, and it reinforces learning the poses at the same time. We are starting with two designs for our initial run, and hope to add a third sometime in the next year.

The Details

The mats will be 59 inches x 24 inches x 0.12 inches, the perfect size for kids. (The average height of a 10 year old boy is 55" per the CDC). They will be made of TPE, which is higher quality than PVC, more environmentally friendly than PVC, and has excellent stickiness that kids need for grip.

The Request

We are asking for funding to produce our initial run of mats to launch on Amazon in late 2016/ early 2017.

The Team

We are an entrepreneurial husband and wife team with the experience to bring this product to market. Erin is a digital marketer and project manager, contributing business savvy, organizational acumen, and branding expertise. Alex is a supply chain manager, contributing his knowledge of purchasing, sourcing, and logistics.

Erin is a digital marketer and project manager who specializes in getting things done. She is an entrepreneur, organizer-in-chief, brand steward, design lover, and social media maven.

Alex is a supply chain manager specializing in sourcing, purchasing, logistics, and data analysis. An entrepreneur who finds efficiencies, helps scale, and sees the big picture.

story:
Summary

What happens when a community wants a place where handmade replaces mass-produced, where the seasons dictate the menu, where conversation flows as easy as the beer? Architect/baker/brewer Peter Soutowood has paired up with a world-class chef Joshua Soth to bring you Fourpenny House--just what La Mesa wants.


Staff

Owner Peter Soutowood has been baking and brewing his entire life, starting with chocolate eclairs in his grandmother's kitchen when he was barely tall enough to see to the counter.  As a licensed architect he brings a love for thoughtful design, comfort, and acoustic control so company can be enjoyed as much as the food and drink.  Overseeing the house brews and baking means his craftsmanship will show in the election and creation of curated experiences for every customer.

Chef Joshua Soth is an industry veteran known for his distinct ability to create innovative riffs on traditional dishes, who came to San Diego with more than two decades of restaurant experience.  His progressive approach in the kitchen has allowed Soth to garner numerous awards including a feature in Celebrated Chefs Chicago and multiple awards for his role at one of Chicago's Top New Restaurants in 2007.  After successfully heading two restaurants, Soth transitioned into catering as the executive chef/chef consultant at Catered By Design, an award-winning company voted Chicago's #1 Wedding Caterer by The Knot magazine and Chicago's Best Caterer by Wedding Wire.  He strives to introduce a local and seasonal cuisine while challenging the palates of guests.


Contribution

Contributors get to see Fourpenny House come to life in the quaint village of La Mesa, California.  With an existing space and design and construction beginning, every dollar contributed brings us closer to opening the doors to this unique concept.  Join Fourpenny's growing party of supporters and fans!

With our $75,000 raised we will be able to compliment investor funds for construction of the kitchen and front of house.  As our campaign is not fixed to the target amount, any amount raised will be of great benefit.  The building we occupy is currently an empty shell so we need to add in all our utilities and level the concrete floor in the kitchen, along with several partitions in the dining and bar area.  Our building dates to 1926 and we are excited to restore the building to its original beauty.


Risks & Challenges

Starting a restaurant is never easy, and there are many risks in this industry.  One way we are addressing the narrow profits in the restaurant industry is by focusing on beer and spirits, which provide high profits with low labor costs, and by brewing in-house we can lower of cost-of-goods and raise profits even higher.   

Owner Peter Soutowood has lived in La Mesa for over a dozen years and watched the demographic shift younger and more cosmopolitan.  The city is undergoing a renaissance and with a recently-completed street improvement the Village has never looked better.  With our location right in the heart of the Village and as one of the few craft restaurants to serve La Mesa, the growth potential is phenomenal, something the owners and investors are counting on for the success of Fourpenny House.

By keeping construction costs trimmed down and being creative with materials and design, we hope to minimize debt load and drive the restaurant to profitability as quickly as possible.  Utilizing seasonal and local foods means both higher quality and lower costs in both transportation and exclusivity.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Our success relies on the quality and consistency of our product and service, but it depends on our customers and fans.  By keeping a buzz around our forthcoming opening, sharing our pictures and posts, and telling friends and family about this exciting new gastropub means we will be busy from the first evening we open.  Spread the word, spread the love!

story:
Payment

You can now contribute or make an easy installment payments of [Two Payments of $75.00 or Three Payments of $50.00].   

Mission & Vision

The overall mission of the campaign/project is to uplift and beautify the Historic sacred grounds at Ovaherero Traditional Authority (OTA) Erf 1755. Site to be known as Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC).

Specific Goals & Objectives

•1) Erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) Construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) Landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) Construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) and lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months.


Beneficiaries

•The project will have positive social and economic impact to Okahandja and Namibia.

•The project will reinvigorate community pride by raising all three community flags plus the national flag, boost unity and increase annual attendees.

•Furthermore, the project will economically create jobs and aid in the fight against poverty.

•The project will beautify the Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) site, the city of Okahandja at its best, and attract tourists to the city of Okahandja, and increase Namibian tourist industry.

Pledges/Donation:

1) One time $200 CAD for those in the Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK, Europe, Russia, China, APAC & rest of outside world). Also, one time  N$200 NAD direct FNB deposit (Namibia, Botswana, South Africa & rest of Africa) contribution.  

2) Your NAME as a sponsor get enshrined on "FOUNDERS' WALL". 

3) Take a tour every August at Okahandja and showcase family & friends of your positive contribution to the community.  NOW to LEAVE A LEGACY BEHIND AT OKAHANDJA FOREVER".

Deadline: December 2016. The Project anticipated completion date is August 2017.

Goals

The overall strategic vision in addition to specific desired goals & objectives as stated above, are:

•1) Erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) Construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) Landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) Construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) Construct lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months,

•6) Construct track field - horses & troops,

•7) Herero House (HH)- office & dignitaries use,

•8) Ovaherero Museum, 

•9) Multipurpose Community Hall to generate weekly/monthly revue for OTA,

•10) Life animal stalls, 

•11) Construct sitting benches,

•12) Heroes Wall (HW) for our fallen heroes and heroines, 

•13) and statues of our fallen Paramount Chiefs/Chiefs, etc.

The Three (3) Project Phases:

Phase One (1):Resources Mobilization.

Phase Two (2):Implementation/Execution.

Phase Three (3):Project Delivery.

We kick off Phase One (March 1st - December 2016). We need your help to make this vision a reality and to give you a chance to shape the future of your community. 

Risk & Challenges:

The goal is to have an open and transparent system in place to account for community funds. In order to achieve the financial goal each donor's name will appear on this site under backers,  a not for profit trust account is opened, online Namibian banking with instant notification will form part of the check and balances.  A monthly financial statement & quarterly auditing report will be released to the public per financial flowchart.  The diaspora communities agreed that all funds collected  through OCP network will strictly be used towards construction and maintenance of OCC at Erf 1755.

"

Ngatu Ungure Ovyetu

"


Disclaimer: Donations are non-refundable. All donated funds will be exclusively used for construction and maintenance of Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) at Erf 1755. The donor or his/her heir(s) relinquish(es) future claim of ownership of donated funds or structures constructed with donated funds. All properties on Erf 1755 will be community properties managed or controlled by OTA (OvaHerero Traditional Authority), its leasing agent(s) or successor entities. Failure to make full payment of $150 will result in your name not to be placed on the Founders' Wall.

story:
For The Career Nudge events, we'll be hosting one-on-one half hour career coaching sessions from Saturday, October 1st to Monday, October 31st, during weekday, evening and Saturday hours, at no cost to the participants. These sessions will be hosted onsite at our office New York City as well as via video-conference, for those who are remote/unable to attend in person. During these coaching sessions we'll cover the following topics (depending on the needs of the individual):

  • Resume review and edit recommendations
  • Drafting a cover letter for your desired role and industry
  • Building an effective network
  • Pursuing a promotion
  • Crucial conversations with your manager/team member
  • Interview prep, offer review and the negotiation
  • Considering a career change & talking through next steps
  • Current career challenges specific to the attendee

In addition, we’ll end the month of coaching with a complimentary “Career Success Secrets Breakfast” session, which will include a panel of guest speakers on Saturday, October 29th to give the women who’ve been coached all month an opportunity to hear from successful women and men that are leaders in their respective fields. Our goal for the breakfast session is for the women to walk away inspired, encouraged and confident about their own future potential.

Recent college graduates as well as women who have been in the workforce 15+ years have benefited from the counsel, encouragement and resources provided by Squad Square. In speaking with clients, we've learned that there's a deeper need from women eager to advance in their careers who have no one to discuss their hopes and ideas with, which has caused missteps and deferred dreams. From October 1st to October 31st Squad Square plans to reach over 500 of these women so they have success stories to share with and inspire the other women and men in their circles. We can't wait to get started! Please help us spread the word J

“Imagine if all 7 billion people in the world received coaching to maximize their potential this week. It would change how humans develop. Even being coached just once per year to develop strengths can dramatically change one's life journey and improve the odds for an extraordinary life.”—Jim Clifton (CEO, Gallup)

75% of the needed resources and services will be provided by Squad Square. Here’s what the requested funding will be used for:

  • Graphic design, website management & advertising before the event
  • Marketing during event
  • Venue space (usage of the private/conference rooms of our current shared office space)
  • Printing costs (worksheets, resources and other takeaways for attendees), paper, postage photography
  • Refreshments for volunteers and coaches; Water for attendees
  • Gifts for guest speakers at breakfast event ($50 value each)
  • Coffee, fruit & pastries for breakfast event with speakers
  • Local travel expenses (subway)
  • Coaching consultant compensation (for evening and weekend hours)
  • Miscellaneous expenses


Here's where you come in! These are the different funding options you can choose from as well as the gifts & benefits you receive with each one:

Exclusive Event Sponsor, $8,000: Your company name & logo prominently displayed on our website listed as the exclusive event sponsor and on all event marketing, email communications, social media, and related promotion materials; Gift: One-day onsite training session for your business/team (i.e. effective people management, constructive feedback, increasing employee engagement, strategic recruitment campaigns)

Event Partner & breakfast sponsor, $5,000: Your company name & logo listed on our website as an event partner; your name/company name & logo displayed as sponsor at event breakfast; Gift: One-day remote training session for your business/team (i.e. effective people management, constructive feedback, increasing employee engagement, strategic recruitment campaigns)

Patron $1,000 (gift – two months of career coaching sessions or one 2-hour remote training session for your business/team, for you or give as a gift; your name listed on the Patron Donor’s list on our website and event materials)

Backer $500 (gift – one month of career coaching sessions [1/week], for you or give as a gift; your name listed on the Backer Donor’s list on our website and event materials)

Supporter $250 (gift – two personal career coaching sessions, for you or give as a gift; your name listed on the Supporter Donor’s list on our website)

Ally $100 (gift – resume review and rewrite, for you or give as a gift; your name listed on the Ally Donor’s list on our website)

Friend $50 (gift – review of your resume with edit suggestions; your name listed on the Friend Donor’s list on our website)

Helper $25 (your name listed on the Helper Donor’s list on our website)

Women interested in participating in the Career Nudge this October can sign up here: https://squadsquare.com/careernudge

story:
Short Summary

Por que importar do Brasil?

O Brasil é um país produtor nato, tanto de produtos de primeira necessidade quanto de produtos acabados. O Brasileiro tem o empreendedorismo e a criatividade nas veias. Produtos brasileiros podem ser bons, bonitos e baratos. Podem realmente te surpreender.

O Pequeno/Medio produtor tem a capacidade de criação, produção em pequena escala, customização em casos específicos. É Versátil, é empreendedor, é criativo, é flexível.

E ainda temos a famosa e não menos importante receptividade do Brasileiro: somos o povo mais receptivo do mundo!

Porém, embora sejamos a maior economia da américa Latina e a segunda na América, estamos atrás de países como Chile e Colombia no quesito Exportação. Motivo: não sabemos como vender nossos produtos, nao temos apoio suficiente aos pequenos e médios produtores, não somos reconhecidos mundialmente, não somos vistos o bastante.

Por estes motivos, optamos por iniciar uma plataforma de exportação (NÃO É UM E-COMMERCE), uma vitrine de produtos brasileiros, caseiros ou industrializados, mas de excelente qualidade, voltados especificamente para a Exportação, para que o mundo possa  experimentar um pouco do que temos a oferecer.

Nesta plataforma vamos disponibilizar conteúdo para que consumidores e vendedores comuniquem-se através de catálogos, links, fotos, enfim, tudo o que possa facilitar a aproximação, a visibilidade, o contato e a venda.

Estamos em tempos difíceis. A Saída para as dificuldades é a união de forças por meio de grupos que, apoiando-se com um mesmo objetivo, tornam factíveis possibilidades até então jamais exploradas. É o caso da exportação em grupo, a consolidação de soluções financeiras, econômicas e logísticas para redução de custos, a famosa e atual rede do bem.

Escolhemos 30 empresas para iniciarmos o projeto: 30 empresas com as quais formamos um profile inicial, de profissionais liberais e empresas de pequeno porte (micro empresas). Delas faremos o primeiro lançamento do site, a primeira 'subida' de fotos e imagens, catálogos e documentos técnicos. Com estas 30 empresas formaremos nosso primeiro trabalho em conjunto, a primeira consolidação de mercadorias para exportação.

Me chamo Cintia, sou sócia e co-fundadora da Zeit Trading, uma comercial exportadora que tem como objetivo tornar possível projetos de crescimento dos pequenos e médios produtores brasileiros por meio da exportação, permitindo-lhes alcançar todos os cantos do mundo, seja qual for a distancia.

Entenda nossa causa:

http://mulhermagnifica.com.br/2016/11/12/viva-e...

http://revistapegn.globo.com/Mulheres-empreende...

http://www.painellogistico.com.br/wp-content/up...

 

What We Need & What You Get

Qualquer ajuda é valida. Quanto mais contribuições conseguirmos, maior será o numero de produtores, artesãos, fabricantes e profissionais liberais envolvidos. Maior será também a variedade de produtos que podemos oferecer na plataforma, aumentando a visibilidade dos vendedores para todo o mundo. Pequenas lojas, pequenas redes... vamos integrar pessoas, integrar redes, produzir trabalho para todos.

Produtos como doces e alimentos típicos brasileiros, artesanato, cosméticos naturais e de qualidade feitos com essências brasileiras e plantas da nossa flora, além de produtos para decoração, utilidades domésticas, maquinários para pequenos e medios empreendedores em todo o mundo, vestuários, bijuterias  e sapatos feitos a mão ou em pequena escala (o que garante em alguns casos a exclusividade do produto), brinquedos educativos e móveis inteligentes infanto-juvenis (móveis com mais de uma utilidade, que nao se perdem com o crescimento da criança), Bebidas alcoólicas artesanais (a nossa verdadeira e brasileiríssima cachaça), produtos 100% naturais (inclusive alguns veganos)... são nossas opções iniciais.

Visite nosso site: www.zeittrading.com.br e www.zeitrep.com.br e saiba mais.

Todo o investimento recebido será aplicado na composição da plataforma online de consulta aos produtos e em sua promoção nas redes sociais. Se o valor superar nossas expectativas, partiremos então para a segunda parte do projeto: uma plataforma de EXPORTAÇÃO ONLINE, para que qualquer consumidor/comprador, em qualquer parte do mundo, possa comprar qualquer quantidade e receber o produto na porta de sua casa, com conforto, rapidez e segurança. Todo o processo de exportação será online, inclusive o rastreamento.

The Impact

Fomentando a exportação também dos pequenos e médios produtores criamos um círculo de consumo que deverá, em um periodo curto de tempo, proporcionar um movimento financeiro positivo entre fabricantes de materia prima, produtores, profissionais e mão de obra ocasional e prestadores de serviços.

Este movimento positivo conectará pessoas, promoverá novas oportunidades e perspectivas a quem embora não tenha uma estrutura física, tem boa vontade, criatividade e coragem de sobra para inovar, reinventar-se, seguir adiante.

Acreditamos que um pequeno movimento positivo se propaga como ondas, como quando lançamos uma pedrinha na água: podemos enxergar onde a pedra caiu, mas não podemos ver até onde a onda provocada pelo atrito da pedra com a água chegou. Este movimento pode estender-se a lugares que jamais pensamos alcançar, pode encontrar pelo caminho pessoas realmente determinadas a ajudar, cooperar, fazer parte. Pode criar novos movimentos ao redor do mundo, em favor dos que precisam, além do simples interesse financeiro da compra e da venda.

Se cada um de nós colocar um pouco de nosso know-how e fé neste projeto, nao só ajudaremos pessoas mas daremos a elas uma nova perspectiva para recomeçar.

    Risks & Challenges

    Vivemos em um país cujas regras aduaneiras são nada flexíveis, e sabemos que a nossa Aduana é um tanto quanto engessada em termos funcionais.

    Sabemos também que os nossos pequenos e medios produtores devem, ao longo do processo, adaptar-se às expectativas dos países importadores, devem seguir regras técnicas e aprender mais sobre o que exigem as aduanas dos países compradores.

    São estes dois pontos os maiores desafios que teremos no decorrer da ação. Todavia iniciamos esta campanha justamente para provocar a mudança, para atrair a atenção dos produtores, quaisquer que sejam suas condições e tamanho, para o mercado exterior. Este será nosso maior investimento: incentivar e apoiar os novos exportadores em suas necessidades de preparação e adaptação, orienta-los, torna-los capazes e presentes nos cantos mais longínquos do globo.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Uma maneira de ajudar-nos nesta campanha é atrair o olhar do máximo de pessoas mundo afora para o produto 'Made in Brazil'. Propague esta ideia nas redes sociais, incentive a compra de pequenos e médios produtores brasileiros e ajude-nos a criar um movimento comercial positivo e consciente!
story_txt:
Short Summary

Por que importar do Brasil?
O Brasil é um país produtor nato, tanto de produtos de primeira necessidade quanto de produtos acabados. O Brasileiro tem o empreendedorismo e a criatividade nas veias. Produtos brasileiros podem ser bons, bonitos e baratos. Podem realmente te surpreender.
O Pequeno/Medio produtor tem a capacidade de criação, produção em pequena escala, customização em casos específicos. É Versátil, é empreendedor, é criativo, é flexível.
E ainda temos a famosa e não menos importante receptividade do Brasileiro: somos o povo mais receptivo do mundo!
Porém, embora sejamos a maior economia da américa Latina e a segunda na América, estamos atrás de países como Chile e Colombia no quesito Exportação. Motivo: não sabemos como vender nossos produtos, nao temos apoio suficiente aos pequenos e médios produtores, não somos reconhecidos mundialmente, não somos vistos o bastante.

story:
If we reach our $66,770 funding goal:

All funds received will go towards realizing SAAS.

If we don't reach our $66,770 funding goal:

All funds received will go towards realizing SAAS, with the possibility for each contributor to ask for a refund and get his/her money back.




A personal message from the inventors of SAAS:

Hi!

We are extremely proud to present you something unique and exceptional.
Something that the world hasn't seen yet.

We have been working tirelessly to introduce you to the future of airbags - the revolutionary Speed Adjusted Airbag System (SAAS).

And we need YOU to help make it happen!


| Introducing SAAS |

World’s Best AIRBAG SYSTEM with 15 Stages

is a crowdfunding campaign that aims to improve airbag safety worldwide.


Our goal with this campaign is:

  • To raise awareness of the potential of SAAS and its possibilities.
  • To raise funds to create a 3D animation of SAAS and how it functions.
  • To raise funds to attend automotive industry seminars and present SAAS with the 3D animation.
  • To lay the foundation for implementing SAAS into future car safety designs.


Before you start scrolling down, here is our contact information.
We'd love to hear from you! Follow us on Twitter and Facebook:



A quick overview of what we will present you on our campaign page:

1. Let's talk about SAAS

2. How SAAS works

3. Airbags today

4. SAAS' key features

5. Our inspiration

6. Our vision with SAAS

7. Our goal with SAAS

8. Why we need you

9. How you can help (Perks!)


Most advanced airbags are designed to:

A) Not deploy at all for low-speed impacts.

B) Deploy the airbag with a moderate force for most collisions, reserving the maximum deployment force for the severest of collisions only.

SAAS' airbag unit features a tailored deployment force to match the severity of any crash. A pyrotechnic inflator divided into 4 chambers, each connected to the airbag through a valve, combine to 15 unique deployment stages. This even allows for a safe airbag deployment at low-speed impacts where current airbags don't deploy at all.

SAAS is designed to be an integrated part of any car safety design. By using radar it predicts the expected g-force at impact and keeps the most appropriate stage ready for deployment.

SAAS can reduce airbag-attributed injuries and fatalities.



Safety Features: (1) Collision Detection. (2) Pre-Crash Measures.
SAAS' PCS can detect an inevitable collision and prepare for it by adjusting the airbag deployment force to the predicted impact speed, by keeping 1 of 15 deployment stages ready to deploy at impact.

The video below demonstrates how SAAS’ PCS operates before impact:



Because every car crash is different, SAAS optimizes airbag protection for each crash by deploying the airbag with the force that best matches the detected g-force at impact. If necessary, the airbag control unit will correct the predicted deployment force. The heavier the measured g-force, the higher the cushion effect of the airbag.

The video below demonstrates how SAAS operates in the event of a collision:


SAAS includes and combines the following components:

  • Doppler radar
  • Central Control Module (CCM)
  • Airbag Control Unit (ECU)
  • 4 crash sensors
  • Customized pyrotechnical airbag inflator
  • Speedometer

The key component of SAAS is the airbag inflator, which is divided into 4 individual propellant chambers with a solid chemical propellant charge.
Chambers 1 to 4 have relative output forces of respectively 1, 2, 4 and 8, which can combine into 15 different inflation forces, using the binary system.

Airbags are universally recognized as an indispensable part of car safety designs. Airbags protect car occupants from injuries and even death during a crash.

When it comes to life-saving technology, new airbags are continuously being designed, tested and studied. Ever since the original airbag prototype in 1963, various types of airbags have been designed to specifically protect drivers and passengers from certain kinds of trauma.

However, despite the obvious benefits of airbags, present-day airbags still have potentially dangerous characteristics during inflation.
SRS airbags are designed to provide additional protection, but still pose a risk for serious or fatal injuries. The ones most at risk for airbag-attributed injuries are elderly, women and children.

Ask yourself this: "Doesn't it seem questionable that only 3 airbag deployment stages would fit the wide speed range of modern vehicles?"
We are convinced 3 stages is not sufficient at all.

We became aware of this when two people shared their personal experience. They pointed out it was the force of the airbag that injured them and not the crash itself. More research on forums confirmed that many people are being injured by the airbag deployment force and not by the forces of the car crash itself.





SAAS is inspired by people who got seriously injured during a car crash.
People who didn't get injured by the effects of the crash itself, but by the force of an inflating airbag. That could have happened to any one of us.

Is this risk really an acceptable reality?

Because we realize that people are being harmed by something that was designed to protect us, we know something has to change.
This is why we invented a safer airbag system - SAAS.


In an era of constantly evolving technology, should we really settle for mechanics which, even though designed to protect, also have the potential to kill?

We designed SAAS to maximize airbag safety and reduce airbag attributed injuries. It should raise the bar for airbag safety worldwide.




Our 3 big steps to realize SAAS:

We will...

1. Finalize our funding on IndieGoGo and send off the perks.

2. Create a visually clear and effective 3D animation of SAAS.

3. Attend seminars to present SAAS to the automotive industry.


Our ultimate goal with SAAS:
We want to make SAAS a standard part of future car safety designs and improve airbag safety on a worldwide scale, ultimately saving more lives.

 How we, the inventors, are going to accomplish our goal:

To accomplish our goal we will use the funds we receive through IndieGogo to pursue the following 2 milestones:

  • Milestone 1 | SAAS 3D Animation | (Image below)

  • Milestone 2 | Presenting SAAS on Automotive Seminars | (Image below)


Why do these 2 milestones need funding on IndieGogo?

Milestone 1 | SAAS 3D Animation — needs funding to create a clear convincing presentation of what SAAS can do and what it can mean for car safety worldwide.

Milestone 2 | Presenting SAAS on Automotive Seminars — needs funding to make trips & visits to auto seminars possible by covering accommodation and travel expenses.

 Milestone 1 | SAAS 3D Animation
 — Why do we need a 3D animation of SAAS?
A professional 3D animation of SAAS is important because we will use it when presenting SAAS on automotive seminars. We need a powerful visual presentation to show the automotive industry how the airbag system operates in real-life situations, including the behavior of its components when detecting a possible collision and during an actual crash.

Milestone 2 | Attending Automotive Seminars
 — Why do we need to attend to automotive seminars?
Attending automotive seminars is important because we need to present SAAS to the automotive industry to take it to the next level. Companies, engineers and legislators within the automotive industry need to be convinced of the necessity of our 15-stage airbag system and get it implemented in the safety design of next generation cars.

To make SAAS a reality, we launched this campaign to raise funds for 3 things:

1. To create the 3D animation of SAAS:

We want to hire a professional animation studio to create a top-notch 3D animated video of SAAS and its features and functions.

2. To present SAAS at automotive seminars:

We want to present SAAS to the automotive industry, using the professional 3D animation. We need to cover our travel and accommodation costs.

3. To work on SAAS full-time:

We take our mission serious. To get SAAS implemented in future car safety designs, we'll have to work on the project full-time and promote it continuously. Therefore, Living expenses need to be covered.

SAAS campaign budget breakdown:
Creating the SAAS 3D presentation $ 13,200
Presenting SAAS on automotive industry seminars $ 24,000
(this accounts for travel, accommodation & seminar fees)

12 months living expenses: $ 22,000
Perk costs & Sending off the perks: $ (depends on perk demand)
Unforeseen expenses: $ 1,500

Net campaign funding goal: $ 60,700
10% IGG / PayPal / credit card handling fees $ 6070

Total funding goal $66770

We have chosen a flexible funding campaign. If we wouldn't reach our funding goal, all funds raised will always go directly towards presenting and promoting SAAS to the automotive industry.


Join us now by picking a perk of your choice!

Please click on one of the thumbnails below
to view a detailed picture of the perk:

Thank you for checking out our campaign page!

To create the 3D animation of SAAS:We want to hire a professional animation studio to create a top-notch 3D animated video of SAAS and its features and functions.2. To present SAAS at automotive seminars:We want to present SAAS to the automotive industry, using the professional 3D animation. We need to cover our travel and accommodation costs.3. To work on SAAS full-time:We take our mission serious. To get SAAS implemented in future car safety designs, we'll have to work on the project full-time and promote it continuously. Therefore, Living expenses need to be covered.


SAAS campaign budget breakdown:
Creating the SAAS 3D presentation $ 13,200
Presenting SAAS on automotive industry seminars $ 24,000
(this accounts for travel, accommodation & seminar fees)

12 months living expenses: $ 22,000
Perk costs & Sending off the perks: $ (depends on perk demand)
Unforeseen expenses: $ 1,500

Net campaign funding goal: $ 60,700
10% IGG / PayPal / credit card handling fees $ 6070

Total funding goal $66770

We have chosen a flexible funding campaign. If we wouldn't reach our funding goal, all funds raised will always go directly towards presenting and promoting SAAS to the automotive industry.

 
 Join us now by picking a perk of your choice!


Please click on one of the thumbnails belowto view a detailed picture of the perk:

                   
Thank you for checking out our campaign page!

story:
CURRENT STATUS: Pre-Production - PCB's are being engineered, accepting pre-orders, raising additional funds to cover those costs. Images below are to illustrate final product which may vary slightly (for the better)!

FULLY PATENTED & TRADEMARKED

that's a ™ and a ®


What is the PiNAPoL? A Network Attached Processing System that will allow multiple microcomputers to work in tandem to process data, graphics, audio and video more quickly than todays hardware. Allowing for up to 12 Microcomputer modules (“Slivers”) to be inserted at the same time (allowing you to completely customize your system), and the ability to daisy-chain multiple PiNAPoL systems together, allows for Potentially Infinite upgrade possibilities. The main PiNAPoL System runs using Linux to provide all of the functionality, however the Slice can run on any mainstream operating system such as Windows, Mac or Linux!

What is the “Slice”? A Mini-Computer that sits on your desk/workspace that can replace the current computer with the ability to use your current peripherals (Mice/Keyboards/Monitors/Etc.). The Slice contains 1 slot for a Sliver to be inserted and can be tailored to your exact needs! These Mini- Computers are able to run on our own Linux OS, or any mainstream version of Linux, Windows, or Mac allowing you to get started into the technology without the worries of too much change!

The Slice comes standard with 8 GB of RAM, expandable to 32 GB. Simply Add a xPU Sliver and you have a fully functional high performance computer!

*This is all you need to get started into the new technology. Just 1 Slice with 1 xPU Sliver and you are up and running! Grab the Starter Kit Perk and get started with the future of computing today!

(xPU = CPU or GPU)


What are these “Slivers”? The Slivers are the brains of the computer system and come in a variety of flavors. Each Sliver serves a different purpose and can be combined in a PiNAPoL System in multiple different configurations. Below is a brief description of the Slivers and what they can offer you!

1. XPU Slivers – Contain 1 CPU/1 GPU or 1 CPU/3GPU and can be setup in multiple configurations based on if you need more processing power or more graphics power. These will use the Intel Atom CPU and the nVidia Tegra K1 GPU.

2. Storage Slivers – Contain 2 slots for m.2 SATA Solid State Storage Modules. Coming standard with 500 GB per Sliver, they are upgradable to 2 TB of storage per module.

3. Home/Office Automation Slivers – Used to connect to smart devices in the home allowing you to fully automate the process of turning on/off lights, enabling of disabling devices in the home, and also allows you to set it for vacation mode, which will (for example) turn on/off lights, TV, Radio, etc, to simulate activity in the home to deter intruders!

4. Home/Office Security Slivers – Contains a specially designed microphone which can detect the sounds of glass breaking, CO or Fire alarms going off, can notify you as well as the local e911 services in the even of fire or break-ins. These Slivers can talk to up to 16 wireless security cameras PER Sliver, giving you a great view of your home or office. If Paired with the home automation and GPS sliver, it can also notify police/fire personnel to your home, and even unlock smart locks on your doors in the event you are not home and a fire happens. This also notifies you on your BLADE or cell phone in the event of an emergency.

5. GPS Track & Trace Sliver - Can be used in the home or office to track cell phones, company vehicles, or notify e911 services (if paired with the security module) to allow emergency personnel to locate your home. This is great for keeping track of the kids, pets, vehicles, and also helps if you system is ever stolen, you can track it!

6. Professional Audio Sliver – Used specifically to allow users to plug-in additional audio equipment such as mix boards, as well as assist with rendering of audio tracks, creating songs, rendering CD-Audio, or creating blockbuster movie soundtracks!

7. Professional Video Sliver - Used to assist with everything from CAD, Graphics, and Video rendering allowing even the part time artist to begin working on animations or feature length films. There are ports available to plug in external equipment such as camcorders or other video devices which you may want to re-master media from (VHS to DVD for example).

Let's never forget about the B.L.A.D.E. - Our handheld control center allowing you full remote access to your PiNAPoL from anywhere in the world using 4G LTE and XLTE technologies, as well as having a higher level of alerts for security, system health, and allowing you to connect to your security system from afar and check in on your home or office!

That's not all this can do, it is also a cellular phone with some amazing features. For example, this device comes with a 720p DLP projector on the top of the phone as well as a stylus with a laser pointer, 18 MP camera, and starts with 128 GB of solid state storage, upgradable to 1.2 TB! Thats an amazing amount of storage and power right in the palm of your hand. This device will run on either our own Linux based OS, or Android and is powered by the nVidia Tegra K1 Processor!


HOW IT ALL WORKS: The very simple explanation of that is ... You can either start with just the Slice and a XPU Sliver and replace your current computer with newer technology, or you can jump right in and immerse yourself in the future RIGHT NOW!

By jumping to a larger setup, let's say "The Big Boy!" for example. You will receive 2 Slices, with the proper Sliver modules to make them run. You will also receive the PiNAPoL system, which then becomes your whole home/office server system with quite a lot of power. The PiNAPoL will be able to handle all of the networking functions you need such as;

Multiple Internet Connections, including the ability to bond them together for more speed OR offering more bandwidth for multiple users. This setup will also allow data to be sent from the Slices, to be processed much faster on the PiNAPoL and then sent back to the Slices as a finished product. These transactions take place in a fraction of the time compared to even top end gaming systems we have today!

As you can see, there are many different options available and should you require any assistance with customizing your system or you need a bit more information than what we have provided, please don't hesitate to contact us!

Your PiNAPoL, Your Way! Scroll Down for more info!!!


















* The prices for this campaign are preliminary. They won't be this cheap for long.

** Product fulfillment is set for the fourth quarter of 2016 (most likely sooner).
*** Images are for illustrative purposes only. The end product may change slightly (but for the better).

story:
UNAVAILABLE ANYWHERE ELSE.


 

I kept moving my left arm from place to place in an effort to find a comfortable, impact-free spot when driving. No Luck! You know that feeling, right? You park your elbow on the sill, then the armrest that is way too low and often too hard, then the steering wheel. And what about that dead space between the door and seat? 

I've been driving for many years, and simply tolerated the discomfort all this time. So, with the help of family, friends, and a fellow Marine I designed and we created a solution we've been using for years. Now, it's time to present it to the world.


      

                             There's Only One Place to Get Cruise Cushions.

                                                SEE PERKS BELOW

                                  

  •  From the U.S. Government's National Institute of Health. 
    Drivers’ Elbow: A Cause of Ulnar Neuropathy (read). 

EASY TO CLEAN.

We Use Only The Highest Quality Non-Stretch Cotton Velvet Fabric: 

  • Silky-smooth. elegant but rugged, non-stretch cotton velvet with specially woven backing. Double-stitched, with sculpted, formed FLEX-FOAM Insert. 
  •  NO VELVETEEN, PATTERNED or CRINKLY MATERIAL.
  • They are ergonomic—fit the curve and shape of your body. 
  • They end elbow pressure-point pain and arm fatigue.
  •  They cushion your forearm—even upper arm.
  • Full Size: Exquisitely plush and Soft, 
  • Choose your colors during post-campaign survey

  • Logo-side: After the campaign you choose which color upon which the CC-Logo is placed for the Custom Duo Color Option 'B'. 

HOW FLEXIBLE IS IT?

Fold it, Twist it, Bend it, Bundle It, Crush it, Scrunch it, Squash it, Squeeze it.

      


                Note: Dimensions may vary fractionally and almost immeasurably.

                                     

  • Reduces driver's elbow and left arm impact when driving.
  • Reduces stress.
  • Provides comfort while increasing comfort.
  • Greatly Increases the 'driving pleasure factor'.
  • Fills the dead space between door and seat.

A Few Placement Suggestions:

  • Window sill placement. 
  • Armrestand dead space between seat and door
  • Added Benefit: Filling The 'Console Gap.' 
    When placed on left and/or driver or passenger side, little if anything can fall between the gap between the seats and console.


PROBLEMS CAN SERVE AS INSPIRATION.

Necessity is often the mother of invention. It's true! 
Being an engineer and a Marine helps inspire the belief there are always solutions. 

                                            

MORE USES

 

                                From idea, to design, to patent, to reality, to you.


CRUISE CUSHIONS™ make driving less stressful for car and truck drivers and for other modes of travel.


     

                              CHOOSE YOUR COLOR(S) FOR YOUR INTERIOR.


                  black | red | burgundy | cream | purple | gray | green | dark blue

     

NOTE:

Although even ordinary designer cushions can be very expensive, we've kept our one-of-a-kind Cruise Cushions™ especially affordable for our IndieGoGo backers. The difference ranges up 30-50% less than our expected-post campaign retail. And they are Made-In-America and come with a 2-year warranty.     

                 

  

OFF RETAIL PRICE.  


                 black | red | burgundy | cream | purple | gray | green | dark blue




  • Per 100 =$2999 (minimum)
  • Your Logo: Cushions with your corporate/business logo, instead of CC logo
  • Color: Single color per order
  • Business: For your business use
  • Premium. As premium gift to your customers
  • Shipping: Free Shipping

And...

OUR BUGATTI 'Thank-You' card.

                                                              

Cruise Cushions™ are not available anywhere else, and are the perfect auto/home/office gift.


TWO YEARS.

Providing a warranty for our product genre is highly unusual. But we're so convinced of the quality of our product, we provide a 2-year warranty against manufacturing defects.


OUR GOAL: $5,000


If your goal is not reached, we will receive nothing. We structured it this way to ensure you that our promises will be kept.

With your purchase of our amazing Cruise Cushions ™ we hope to fulfill our goal of putting more Americans to work, especially veterans. 

As an inactive Marine, I know veterans make very dedicated and dependable employees. Young Americans also need gainful employment. And while we cannot make a huge impact, we can do what we can.

If our goal is exceeded, we can do even more and create other useful products similar to and in the same family as our Cruise Cushions ™.


 RISKS & CHALLENGES:


While there is risk associated with any business venture, we are committed to fulfilling all orders placed during our IndieGoGo Campaign, regardless of outcome. Your risk is minimal to none. 

We are determined to keep our cushions made in America...

and by Americans. With your help we will expand our capabilities and stay true to that vow.


  • Where are Cruise Cushions ™ made?
    IN AMERICA
  • May I choose the side for the logo?
    AFTER THE CAMPAIGN, IN OUR SURVEY
  • When do I get to choose the color?
    AFTER THE CAMPAIGN, IN OUR SURVEY.
  • May I purchase more than one 'Option'?
    YES. YOU MAY ORDER AS OFTEN AS YOU WISH.
  • Will Cruise Cushions™ be available in stores?
    NO. AFTER THE CAMPAIGN THEY WILL BE AVAILABLE AT CruiseCushion.com
  • May I mix colors in a single order?
    Colors may be mixed when ordering pairs or more—one color per pair. 



LEGAL NOTICE:

 Our delivery schedule is very carefully estimated. While the timeline may shift slightly, you will be kept informed and up-to-date. Our goal is to be even ahead of schedule.

We will do our best, and hope to deliver on time, and whatever happens we will keep you updated every step along the way.


 Leaders:


We thank you for your support. 
Our success depends upon you, our "Angel Backers.'

                               PLEASE USE SHARE BUTTONS ON RIGHT OF PAGE


Hi: Let me, Dr. Bob, Gene, Tim, Rachel, Jane, Natalya, and Mzia (not pictured), and Daniel (not pictured)—all under Gene's ingenious leadership—build a Cruise Cushion™ for you. We'll make sure our entire team gets your orders out on time, and with the quality we demand of ourselves, and the quality you deserve.

Please follow our progress here. See CruiseCushion.com for our posted THANK YOUs to our supporters and for other information.

 
Gary Conrad, V.P. Development/Marketing


Gene Cartwright, Creator/Inventor/President
My classic 1967 Olds-442, outfitted with black Cruise Cushions.

Grab your Cruise Cushions and join me on Route 66.

Thanks!

story:
I'm a mama's boy...


...and I learned to season food at the young age of 10 in the kitchen, standing by and helping my Mom as she cooked everything from Fried Chicken to Pepper Steaks and plenty of home-baked goodies.

Later, I watched my father as he opened his first restaurant selling burgers, sandwiches, pizza and more in the little store he owned next to my high school; and that's where the dream of starting my own restaurant began! 

My life has led me down various entrepreneurial paths, but I have never felt the timing was quite right to start a restaurant.  For the past 10 years, I have been blessed to build one of the most extensive networks of friends and associates throughout the city of Austin, and it was this same network that pushed me to take the leap of faith and start the very first ROLLING ROOSTER Food Truck. 

How It All Began

The journey began originally after I purchased a $30 fryer from Walmart and I would go out on my patio regularly and fry chicken wings; experimenting  with many different variables such as the types of oils, brands of chicken, cooking temperatures and a whole host of seasonings and spices. I spent  many evenings on my patio taste testing fried chicken wings and perfecting my craft . At one point, I began inviting friends and family over to rest my palate and be my taste testers! I would  go on to get the thumbs of from many of most critical friends.

Thanks to my mother, who is also my biggest supporter, I felt like we had finally concocted a wing recipe good enough to please the masses - and so began our official journey!

Unique. Authentic. Ethnic

I have created a simple yet effective menu that specializes in 3 proteins: chicken, fish and shrimp, all served with a rich buttermilk waffle. The Rolling Rooster food truck was the first of its kind in the Austin/Pflugerville area. Our food, shaped by decades of passion and soul, was well received by those looking for fresh food that wasn't frozen, well-seasoned and full of flavor in every bite!  As a result, we have been extremely blessed with huge growth and we are now ready to expand and build a brick-and-mortar restaurant to serve our growing fan base.

 The Need, The Niche

Our market research among our current customers revealed a diverse population in the Pflugerville area that craved a place to dine on a great tasting southern-infused menu that was cooked to perfection and made fresh upon ordering. At the restaurant, we will also serve breakfast for the early risers who can get their morning cup of coffee, in addition to eggs, bacon, grits and other savory dishes. 

Saturdays and Sundays will also feature our ALL YOU CARE TO EAT WING-INFUSED BRUNCH, a first-of-it's-kind offering in this marketplace. The NEW ROLLING ROOSTER facility is in Pflugerville, in the same shopping center as Pizza Hut, located right next door to Pflugerville High School. The lease is signed and renovations are almost complete. 

Exceptional Quality, Cost Efficient

We have boot-strapped the start-up funding of the restaurant  through today. Our team has worked extremely hard to design a restaurant that provides exceptional quality, and yet remains cost efficient. My mother taught me how to be a continuous shopper, and  although she is 1,100 miles away, her lessons remain as fresh as to me as when she originally passed them down. 

We are now in the final stages of outfitting the space with the proper kitchen equipment including a vent-hood with fire suppression system, refrigeration, stove, ovens, fryers, grills, signage and more. Additional future expenses include the build out of a patio deck, as well as purchasing supplies, chairs, tables and a robust point-of-sale system.

Casual, Comforting, Quick

Our concept for the Rolling Rooster in Pflugerville is a casual restaurant that offers counter-service with plenty of comfortable seating. The food can be enjoyed on premise or picked up to-go to be savored at home or work. Everything we serve will be freshly prepared, so it will not be fast food; but it will be great food prepared efficiently to accommodate you and your busy schedule. We will be open Mon - Fri from 8am - 7pm for breakfast, lunch and dinner and we will start out with 8am - 9pm hours on Saturday and Sunday. 

I am currently serving in the role as Head Chef and I am in the process of hiring passionate people to help me deliver my kaleidoscope of aromas, spices and tastes to all of you in the Pflugerville area - the  same way as we have done in our food truck on Howard Lane.  We anticipate that the renovation being completed in mid to late December, and plan to open the doors to lots grumbling greedy bellies shortly after - just in time to cater your personal or office party this holiday season!

The Campaign, The Donors, The Dream: #RockWithTheRoo!

We are looking for dedicated foodies, loyal friends and people passionate about helping local, homegrown entrepreneurs realize their dreams.  Our  goal is to raise $12,500. To date, we have invested tons of resources into the kitchen venting hood, fire suppression system, plumbing , counter build out, exterior signage and other major equipment and furnishings. 

We are turning to crowdfunding, not only to raise the money we need to cross the finish line, but we are also looking to connect the community to our project, and reward you for your support and passion. We would like to generate grassroots ambassadors and loyal followers of The Rolling Rooster and the unique foods and flavors of my cuisine.

Other Ways You Can Support

If you are unable to contribute to the campaign with money, please, help us spread the word among your personal network of friends who you know love a good meal and a local business success story!. Share the link to this page on Facebook. Tweet about it on Twitter. Post it on your blog. Email your peeps. Talk to your friends. 

Without your personal generosity, our dream cannot become a reality.  We are sincerely humbled and we are so grateful for your donation and support! 

Thank you!
story_txt:
I'm a mama's boy...
...and I learned to season food at the young age of 10 in the kitchen, standing by and helping my Mom as she cooked everything from Fried Chicken to Pepper Steaks and plenty of home-baked goodies. Later, I watched my father as he opened his first restaurant selling burgers, sandwiches, pizza and more in the little store he owned next to my high school; and that's where the dream of starting my own restaurant began! 
My life has led me down various entrepreneurial paths, but I have never felt the timing was quite right to start a restaurant.  For the past 10 years, I have been blessed to build one of the most extensive networks of friends and associates throughout the city of Austin, and it was this same network that pushed me to take the leap of faith and start the very first ROLLING ROOSTER Food Truck. 
How It All Began
The journey began originally after I purchased a $30 fryer from Walmart and I would go out on my patio regularly and fry chicken wings; experimenting  with many different variables such as the types of oils, brands of chicken, cooking temperatures and a whole host of seasonings and spices. I spent  many evenings on my patio taste testing fried chicken wings and perfecting my craft . At one point, I began inviting friends and family over to rest my palate and be my taste testers! I would  go on to get the thumbs of from many of most critical friends.
Thanks to my mother, who is also my biggest supporter, I felt like we had finally concocted a wing recipe good enough to please the masses - and so began our official journey!

story:
Former Jewish temple now seeing success as art space in Curtis Park

Once a Denver building with a murky future, Temple is now an art and nonprofit space with social mission

By Joe Vaccarelli
YourHub Reporter

POSTED:   11/19/2015 12:01:00 AM MSTADD A COMMENT| UPDATED:   5 DAYS AGO


Thomas Evans works on a painting of Peyton Manning in his studio space at Temple Art Space in Denver on Nov. 11, 2015. (Seth McConnell, Your Hub)

All Adam Gordon had about 18 months ago was ownership of an old Jewish temple in disrepair and a big idea for a social venture. 

Now, he is running a renovated building called the Temple, equipped with art-making spaces and a home for several small businesses that promote either artists or creative fields. The building will be full next month when the Temple Bakery opens up on the ground floor of the nearly 130-year-old building in Denver's Five Points neighborhood. 

Lewis Neeff watches a dollar bill in a fish tank as he works on crystalizing the appearance of the bill in his studio at the Temple art space. (Seth McConnell, YourHub)

The Temple, 2400 Curtis St., lies on the outskirts of both the Curtis Park Historic District and the River North Art District. Gordon was determined to make it into a place that was affordable for small businesses, nonprofits and artists who have found themselves priced out of the surrounding area and other parts of downtown. He bought the property with a partner he has since bought out. 

"Everyone in this entire process has understood that this building is important to the community and the social mission would be the primary focus," Gordon said. 

The Temple is home to places like PlatteForum, Processus, URBN Media, the Denver Zine Library and Sent(a)Mental Studios. It will add the Temple Bakery in December, which will be a joint venture between two bakers that will sell an assortment of baked goods during the day and pizza at night. It will also be a business incubator for two other bakers who can move on to start their own business after six months, with new proteges coming in at that time.

Gordon gave the bakery eight months of free rent and is running a crowdfunding campaign to raise money for the bakery, the zine library and an art project to adorn the south-facing wall at the Temple. 

"It's the perfect place for us," said Eden Myles, co-owner of the Temple Bakery. 

Lori Owicz uses a paint brush to apply ink to panel board as she works on a piece in her studio space at Temple Art Space in Denver on Nov. 11, 2015. (THE DENVER POST | Seth McConnell)

The zine library is home to more than 15,000 "zines" — self-published magazines — and runs workshops for those who make them. Their portion of the fundraising will go toward providing a permanent display area for the library. 

The library shares space with Sent(a)Mental Studios, an organization that works closely with the GLBT community and provides creative alternatives to suicide. 

The library's co-founder, Kelly "Shortandqueer" Costello, said the Temple was the ideal place to move after the library's previous location was sold in west Denver. It also provided a means to connect with like-minded folks. 

"The Temple became an opportunity to connect with those in that world," Costello said. 

The 20-plus artists who rent space pay about $1.25 per square foot monthly, averaging about $350 per month, making it an affordable place in an area where many artists have already left for cheaper places. Many of the studios are also of a size where the occupant can sublet some of his or her space.

Mario Zoots was the first artist to move in when the building was still being renovated. He said the building has a weird energy and jokingly said it might be haunted, but he plans to be there for years to come. 

"It's like a home away from home," Zoots said. "It's a community, and there's great and talented artists there."

Built in the late 1880s, the Temple has been home to three synagogues during its history, but was later home to a music venue that saw the likes of punk band Black Flag play there. More recently it has boarded-up windows and a hole in the roof. 

The building is listed on the National Register of Historic Places and could become part of the Curtis Park Historic District, something Curtis Park Neighbors president Joel Noble said has been a long-time goal. Noble said he was worried the building would be torn down before Gordon and his partner acquired it. 

"Now there's no sense of threat. While we do want it landmarked, there's not the pressure to get it done next week," Noble said 

Gordon, an artist, musician and social entrepreneur, bought the building cheap with the intent of keeping it cheap for the community. 

"It's just a model where the numbers can work," Gordon said. "I know developers would say you can't do it. This was just a social thing and we did it and it's cool."

Joe Vaccarelli: 303-954-2396, jvaccarelli@denverpost.com or @joe_vacc


Our Project

Your donation will fund the completion of three main projects inside the Temple, each directly benefiting the neighborhood and the community at large:

1.  Launching the Temple Bakery.

2.  Adding a permanent display area for the Denver Zine Library.

3.  Constructing a living wall and edible landscaping to beautify the building's facade and provide food for the bakery.

This project will connect the Denver community with all that’s created within the Temple’s walls while keeping local residents’ wallets and stomachs from being empty.

The Temple Bakery will also serve as a creative incubator for other food service entrepreneurs, offering culinary residencies and kitchen rental opportunities for local producers to safely create value added products.

Who We Are

The Temple at 2400 Curtis has a century of colorful religious, proprietary, and creative history behind it. The Temple exists today as a social venture established to preserve and revive an important landmark in the Five Points district while providing affordable studios to over twenty professional artists, local non-profits and small businesses. This includes the Processus creative workshop facility, community non-profit space for PlatteForum and the Denver Zine Library/Sent(a)Mental Studios, and creative business suites for URBN Media and Narro Design Firm.

Our Mission

Five Points, which holds the River North, or RiNo, and Curtis Park neighborhoods, is facing cultural dilution due to rapid gentrification. Homes are being bought and torn down to build modern condominiums alongside the future sites of businesses like Starbucks and Whole Foods.  Our mission is ultimately to maintain and productively develop Five Points’ status as a hub for creative culture by preserving the district’s original, artistic spirit alongside this growth.

The Temple Bakery

The Bakery and its nightly pizza shop would ideally be a gathering place for Five Points, bringing people together in the classic way that only food can. 

This project is an experimental collaboration between culinary visionaries Eden Myles (Five Points Pizza/Black Sheep Bakers) and Shauna Lott (The Long I Pie). They are currently working to develop this initiative with the RMMFI - Rocky Mountain Micro Finance Institute and DRI Goods Inc. - Denver Retail Incubator. 


The Denver Zine Library

The Denver Zine Library houses over 10,000 different zines, providing resources for entertainment and education. The Library’s location, immediately adjacent to the restaurant, will serve as a middle ground between the culinary and visual creative activities in the building. In order to respect the work on view, we need to build a more official display.

The Living Wall - Growing Local Food & Empowering Local Artists

The remainder of the money earned through this project will be set aside to further The Temple’s sense of individual identity by creating a ‘living wall’ and several mural projects. The living wall will be a two-story trellis where micro-greens and other edibles can be grown. Other open-source agricultural designs will be installed by the Denver Permaculture Guild. The food grown here will be used in the Temple Bakery’s kitchen. 

The mural initiative will fund around five current Temple artists to impart their own unique vision onto the building via paint and light sculpture, further connecting the creative activity inside with the world at large.

PERKS

Long i Pies 

Five Points Pizza

Five Points Pizza

Black Sheep Bakers T-Shirt

Five Points Pizza T-Shirt

Five Points Pizza - T-Shirt

Valhalla Cakes

Valhalla Cakes

 Valhalla Cakes

Ex Mario Zoots Artwork other Temple Artist work here 

Processus punchcard good for 20 hours of workshop time

PlatteForum 4600sq ft  Event Space


Other Initiatives

There are many other Temple projects underway that are not a part of this crowdfunding campaign. A gallery is being developed to feature rotating exhibitions curated by resident artists in addition to a permanent installation of an exhibition of photographs and memorabilia detailing the site’s illustrious past. 

There are long-term plans to turn the roof level into a space for more agricultural development and/or social activity, and there is another partial story of the building currently being developed for more creative space. There has even been discussion about programming for the consistent production of original creative written content. 

Thanks For Your Support!

With your generous help, we can close the loop on a small series of projects that will help hoist The Temple to a plateau of operation upon which it can sustain meaningful public engagement, embracing the creative spirit of local people who care about bettering their environment through their practice. Thank you for supporting our projects!
