story:
Summary

The late, lamented Terry Pratchett said, “A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read.” Well, we'd like to be your neighborhood black hole, times two.

We are so excited to announce that we've leased space for a second branch of Books With A Past in historic Savage Mill in Savage, Maryland! We've loved helping Western Howard County find just the right book for the last 20 years, and plan to keep our Glenwood store going strong. We want to share the love and bring an independent bookstore to a town that doesn't have one right now.

If you know us, you know we're devoted to print books. Curling up on a rainy day with a cozy e-reader just doesn't have the same ring to it. And what's a great book without a coffee mug, some cozy socks, and a scented candle to complement it? We want to bring lots of literary goodness to Savage Mill, and we need your help to do it right!


What We Need & What You Get

We've got the space and we've got the elbow grease, but what we need is a little cash to get going. We're going to do this as cost-effectively as possible, but our budget needs to be a bit larger. Our Glenwood store has about 65,000 books, 90% of which are used; the new location is going to host a more even mix of new and used books, as well as literary sidelines. And whoa baby, it takes a lot of books to fill 1,500 square feet!

(It doesn't look like much yet, but soon it will be filled with books!)

What we need:

  • Fixtures (bookcases, tables, etc) : $2500+
  • Inventory: $15,000+
  • Signage and Technology: $1000
What you get:
  • Double the reading pleasure!
  • Cool Books With A Past swag
  • Discounts in both stores
  • The undying affection of your local booksellers :-D


Risks & Challenges

We're committed to opening our second store. We've already signed the lease and plan to be open in time for the holidays, so our biggest challenge is getting everything together in time. Let's just say our fearless leader will be burning the candle at both ends for a few months.

$15,000 really isn't enough to completely build out a new store. We're covering the cost of operating expenses, licensing, etc. from other revenue sources and loans. We're improvising on the bookshelf and display front for the moment; it's more important to us to use our available funds to gather a wide array of books for you to covet (also known as inventory). The money we raise here will help us make our new store as fun and well-stocked as possible. All funds raised over the goal amount will continue to go to more books!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate (and even if you can!) you can talk about us. (Go ahead, we can take it.) Help us out by sharing our campaign and following along with our journey. We're really not hard to find: you can visit us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and our website!

Of course, the reason we're such fans of independent bookstores is that they are community gathering places. So you can stalk us online, but we would really prefer that you grace us with your presence in person! 

(Check out our future digs! Savage Mill is a historic building filled with small, independent businesses. A large percentage are women-owned.)

 little cash to get going. We're going to do this as cost-effectively as possible, but our budget needs to be a bit larger. Our Glenwood store has about 65,000 books, 
90% of which are used; the new location is going to host a more even mix
 of new and used books, as well as literary sidelines. And whoa baby, it
 takes a lot of books to fill 1,500 square feet!

(It doesn't look like much yet, but soon it will be filled with books!)
What we need:

Fixtures (bookcases, tables, etc) : $2500+
Inventory: $15,000+
Signage and Technology: $1000

What you get:
Double the reading pleasure!
 Cool Books With A Past swag 

Discounts in both stores
The undying affection of your local booksellers :-D

    
Risks & ChallengesWe're committed to opening our second store. We've already signed the lease and plan to be open in time for the holidays, so our biggest challenge is getting everything together in time. Let's just say our fearless leader will be burning the candle at both ends for a few months. $15,000 really isn't enough to completely build out a new store. We're covering the cost of operating expenses, licensing, etc. from other revenue sources and loans. We're improvising on the bookshelf and display front for the moment; it's more important to us to use our available funds to gather a wide array of books for you to covet (also known as inventory). The money we raise here will help us make our new store as fun and well-stocked as possible. All funds raised over the goal amount will continue to go to more books!
  
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't donate (and even if you can!) you can talk about us. (Go ahead, we can take it.) Help us out by sharing our campaign and following along with our journey. We're really not hard to find: you can visit us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and our website!
Of course, the reason we're such fans of independent bookstores is that they are community gathering places. So you can stalk us online, but we would really prefer that you grace us with your presence in person! 


(Check out our future digs! Savage Mill is a historic building filled with small, independent businesses. A large percentage are women-owned.)

story:
Short Summary

I plan to start raising Eurasian emerald darkhorns. This species is known for its mild temperament, relatively fast maturity, disease resistance, and prolific breeding habits. This means I'll be able to get a better yield.

I’ll purchase a buck dragon to start my venture. I’ll put him out to stud and charge fees for the service. Using the income from these stud fees I hope to purchase a doe dragon and use these as a breeding pair to begin raising my clan.

Through contacts at the local pub, I have located a reputable dragon dealer. He has found a dragon that will suit my needs. I have started corresponding with said dragon to explain my plan. At first he was a little indignant about the whole stud services business, but once he understood his role, he has become positively enthusiastic about the idea.

Based on the price quoted by the dealer, and the dragon importation fees and licensing, I'm hoping to raise $750 to purchase the darkhorn to begin my stud program.

Alternatively, I have found an Appalachian black in the possession of a California celebrity. He’s bad tempered, in frail health, missing teeth from years of soda drinking, and likes to mimic anyone he’s speaking with. This is an obnoxious beast, whose favorite game is to wave his claw around your body while yelling, “I’m not touching you.” The cost to buy and license this dragon is $150. I’d prefer to start with higher quality stock, but I’ll do what I must to achieve my dreams.

I took this business plan to bankers, but they were skeptical of my ability to turn a profit in this industry. They also closed my personal accounts. That’s why I’m posting it here in hopes of reaching out to dragon enthusiasts around the world.

Business Plan

Security

I will sell the dragons as security guardians. Given their legendary propensity for hoarding and protecting treasure, this seems like a gimme, but amazingly very few institutions use this age-old, hacker-proof security system. Gringotts uses them, but we disagree with their training methods and refuse to sell to them. Very few people are willing to burgle a place guarded by dragons—hobbits wearing magic rings being the exception. Banks and the Federal Reserve could profit by using more dragons.

Aviation

Another profitable use for these creatures is as novelty transportation. I plan to work with some saddle makers and the FAA to offer some short flight routes and in-city transportation.

Imagine arriving at your wedding or prom on dragonback! Each ride will include, of course, a photo with the mount, and a serving of roasted fowl, caught and served midflight.

Sustainable meat source and craft source

Dragon breeds differ, and raising wyverns (which breed like rabbits and lack the power of speech, in fact they’re not true dragons) for dragon steaks is another viable option. The meat is quite tender, with a naturally spicy flavor, similar to steak that has been marinated in hot sauce—a zippy alternative to standard fare

If you are offered dragon meat, it’s usually wyvern meat from a factory farm. These animals have limited abilities to move, being housed in small stalls. Often sedated and mutilated, corporations remove fangs and claws and clip wings to keep them manageable. They are heavily dosed with hormones and antibiotics to increase meat yield and to fight scale rot and eye infections. Our wyverns will be free range, and kept calm by letting them breathe a little fire now and then. We let them fly, knowing they’ll return to a home they love. This will provide a superior cut of meat from a happier beast.

I hate waste, so the bones, teeth, claws and hide of any animals harvested will be sold for various crafts, clothing, and magical ingredients.

Culling less desirable humans

The darkhorn I intend to purchase came up with this service: reducing an overabundance of humans by eating less desirable elements of society. His target prey would be Congress, anyone running for president (he proposes to allow the country to vote on who he eats by paying a small fee), and anyone who proves to be so hopelessly inept as to be polluting the gene pool (again, nominations would include a small fee). To be quite honest, he said he doesn't particularly like eating humans. High levels of sugar consumption have made people cloyingly sweet and cause him severe indigestion, but he’s willing to do this to improve society.

Alternative fuel source

Dragons make fire. Preliminary tests show that running geothermic-style pipes through your dragon’s den produces abundant heat. Dragon fire also burns hotter, even in your wood stove. That means you can run the stove at a lower level and use less wood in the winter. Because of the higher heat, there is less smoke and air pollution from dragon fires. A win for you, the dragon, and the environment.

Dragon conservation and repopulation

As many know, dragons have experienced significant population declines in the past century due to urban encroachment on their lands, loss of prey, and through the scourge of dragon slayers.

Dragons were once found throughout the U.S. Now their range and varieties are limited. You can still find the Great Basin sandwyrm and the Sonoran blue in less populated portions of western Utah, eastern Nevada, and Arizona. The only great wyrm still found in the east is the Great Lake yellowbeard, and that variety is really more of a sea serpent. Dragons play a vital role in the ecosystem. A healthy population of the Northwestern green keeps the Sasquatch population in Oregon, Washington, and Idaho at sustainable levels. 

We have successfully reintroduced grizzly bears and wolves into ecosystems and seen how they have proven to be an asset: wolves have brought balance to Yellowstone’s elk population. Reintroducing this megafauna to the Americas can have widespread benefits. As an example, the recent griffin attacks in northwestern Pennsylvania could have been averted by the presence of the dragons that once populated that area.

I’ll work with the Forest Service and states throughout the union to reintroduce these natural creatures in their historic ranges.

The dragon I have been corresponding with says these attitudes and practices are the result of an anti-dragon media that seeks every opportunity to play up supposed dragon offenses against people. With education we can do this.

Costs

Any additional funds raised will be used to expand my dragon clan and for related supplies and expenses. Examples are below:

·  Land. As you probably know, dragons are not herd animals, so raising a good population requires significant acreage.

·  Secrecy spells and security. As my clan grows, I'll need to take protective measures to keep my property a secret from would-be dragon slayers.

·  Feed. Feeding a dragon can be very expensive. Although they don't eat more than a couple of times each week, a fully-grown dragon can consume six or eight cows each month.

·  Supplies and training. Other expenses such as protective clothing, burn creams, and potions for regrowing limbs that may be inadvertently bitten off. Even under the best circumstances and with the best dragon relationships, there are accidents. Other expenses include the purchase of gold and jewels to be used as rewards in training, as well as a correspondence course in Draco, the language of the great wyrms.

·  Veterinary and dental fees. Many large animal practitioners are biased against dragons, and charge “hazard fees” to work around them.

·  I thought insurance costs would be bigger, but when I mentioned my plans to our insurance agent, he laughed and said our current policy would cover dragon-related accidents on our property. However, he did raise my deductible for visits related to mental health.

Risks & challenges

I could be eaten or die by fire if there is a training accident. I may lose a duel with a dragon slayer if he comes onto my property. Communicating with dragons in a way that gains their respect can be a real challenge. Keeping the public calm if they find out I have the dragons may pose a problem.

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't donate, please share my campaign. I'm hoping to make a real difference in the world by increasing the population of a great mythical creature.

story:
The Concept

We are a group of veterans who all ended up at the same duty assignment after knowing each other for years. Unfortunately, El Paso Texas, which has one of the largest concentrations of military members, has the worst night life we have all seen. Between the 4 of us, we have been to and partied in over 30 countries. Our concept is to bring all of our experiences together and build the most badass club in  the south west.


What We Need 

We are seeking help to raise $200,000 to help us jump start our project. What the money will be used for:

1) Buy a bigger and better audio system

2) Get a larger location that will allow us to feature premier DJ's, host large functions like Beer Pong Championships, and have live performers.

3) Introduce tables with automated beer tap systems

4) Build a badass VIP section

If we raise more than $200,000

If we destroy this goal, we will of course add more Perks.  We would ultimately like to raise enough to have the club ready for new years and be able to throw a huge party with a premier hiphop artist and EDM/Hiphop DJ.  Our concept does allow us for any genre of music, which is awesome..but lets party for the new years!!!


The Impact

Basically, we want to build the best nightclub around! The nightlife in El Paso Texas sucks, and all the bars and nightclubs around here are just thrown together. We want to build a place that is better and badder than the rest.

Risks & Challenges

We are already teamed up with the best Pizzeria in town and have the connections with all of the major distributors for crafts beers, liquor and equipment. With the being said, the challenge is starting this new venture. In order to start this concept, we have all put our cash together but realized after talking to our people that we were shy by a few bucks to complete our entire concept. Before jumping into this, we would like your help to raise the funds to give us a running start!!!



Here are a few concept ideas we have seen around the world that we would like to incorporate into the club.

1) A Full Size Stage and Dance Floor that also incorporates 6 full service bars for our patrons.

 2) A Craft Beer/ Whiskey lounge that sits back away from the big party but not to far to miss the fun!!!


 3) A full Pool Room loaded with Pool Tables, TV's and a full service bar for those who aren't all about that dancing life.


 4) A badass VIP section with bottle service and dedicated personal servers. The VIP section will be modeled from some of the best VIP's in London.


5. Tables with automated taps, one of the popular trends in Europe


6) Projectors for all of the Fights, Sporting Events and Beer Challenge night! Regional Beer Pong tournaments


Who Doesn't Love CornHole???


7) We will also be adding a Chicago Style Pizza Kitchen inside of it.



The Team

Brandon Norwood - Smoking Hot Tactical Partier!!!


James Bredeson - I'm not drunk!


Aaron Corrales - Smokin Hot Creative Samurai

story:
Mais qui suis-jeu ?

Tour à tour magicienne, princesse, pirate ou clown, j'aime sublimer les moments importants des enfants ou simplement les amener dans des contrées merveilleuses le temps d'une après-midi !

  


Après 10 ans comme cadre en Grande Distribution, j'ai décidé de créer Lud'éveil, d'abord en Auto-Enterprise en 2011, sans aucune aide, puis en EURL depuis 2014, toujours sans financement.

C'est en fondant une association de joueurs, Parta-Jeux, en 2009, et en proposant des animations auprès des enfants de la commune que cette passion de l'animation a germé. Depuis, je n'ai cessé de me former, en restant salariée tout d'abord, puis en me consacrant entièrement à mon entreprise. 

Côté vie perso, je suis l'heureuse maman de deux anges, âgés de 3 et 5 ans, qui ont la chance de tester toutes mes extravagances et mes nouvelles idées d'animations en avant première !

L'entreprise

Lud'éveil est spécialiste de l'animation enfants basée en île de France. Nous proposons des animations très variées, comme des kermesses avec jeux en bois, du maquillage artistique, de la sculpture ballon, des structures gonflables et bien d'autres choses sympathiques.

                                                   


Tout le monde peut être client ou avoir affaire à une de nos animatrices !

  • Les particuliers,

Pour les mariages, baptêmes, anniversaires, et même les futures mamans dont nous peignons le bidon tout rond (belly painting)

  • Les associations, comités des fêtes...

Nous animons régulièrement des marchés de noël ou campagnards, des fêtes de quartiers, mais aussi des fêtes de parents d'élèves...

  • Les collectivités locales

Font appel à nous principalement pour les fêtes de fin d'année (juin et décembre) de leurs crèches ou écoles, ou leurs évènements à destination des enfants (Halloween...)

  • Les entreprises

Toutes les entreprises peuvent faire appel à nous, que ce soit pour animer un point de vente pour un petit commerçant, ou une grande galerie marchande pendant les fêtes. C'est surtout au moment de Noël que les comités d'Entreprises (CE) font appel à nous pour animer leur arbre de Noël et en faire une fête dont les enfants reparlent longtemps !!

La ludothèque

Jusqu'à présent nous nous déplaçons à domicile ou en entreprise. Mais j'ai vite remarqué que parfois les parents ne pouvaient pas ou ne souhaitaient pas, faute de place ou parce qu'ils n'ont pas envie de faire le ménage ensuite, organiser l'anniversaire de leur enfant dans leur appartement.

                                                  

C'est sur ce principe que l'idée de la ludothèque a fait surface. Proposer un lieu ouvert le week-end où les enfants pourraient jouer et fêter leur anniversaire.

Et tant qu'à faire, puisque le jeu est le meilleur vecteur de l'apprentissage, j'ai eu envie de l'ouvrir aussi après l'école et le mercredi matin pour les enfants non scolarisés !

Je voudrais que cette ludothèque soit un lieu d'échanges, de jeux, un lieu ou parents et enfants pourraient réapprendre à jouer ensemble, parfois à communiquer pour les ados. Un lieu de rêves, d'amusements, dans lequel les règles du jeu seront simples : se respecter, croire en soi et aux autres, grandir et s'éveiller ensemble par le jeu !

Et je voudrais qu'elle soit ouverte au plus grand nombre avec des tarifs accessibles à tous. 

Mon besoin en financement :

Le financement va m'aider sur plusieurs points. Et j'espère que les contreparties que je vais vous proposer vont vous plaire !


  • La création d'emplois !

Il est difficile à l'heure actuelle de quantifier de manière exacte le nombre d'heures qui seront créées, car cela dépendra surtout des réservations qui seront faites. Mais à l'heure actuelle il y a déjà deux à trois animatrices qui travaillent régulièrement avec moi, et je souhaiterais doubler ce chiffre. J'aimerais également embaucher un apprenti en administration et/ou communication.

Vos contreparties :

Vous l'avez comprit, ma petite entreprise est très locale, alors pour satisfaire à la fois les contributeurs d'Île de France et ceux de la France entière, je propose, pour chaque contrepartie, un aspect social, ce sera à vous de choisir si la contrepartie est pour vous ou pour une famille défavorisée de ma commune !

Risques et défis

En France, les ludothèques sont principalement associatives (donc subventionnées) ou municipales, et bénéficient donc souvent d'un budget bien définit. Elles sont ouvertes aux citoyens de la ville.

Il est donc assez rare de voir une initiative de ce genre, qui ne peut se comparer aux groupes qui fleurissent proposant de gigantesques structures à escalader. Car ce que nous voulons proposer, c'est un espace à dimension humaine, où les enfants trouveront à jouer et les parents à parler. Je ne peux donc m'appuyer sur aucun business plan similaire, mais je suis soutenue par de nombreuses amies qui me conseillent pour réussir cette aventure !

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous aimez les enfants, que vous aimez notre concept d'espace de jeux solidaire et plein de rêves, parlez de notre projet autour de vous, sur vos réseaux, auprès de vos clients, pour qu'ils nous aident à leur tour !

Vous pouvez aussi en parler à des marques de jouets qui pourront faire des dons, nous parlerons de leurs produits sur notre blog !

Les collectivités locales

Font appel à nous principalement pour les fêtes de fin d'année (juin et
décembre) de leurs crèches ou écoles, ou leurs évènements à destination des
enfants (Halloween...)

Les entreprises

Toutes les entreprises peuvent faire appel à nous, que
ce soit pour animer un point de vente pour un petit commerçant, ou une grande
galerie marchande pendant les fêtes. C'est surtout au moment de Noël que les comités d'Entreprises (CE) font
appel à nous pour animer leur arbre de Noël et en faire une fête dont les
enfants reparlent longtemps !!
La ludothèque
Jusqu'à présent nous nous déplaçons à domicile ou en entreprise. Mais j'ai
vite remarqué que parfois les parents ne pouvaient pas ou ne souhaitaient pas,
faute de place ou parce qu'ils n'ont pas envie de faire le ménage ensuite,
organiser l'anniversaire de leur enfant dans leur appartement.                                                  C'est sur ce principe que l'idée de la ludothèque a fait surface. Proposer
un lieu ouvert le week-end où les enfants pourraient jouer et fêter leur
anniversaire.
Et tant qu'à faire, puisque le jeu est le meilleur vecteur de
l'apprentissage, j'ai eu envie de l'ouvrir aussi après l'école et le mercredi
matin pour les enfants non scolarisés !
Je voudrais que cette ludothèque soit un lieu d'échanges, de jeux, un lieu
ou parents et enfants pourraient réapprendre à jouer ensemble, parfois à
communiquer pour les ados. Un lieu de rêves, d'amusements, dans lequel les
règles du jeu seront simples : se respecter, croire en soi et aux autres,
grandir et s'éveiller ensemble par le jeu !
Et je voudrais qu'elle soit ouverte au plus grand nombre avec des tarifs
accessibles à tous. 
Mon besoin en financement :
Le financement va m'aider sur plusieurs points. Et j'espère que les
contreparties que je vais vous proposer vont vous plaire !

La création d'emplois !

Il est difficile à l'heure actuelle de quantifier de manière exacte le
nombre d'heures qui seront créées, car cela dépendra surtout des réservations
qui seront faites. Mais à l'heure actuelle il y a déjà deux à trois animatrices
qui travaillent régulièrement avec moi, et je souhaiterais doubler ce chiffre.
J'aimerais également embaucher un apprenti en administration et/ou
communication.
Vos contreparties :
Vous l'avez comprit, ma petite entreprise est très locale, alors pour
satisfaire à la fois les contributeurs d'Île de France et ceux de la France
entière, je propose, pour chaque contrepartie, un aspect social, ce sera à vous
de choisir si la contrepartie est pour vous ou pour une famille défavorisée de
ma commune !
Risques et défis
En France, les ludothèques sont principalement associatives (donc
subventionnées) ou municipales, et bénéficient donc souvent d'un budget bien
définit. Elles sont ouvertes aux citoyens de la ville.
Il est donc assez rare de voir une initiative de ce genre, qui ne peut se
comparer aux groupes qui fleurissent proposant de gigantesques structures à
escalader. Car ce que nous voulons proposer, c'est un espace à dimension
humaine, où les enfants trouveront à jouer et les parents à parler. Je ne peux
donc m'appuyer sur aucun business plan similaire, mais je suis soutenue par de
nombreuses amies qui me conseillent pour réussir cette aventure !
D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous aimez les enfants, que vous aimez notre concept d'espace de jeux
solidaire et plein de rêves, parlez de notre projet autour de vous, sur vos
réseaux, auprès de vos clients, pour qu'ils nous aident à leur tour !
Vous pouvez aussi en parler à des marques de jouets qui pourront faire des
dons, nous parlerons de leurs produits sur notre blog !

story:
Enjoying high quality wine can be an expensive habit. Much of the cost from your favorite wines goes into the packaging and shipping of heavy glass bottles. These bottles will have an adverse effect on our planet for decades.

The EPA estimates 3.9 billion wine bottles will end up in U.S. landfills in 2016 alone.

  • Wines Stay Fresh Up to 6 WEEKS After Opening
  • Cask Reduces Our Carbon Footprint by up to 65%
  • Savings in Packaging and Shipping  allow VINIUM to Sell at 40%-50% less than Similar Wines Shipped in Bottles
  • Lightweight Convenient Package Can be Taken Almost Anywhere
  • Made From Recycled Materials AND 100% Recyclable 
  • BPA Free

VINIUM has taken the leadership role to encourage positive change in the American wine industry by crafting wines for consumers who enjoy high quality and are focused on issues regarding our planet.

                            

VINIUM wines are sourced from the finest California vineyards in the North Coast appellations of Napa Valley, Sonoma Valley, Alexander Valley, Russian River, Dry Creek, Lake and Mendocino Counties.

Our revolutionary packaging lets you enjoy wine at your leisure, where you want it, without fear of spoilage or breakage. Enjoy super-premium wines on picnics, at the pool, while yachting, on the beach, at concerts, or when camping, worry free.

The funds we are raising will help promote and produce VINIUM for nationwide distribution, so it can be enjoyed beyond our local area. Our goal is to have VINIUM’S top shelf quality wines available across the country!

                                     

                     

Our 100% recyclable casks will help eliminate some of the 3.9 Billion wine bottles that find their way to our landfills each year. 

Each case of VINIUM will also eliminate 36 pounds of unnecessary greenhouse gasses created from the production and shipping of 12 heavy glass bottles. 

If even 1/3 of wine consumed each year in the U.S. used similar packaging greenhouse gasses would be reduced by 4.2 Billion pounds each year.

We are also asking other wineries to join us in packaging higher quality wines in alternative packaging to help eliminate as much waste and carbon output as possible from the American wine industry.

        RICHARD CARDOZA - Founder               GEORGE BURSICK - Winemaker

Richard Cardoza, founder of VINIUM, was a retailer of Fine Wines and Spirits for over twenty years, working with wineries and distributors to bring the highest quality products and best value to his customers. 

With VINIUM he hopes to bring top quality wines of great value to the masses in an environmentally friendly and sustainable manner. His goal is to help everyone realize that small batch craft wines can be healthier for the planet and easier on your wallet.

Award winning winemaker George Bursick crafts our super-premium wines in the Napa Valley. Formerly of Sonoma Valley wineries Ferrari-Carano and J Vineyards George’s wines consistently received the highest ratings including #1 Wine of the Year - Wine Spectator Magazine Top 100 and #1 Pinot Noir of the Year from Wine Enthusiast Magazine.  His focus with VINIUM is to make his blends to rival the top wineries of California's Northern Regions at half the price.

In  2015 VINIUM formed an alliance with a major U.S. distributor who shares our vision of eco-conscious wine packaging.

Our distributor wants to see that there are VINIUM fans all over eager and interested in spreading the word and buying our wines!

This alliance will enable us to grow into 2000+ stores nationwide. We believe our successes will disrupt the industry and fuel a dramatic change in the way wineries package and bring wines to market in the future.

With the money from this campaign we will be able to pay for marketing, advertising, and secure the support of our distributors to bring our top shelf wines to the masses, without breaking anyone’s bank.

            

2013 CABERNET SAUVIGNON "NORTH COAST"

Seductive, layered aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry jam, ripe plum and black licorice leap from the glass with subtle undertones of mocha and spice.

The flavors are plush, rich and concentrated and seem to stay on the palate forever. Soft, supple tannins and lush fruit flavors make it one of the most approachable Cabernet’s of the vintage.

1.5 Liter Cask - RETAIL VALUE $28.99 - Equivalent to 2 bottles for the price of one!

2014 PINOT NOIR “SONOMA COAST”  

Elegant aromas of ripe cherry and wild strawberry dominate with a hint of vanilla, sandalwood and mineral notes.

Concentrated flavors of dried cherry, ripe raspberry and vanilla with a touch of dark chocolate visit the palate and stay for a while. Robust tannins give way to the lingering dark berry flavors.

1.5 Liter Cask - RETAIL VALUE $28.99 - Equivalent to 2 bottles for the price of one!

2015 CHARDONNAY "SONOMA COAST" 

The cooler climate of the Sonoma Coast provides unexpectedly bright and well balanced

Chardonnay.

Our 2015 Chardonnay exhibits classic Russian River Valley notes of white peach, Meyer lemon, tangerine and honeysuckle. The flavors echo the aromas on the palate with a complex creamy texture.

The finish is clean and long and begs for another glass!

1.5 Liter Cask - RETAIL VALUE $28.99 - Equivalent to 2 bottles for the price of one!

                

Please consider supporting our Mission by making a donation, by "backing" one of our Great "Perks" or by Sharing with Friends who Love Wine and Love Mother Earth!

Thank you,
Richard Cardoza, Founder

campaign_city: Saint Helena, Napa Valley, United States

story:
Short Summary


The city of Sombor, Serbia is dying out. Once wide-known for its artistic and inclusive culture, recent wars and political turmoil have left it impoverished, eventless and unattractive. Its youth finds no moral nor financial support to explore its talents and express its abundant ideas, creativity and ethusiasm. With no-one to lead, or show the way, the young don't even know where to start. The prevailing culture has become that of pessimism and discouragement.

Determined to shake things up, Tanja Adzic (LinkedIn), and Serge Bajic (LinkedIn), a linguist and an MBA graduate, have took it upon themselves to make Sombor worth living in. They started "Fabrika" (Factory),  a social non profit accelerator that will provide working space, mentorship, financial support and easier access to funds to young teams with great ideas. Their vision is to change the town's culture to that of activism, creativity and innovation.

Fabrika will provide office space, mentorship, and assistance in obtaining financial grants to local teams with ideas of potentially great social value.

They need supporters who will help start "Fabrika"-s manufacturing process, and save this gorgeous town and its youth from being left behind and forgotten.

Tanja

Milica

Dragan

Majda

Goran

Trile

Some of Fabrika's founders and mentors


The Problem

Our research has shown that 1 out of every 4 persons finds it “extremely difficult” to execute any sort of idea in Sombor, citing financial difficulties, no working space and no support from the local community as some of the main problems. 

Young people (15-25 years of age) who have an idea simply don’t know what to do with it, and are overwhelmed with the scope of potential problems they would face if they would decide to execute it. They have little institutional support, no money and have no idea where to look for mentorship and financial support. 


The solution

We will create a space which will host 10-12 people (ideally 3-4 teams) who will actively work on their ideas. During the course of 5 months, we will organize a total of 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to NGO operations and project execution, as well as 8 awareness-raising lectures. Sessions and lectures will be hosted by distinguished Serbian activists with a long and successful track record. 
Create a space which will host 10-12 people who will actively work on their ideas; organize 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to project execution; Leverage our network of institutions, donors and funds to help our teams fundraise.

We will stipend every team with an encouraging amount of cash, in order to promote activism as a career choice. We will organize “demo days” in which teams will be able to present their ideas to local high net worth individuals, companies, and local patriots living abroad, in order to attract their financial support. And finally, we will leverage our own network of institutions, donors and funds, in order to help our teams fundraise. 

At all time we will be providing a friendly atmosphere in which ideas, innovation and discussion can thrive without discouragement and pessimism.

When we asked our research respondents if they would execute an idea from the field of their interest if  they had “Fabrika”-s support, all of them (36 total) said “yes”.




What We Need & What You Get

Our immediate need is refurbishment and equipment of the working space for local teams - a place where ideas will thrive without discouragement. We will invest in promotional activities, in order to encourage teams with awesome ideas to apply. We will also need to pay for fixed costs such as rent and utilities. Once we have traction and something to show, we will be able to fundraise from established funds and institutions. 

Your donation will help us stand on our feet, and get us far enough to pursue more sustainable means of funding. You can find our entire budget on this link. 

Our supporters will be rewarded with a wide range of perks, from public introduction during openning event, through local handcrafts, down to the prized local fish stew recipe. 


Risks & Challenges


Initial reaction to "Fabrika" has been awesome. There are already teams interested in participating. We have recieved a lot of praise and support for our effort, with many prominent Serbian activists offering pro-bono assistance. However, albeit welcome, we know that praise alone is not enough to make things happen. 

The main challenge we face is raising enough funds to accelerate the chosen teams in our first year of operations. There is a risk that by October, when our programme is due to start, we will not have secured a grant that would finance it.  

But even in that scenario, we will not lay down our arms. We will continue to push towards securing an investment, with our director, Tanja, tirelessly knocking on every door, and our chairman, Serge, covering monthly expenses from his own personal savings. We will fully utilize our network of advisors towards that one goal, until the money is in and we are ready to revive our city. We will never, ever give up on Sombor and its people.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially, don't worry - there are other ways you can contribute. Share our campaign on your Facebook walls, and IM the persons in your network who are likely to be interested in our cause, and familiar with institutions providing grants to organizations such as ours. 


foto by Ispánovics József

Finally - a great, big thanks. If you're ever in the neighbourhood, Sombor and its majestic people and culture will welcome you. And be sure to give us a call - we'll be happy to show you around. 

We'd like to thank Aleksandra, Ena, Jovana, Marko, and English Language Academy Sombor for their help in creating this campaign.

story:
Dechets a l’Or (DalO) or “Garbage to Gold” is a small business focused on processing waste in West African cities to produce sustainable benefits – organic compost fertilizer, recycled plastics, and renewable energy – that improve public health, create economic opportunities for local farmers, create local jobs, and change the way people view their waste. We have a small pilot currently in operations, and we are ready to expand. This campaign is raising money to achieve that goal. Our $75,000 target will grow the business to a financially sustainable size. 

DalO is a holistic waste processing and collection system that we believe can significantly change things in small and medium sized cities across Africa. Your funds will help us make this a reality.

How will your money Help Others:

We are currently serving 110 households and with your help we will, within 3 months, expand to serve over 700 households, processing over 50 tons of waste per month and producing over 16 tons of fertilizer per month.

Serving 700 household will allow us a large enough quantity of waste to process a marketable volume of fertilizer and plastics, and to test models for our anaerobic digester to produce an economically relevant quantity of bio-gas. The impact of reaching this scale will be HUGE!

We will:

  1. Expand to serve 700, within 3 months
  2. Collect to over 180,000 lbs of waste per month
  3. Produce 16 tones of fertilizer per month
  4. Increase our team from 5 to over 15 people
  5. Purchase and retrofit a truck for waste collection
  6. Secure land and construct  waste processing facility 
How will funds be used:
  1. $12,000 - 1 truck retrofitted for waste collection 
  2. $10,000 - 4 months operational exp; 15 employees, gas & oil for truck, etc.
  3. $8,000 - 1300 waste bins, prefinanced for 600 customers
  4. $5,000 - 12 months Rent of land for processing facility
  5. $4,000 - 12 months Marketing and branding 
  6. $3,000 - Construction of processing facility
  7. $1,500 - Equipment for personnel

    *$31,500 - Misc exps and on-boarding 1200 new customers and 20           additional personnel.

Our Story:

While teaching English in Kankan, Guinea, Ayo, our founder, experienced first hand the challenges of living in rapidly growing cities; lack of electricity, limited access to water and healthcare, children constantly getting sick with one illness or another, piles of garbage everywhere, and limited job opportunities. His students talked about the difficulties of finding a job even with a university education. At that point Ayo began thinking about ways to help create opportunity for Kankan and other rapidly growing cities. 

After leaving Guinea, Ayo pursued a Masters in Urban Planning at Columbia University where he learned about the potential of biomass as a source of energy and fertilizer. This sparked Ayo interest in using the tons of abandoned waste to create a sustainable business in Kankan - the resources are there, and the benefits would extend far beyond the university students DalO will employ to the entire city of Kankan.

We have been operating in Kankan since March 2015, and already raised $10,000 via KivaZip. Now to scale our venture we are seeking additional funding.


Better Waste Management Leads to Better Quality of Life

Currently DalO serves 110 households in the city of Kankan, Guinea, offering a  holistic solution to waste, we process, recycle, or reuse more than 80 percent of the waste that we collect, which would otherwise find its way into rivers, burning in piles abandoned on the side of roads, or blocking waterways.

DalO works with the organic, plastics, and paper fractions of waste, which combined account for over 80% of all waste in Sub-Saharan Africa, waste that, left untreated, can cause:  

· Increased rates of disease such as malaria and cholera. 

· Reduced health for the millions of people who live in areas where underground well water is contaminated by unsanitary disposal and decomposition of waste.

· Lower economic opportunity; hundreds of jobs can be created for the collection and processing of waste to fertilizer and energy.

The World Bank, estimates that per capita the average daily waste production of the 260 million urban population in Africa is .65 kg of waste, and this population is expected to increase to 518 million by 2025 with an estimated increase in daily production to .85 kg. The time to turn this problem into an opportunity is now, please help us transform Africa's Garbage into Gold!

Our $75,000 target will grow the business to a financially sustainable size. DalO is a holistic waste processing and collection system that we believe can significantly change things in small and medium sized cities across Africa. Your funds will help us make this a reality.How will your money Help Others:We are currently serving 110 households and with your help we will, within 3 months, expand to serve over 700 households, processing over 50 tons of waste per month and producing over 16 tons of fertilizer per month.Serving 700 household will allow us a large enough quantity of waste to process a marketable volume of fertilizer and plastics, and to test models for our anaerobic digester to produce an economically relevant quantity of bio-gas. The impact of reaching this scale will be HUGE!We will:

Expand to serve 700, within 3 months
Collect to over 180,000 lbs of waste per month
Produce 16 tones of fertilizer per month


Increase our team from 5 to over 15 people
Purchase and retrofit a truck for waste collection
Secure land and construct  waste processing facility 
How will funds be used:
$12,000 - 1 truck retrofitted for waste collection 
$10,000 - 4 months operational exp; 15 employees, gas & oil for truck, etc.
$8,000 - 1300 waste bins, prefinanced for 600 customers
$5,000 - 12 months Rent of land for processing facility
$4,000 - 12 months Marketing and branding 
$3,000 - Construction of processing facility

$1,500 - Equipment for personnel*$31,500 - Misc exps and on-boarding 1200 new customers and 20           additional personnel.

Our Story:While teaching English in Kankan, Guinea, Ayo, our founder, experienced first hand the challenges of living in rapidly growing cities; lack of electricity, limited access to water and healthcare, children constantly getting sick with one illness or another, piles of garbage everywhere, and limited job opportunities. His students talked about the difficulties of finding a job even with a university education. At that point Ayo began thinking about ways to help create opportunity for Kankan and other rapidly growing cities. After leaving Guinea, Ayo pursued a Masters in Urban Planning at Columbia University where he learned about the potential of biomass as a source of energy and fertilizer. This sparked Ayo interest in using the tons of abandoned waste to create a sustainable business in Kankan - the resources are there, and the benefits would extend far beyond the university students DalO will employ to the entire city of Kankan.We have been operating in Kankan since March 2015, and already raised $10,000 via KivaZip. Now to scale our venture we are seeking additional funding.Better Waste Management Leads to Better Quality of LifeCurrently DalO serves 110 households in the city of Kankan, Guinea, offering a  holistic solution to waste, we process, recycle, or reuse more than 80 percent of the waste that we collect, which would otherwise find its way into rivers, burning in piles abandoned on the side of roads, or blocking waterways.DalO works with the organic, plastics, and paper fractions of waste, which combined account for over 80% of all waste in Sub-Saharan Africa, waste that, left untreated, can cause:  · Increased rates of disease such as malaria and cholera. · Reduced health for the millions of people who live in areas where underground well water is contaminated by unsanitary disposal and decomposition of waste.· Lower economic opportunity; hundreds of jobs can be created for the collection and processing of waste to fertilizer and energy.The World Bank, estimates that per capita the average daily waste production of the 260 million urban population in Africa is .65 kg of waste, and this population is expected to increase to 518 million by 2025 with an estimated increase in daily production to .85 kg. The time to turn this problem into an opportunity is now, please help us transform Africa's Garbage into Gold!

story:
Athens, Georgia is the epitome of a college town. With a laid-back and fun-loving atmosphere, Athens is famous for its nightlife and good times. Athens killer bar scene allows all of its citizens to go out, have a few drinks, and spend some quality time with some quality friends. But Athens doesn't just party at the clubs on Saturday night. Athens knows how to have a good time staying in as well. Whether it be a backyard barbecue, a pregame get-together, or a rocking house party, Athenians know how to have a good time at home. But with the party comes the chore of going out to the liquor store or super market and shopping for your beer, wine, liquor, and other beverage supplies. But with our service, the first of its kind in Athens, we will combine the price savings and comfort of a stay-at-home experience with the convenience of downtown bars. 

Beer Run is an Athens-based business dedicated to quick and convenient beverage delivery to the citizens of Athens. With Beer Run's website, you will be able to order from a comprehensive list of your favorite beers, wines, and spirits and have them delivered directly to your door. And the best part, the prices you pay through Beer Run will be exactly the same as if you went to the store and bought them yourself! 

There are many common situations that could be solved by the use of our service. Say you are hanging out with some friends, you've all had a couple of drinks, and you realize you are almost out of beer. Don't risk driving to the store, just have our drivers bring it to you! Its much more convenient and much safer. Maybe you started cooking for a dinner date and realized that you forgot to pick up that special bottle of wine on the way home from work. No worries, just order one of our wide varieties of wine and have it at your door in minutes. Are you busy planning a big birthday, anniversary, graduation or game-day party? Leave the liquor run to us and focus on having a great time. There is no end to the uses for our convenient and price-efficient service. 

The pricing system for the use of our service will be very simple. The price of each item you order will be the exact same price that you would pay if you went to the store yourself. If you check out as a guest, on top of your order total, you will pay a small, flat delivery fee, in addition to an even smaller mileage fee, and have it delivered directly to your door. No matter the order size, you will pay the same small fee. Whether you get a single bottle of wine, or several cases of beer, the fee is always the same. All you need to have is your ID on hand and ready to be presented to your delivery driver, and its as easy as that. If you chose to be a part of one of our Membership Plans, its even easier than that! We will keep your information on file, and in addition to an even quicker checkout process, you will receive your delivery free of the delivery fee and the mileage fee! You won't pay a single cent more than if you had driven to the store yourself and checked out with the cashier in person. For the exact same price, you can get your order delivered directly to your house or place of business. 

So if you are interested in becoming a member of this service, we are sure you are asking where your initial investment is going. The initial IndieGoGo investment will go towards the development of our website. We want to have the most convenient and easy to use website out there, and in addition to this we want to make sure that all of your information is safe. So in order to meet these goals, we are hiring an experienced professional to build our website. 

Once the IndieGoGo campaign is completed (assuming it is successful), we believe we will be ready to begin operations in roughly 6 weeks. Our goal is to kick off our service on New Years Eve and to make 2016 our launch year. If you preordered a membership, it would officially start on New Years Eve and would go through the 31st of the last month of your membership, at which time you could renew your membership if you wish. 

We do have three different membership plans available at this time: Personal, Household, and Organizational. The Personal membership, as you would guess, is a membership for one individual. This membership allows one person to order and that person has to accept the delivery with identification ready. The Household membership allows up to 4 people to share a membership. These 4 people could all upload their information to the one account, and any of those 4 people can order and accept deliveries made with this account. The benefits of this account is a per-person discount: starting at $7.50 per-person as opposed to $10. Finally, there is an Organizational Membership that is very similar to the Household Membership, but can have up to 16 people on the account. This is perfect for a business, social club, fraternity, etc. The savings for this membership are huge with per-person prices as low as $3.75 for a one month membership. 

This service is in its infancy around the nation and we believe that it will be very applicable to the Athens market. We are excited to bring this new idea to a town like Athens, the town that the entire Beer Run Team calls home. Drink on and party hard, Athens.

story:
Check out our Prezi presentation

Double Impact: Help Bridge the Digital Divide and Institutionally Facilitate the Food Justice Movement

We are not your average techies....
We are the people that you call when you really want to understand the software you use at work; the toy you bought for your child and are not sure whether it is safe; the gadget you got as a gift and don't know what it is and how to use it.
You come to us because we know how to explain things to you, in your language, at your level, without any judgment.  We understand you. We understand technology.
And we want to build a natural food cafe as a gathering space for learning and training.  We appreciate the fact that we are able to offer our skill sets as much needed services at affordable rates.
In the spirit of social justice and a commitment to build sustainable communities we are able to offer customized culturally-relevant learning experience; an inclusive and supportive co-working space for the aspiring entrepreneur; and cafe menu that is responsive to the health needs of the community.
Our products:

  • Cafe: locally sourced/natural/organic coffees, teas, juices, soups, salads, baked goods, sandwiches
  • Experience-based, culturally relevant, customized office technology training: Microsoft Office, Google Drive, Mobile Devices, Social Media, etc...
  • Co-Working Space for students & entrepreneurs
  • Consulting Services
  • Website Development and Support
  • Social Media Development and Integrations
  • Tech Support 
  • Computer Repair
  • Design Services: flyers, posters, booklets, other print materials

  • Tech Desks  (computer loaded with software for customer use)

,
Location! Location! Location! Help Open Our Doors

We are asking $45,000 for:
  • downpayment on space
  • remodeling 900 sq/ft space to code upgrade
  • upgrade telecommunications infrastructure
  • purchase commercial equipment (induction ranges, crispers, slow cookers, etc.)
We have a unique opportunity to open our tech cafe on a densely populated block in Washington Heights.  The location is one of the storefronts of 3810 Housing Development Financial Corporation (between 158th and 159th Street), a low-to-moderate income housing cooperative. The Board Members are in support of our business model and would love to have a cooperative business in their property.

Steps away from the location are: the subway, the Post Office, 24 hour Planet Fitness,  Boston Market (coming soon!), 3 banks, real estate and travel agencies, barber shops, supermarket, bodega, variety stores; New York Presbyterian Hospital is 6 blocks away! NO CAFES - NO DIRECT COMPETITION!

The Perks

Everyone will get a free cup of organic coffee once we open our doors.  Everyone will be mentioned in all of our publicity.  Here are our perks:
  • $25 - Unimpressed Mug
  • $50 - Unimpressed Mug & T-shirt + 2 free Smoothies
  • $100 - Unimpressed Mug & T-shirt  + 2 free meals
  • $250 - Unimpressed Mug & T-shirt + 2 free meals + 10% off for a year!

Growing up "hood" in the Analog to Digital Era

Our Theory of Change

As social justice organizers and technologists that grew up and live in Washington Heights, we want to bring NYC's Silicon Alley to "da' hood".  

The established link between education and health outcomes is the motivating force behind opening a tech center and natural/organic food cafe.  

Washington Heights in the 1980's and 1990's was the crime capital of New York City.  Now, our neighborhood is experiencing a cultural and economic rebirth attracting all types of people and businesses wanting to call Washington Heights home.

Despite the technological revolution of the past fifteen years, and all the recent economic growth not much has changed in our community as it relates to access to technology education that create paths to meaningful employment or the ability to purchase affordable natural/organic food. 

Meanwhile, the fast-paced growth of technological innovations has drastically changed the way many people work.  Very few companies have limited resources to properly train their employees to keep up with the changes.  And workers don't have the time and/or money to commit to traditional courses.  Online classes are often not comprehensive enough.  


As a result, many jobs become obsolete and employers are hiring younger, tech-savvy people who work for less.  And the glass ceiling is thickest for women and minority communities - even if we do get the degrees, we still do not get hired. 


The other critical challenge is that despite the fact that the local restaurants may offer relatively healthy meals they are limited in scope.  The over-prevalence of fast food chains, bodegas, and delis are major factors in making cheap junk food available to people with limited budgets.


We are ready to take on those challenges and empower ourselves while we empower our community.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't get the full $45,000, but do get $25,000 that secures a lease we have a few options available to us: 

  • traditional bank loans with our lease
  • rent storefront to a temporary client such as a tax company during tax season
If we don't get the minimum of $25,000 which secures a lease, we will put whatever available funds into a savings account, and continue to solicit funds to open the cafe.
We are determined to realize our vision of having a Bits and Bites Tech Cafe in every underserved community of New York City!

Vision and Mission: Old Skool Flavor with Nu Skool Rules

Our vision is to accomplish two goals: help bridge the digital divide in technology education and, as a business, be an active agent of the food justice movement to address the health disparities in all the underserved communities of New York City.


Our mission is to establish Bits and Bites Tech Cafe as the model cooperative business that offers inclusive co-work space, expands access to technology education and have a menu of locally-sourced, natural/organic food/drinks to underserved communities in our community.


We will operate as a worker-owned business in accordance to the seven principles of cooperation of the International Co-operative Alliance which are:

  1. Voluntary and Open Membership
  2. Democratic Member Control
  3. Member Economic Participation
  4. Autonomy and Independence
  5. Education and Training
  6. Cooperation among Cooperatives
  7. Concern for Community

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but like to support, please share our links to people you know who want to support a sustainable business that cares about the environmental, human, social, civil and political rights.  

Send our link who wants to support local revitalizers, not outside gentrifiers.

Like our page in Facebook and follow us Twitter! 


And when the store opens, come have a cup of coffee.

story:
Short Summary

I am a disabled combat Veteran, I was deployed in Iraq for Operation Iraqi Freedom. My time serving resulted in physical injuries that limit the amount of physical work I can now do (before the Army I worked in construction and am a General Contractor), Due to these factors I invested all my savings into a company, Globally Good which sells different product lines I design myself, including a sports line that sells stainless steel water bottles. My sports line is called Team Hydrate.

I am now being threatened with a law suit by a large corporation, Steel Technology, LLC who have already put one company out of business for a trademark they got that should never have been passed.

The trademark they managed to get passed (after several attempts and several denials) is for an unpainted strip of metal at the top of the bottle under the lid, which their Hydro Flask bottles also have.

The president of the company made a sworn statement in January, 2015 saying as far as he was aware no other company had been using this design. We were selling our bottles before this along with Thermos who have been selling such a bottle since 2012 and several other companies as shown in the video above and the additional images on this campaign.

The untrue statement he gave was the reason the trademark was passed.

We believe in a free market, where large corporations don't get to bully smaller family-run businesses out of the marketplace and would love help from you to stand alongside us as we appeal for this unfair trademark to be reversed.

Your donations will be helping a Veteran continue to work hard to provide for his family. Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

We will be using the funds to appeal this shouldn't-have-been-passed trademark which will cost $2000. We may need further costs for legal fees if Hydro Flask continues this egregious pursuit to try to put small companies out of business.

We are not trying to make money from people, we just want the ability to continue working hard on the business we have created for ourselves.

Any money after the legal costs are taken care of will be donated to charity!

The Impact

In January of 2014 there were 49,000+ homeless Veterans according to the US department of housing.
After serving most Veterans want to come home and continue to contribute to society, starting small businesses is one of the positive ways we can do this. 
We have proven we can work hard and care about fighting for this countries (and every citizen's) freedom, we believe large businesses shouldn't be trying to corner the marketplace making it hard for businesses started on American soil to stay in business.

Risks & Challenges

Taking on a large corporation we risk further legal action being taken against us, but we are determined to not have Steel Technology, owners of Hydro Flask put any more small companies out of business and feel this is a stand we have to make.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand the holidays are upon us (this is one of the other reasons this happening this week has hit us so hard) , so if you are unable to contribute at this time we ask that you please take the time to share our campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social media.

From this humble Veteran to you, I thank you!

story:
What is The Dub Truck?

The Dub Truck is a work in progress. After much planning and preparation, an original 1979 Chevrolet P30 step van has been purchased and will be modified into a food truck. Once finished, The Dub Truck will be operated primarily in Northwest Arkansas.

  • Only ingredients from local businesses and individuals at Farmer's Markets will be included in my dishes. No big box stores playing a role here.
  • My menu will change constantly. One week may be Greek breakfast and the next may be Indian dinners. I want to produce creative and outgoing dishes that keep people coming back for more.
  • By backing The Dub Truck, you will play a part in making a community self-reliant by focusing on small business helping small businesses grow.


What We Need & What You Get

  • I'll be completely transparent and honest with you... This conversion is going to be very time consuming and will come with a significant cost.
  • Luckily, the engine has been completely rebuilt and is in very good shape. There is still some minor body work to be done ($2,000), plumbing work ($1,000), electric work ($1,500), restaurant equipment ($10,000), a vinyl wrap ($6,000), rental of a commercial kitchen for initial 3 months ($9,000), licensing and insurance ($8,000).
  • Apart from my time and effort, I am continuing to work and will have my own finances invested in The Dub Truck.
  • While I do need your support to make this dream a reality, I'm not looking to take your money and run. There are a number of perks available that will allow me to give in return: meals, shirts, permanent recognition in the truck, and even a personalized food truck item!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute in the way they would like to, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on all social media platforms and get the buzz going for The Dub Truck.
  • There are other ways to contribute and receive Legendary status. If you or anyone you know is interested in becoming a sponsor or supplying equipment, feel free to contact me.

That's all there is to it.

Thank you for your support, Bros & Brodettes!
story_txt:
What is The Dub Truck?The Dub Truck is a work in progress. After much planning and preparation, an original 1979 Chevrolet P30 step van has been purchased and will be modified into a food truck. Once finished, The Dub Truck will be operated primarily in Northwest Arkansas.  Only ingredients from local businesses and individuals at Farmer's Markets will be included in my dishes. No big box stores playing a role here. My menu will change constantly. One week may be Greek breakfast and the next may be Indian dinners. I want to produce creative and outgoing dishes that keep people coming back for more. By backing The Dub Truck, you will play a part in making a community self-reliant by focusing on small business helping small businesses grow.     What We Need & What You Get  I'll be completely transparent and honest with you... This conversion is going to be very time consuming and will come with a significant cost.
Luckily, the engine has been completely rebuilt and is in very good shape. There is still some minor body work to be done ($2,000), plumbing work ($1,000), electric work ($1,500), restaurant equipment ($10,000),  a vinyl wrap ($6,000), rental of a commercial kitchen for initial 3 months ($9,000), licensing and insurance ($8,000).
Apart from my time and effort, I am continuing to work and will have my own finances invested in The Dub Truck.
While I do need your support to make this dream a reality, I'm not looking to take your money and run. There are a number of perks available that will allow me to give in return: meals, shirts, permanent recognition in the truck, and even a personalized food truck item!
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people can't contribute in the way they would like to, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Share this campaign on all social media platforms and get the buzz going for The Dub Truck.
There are other ways to contribute and receive Legendary status. If you or anyone you know is interested in becoming a sponsor or supplying equipment, feel free to contact me.   That's all there is to it.Thank you for your support, Bros & Brodettes!

story:
Why build a bottle library?

Two of the biggest concerns for the future of Myanmar are the education of the younger generation and protection of the natural environment. The bottle-building project in Na Jo Ai village is designed to raise awareness of the damage caused by plastic waste and to provide a resource library to enhance the education of the village residents. 

What We Need

Our friends and partners in the tourism industry and the Bagan community are assisting in gathering rubbish and recycled plastic bottles. These will serve as the 'bricks' for the building. However we still have construction costs to cover as well as librarian training and materials needed to ensure a sustainable project.

  • Materials: building supplies including cement, cross beams, labour costs and a roof.
  • Staffing: we hope to train 2 residents of the village as librarians with the assistance of the British council
  • Ongoing material rotation will ensure the residents of Na Jo Ai are getting the maximum benefit from the library

The Impact

This is the first project of its kind in Myanmar. Our friends at Husk (

http://www.huskcambodia.org/#!bottle-buildings/c5hc )have proven the success of such projects in Cambodia and are assisting us in our efforts. Already we are seeing the positive impact of environmental education and positive motivation from the community to clean up their surroundings. We hope the long term benefit of the library will help improve the lives of Na Jo Ai's residents and provide them with greater opportunities for employment.

Risks & Challenges

We have worked hard to develop a strong relationship with the local community and gain their trust in the project. Of course the biggest hurdle for us is time and money. Stuffing 20,000 bottles takes a long time (30 minutes per bottle for stuffing not to mention the time spent collecting the plastic waste to fill the bottle!). We are in regular contact with key members of the community to ensure they are patient and remain enthusiastic about the plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to help Na Jo Ai- not just by giving money!

  • Join with the Bagan Plastic Campaign's weekly clean-ups
  • Help us stuff bottles when visiting Bagan
  • Spread the word to friends and family

story:
Why Are We Here?

Well, it all started when a man and an ovulating woman really liked each other...kidding! Sort of. We really wouldn't be here without periods and the menstrual cycle, right? So why are we, as a society, so afraid to talk about them?

We're so used to hearing everything negative about menstruation - what a pain in the uterus! - but we're here to tell you it doesn't have to be so bad. 

We're tired of being told to hide our period or made to feel ashamed of it. We say, let's own it! Not only that, let's celebrate it, honor it, and learn more about it. Because menstruation doesn't need to be just something we dread having to endure every month. 

There's so much more to it than that, and it is empowering.
Guys, we're talking to you, too!

What Is Cycledork?

We are everything cycle-related (and yes, sometimes we can't help being a bit dorky about it!)

Some have referred to 2015 as the year of the period, and though we've come a long way in terms of awareness and stigma-busting, there is SO much more to do. That's why it's so important to keep the momentum going.

Our intention is to continue that conversation, to foster a safe and welcoming platform for socially conscious, period-positive, body-positive dialogue and to create even more opportunities for honoring, celebrating, and learning more about the very natural process that is not only necessary to create life but actually affects us all in so many more ways than we could've imagined.

For instance:
  • Did you know more than one fifth of the girls in Sierra Leone miss school because of menstrual stigmas?
  • Do you really know what's in your feminine products?
  • Have you heard of the tampon tax?
  • Are you aware of all  available contraception options?
  • Did you know PMS is common but not "normal"?
  • What is the menstrual cycle, anyway?

Not so sure about all that? No worries, that's why we're here! 

You can also expect to see some great interviews, helpful health and wellness tips, the latest on reusables, cycle apps, and technology (yes, there's period tech news!) and of course, some lighthearted menstrual mirth. We do love us some plucky period humor.

Why Help?

We need your help to show the world menstruation matters. That periods can be empowering.

Women will spend an approximate whopping 3000 days of their lives menstruating - that's over 8 years! - and yet it's still something we aren't welcomed to talk about freely. Worse, there's still so much misinformation out there. 
"Repairing women's relationship to the body through undoing the menstrual taboo and sharing body literacy ought to be foundational to the feminist movement. It reconnects us to ourselves and to the world around us, to each other. It is a vital source of revolutionary power."  - Holly Grigg-Spall
62 million girls worldwide are not in school. A large part of this has to do with menstrual stigmas.
"Scholarships, bathrooms, and safe transportation will only go so far if societies still view menstruation as shameful and shun menstruating girls." - Michelle Obama
We find this unacceptable.

Fund Goals

After we pay campaign fees, 100% of your contribution will go towards our mission.
Funds raised will help us cover the costs of building our full website including hosting and development, paying our wonderful graphic designer who has worked so patiently, and getting us off the ground with startup marketing costs. Our goal also includes a small startup nest egg to pay a modest team of regular contributors as well as visual artists to create awesome and special Cycledork infographics and images. We have big ideas! And we think you'll really like them.

Our Amazing Perks & Partners

We're so excited to be launching our very first Cycledork swag!
Featuring "Undo the Taboo" on our T-shirt, Mug, & Tote.

T-shirts and totes will be hand-printed locally in NYC by the wonderful Magdalena Concepts.  T-shirts available in women's (S-2XL) and unisex (XS-4XL) - If you claim this perk we will reach out to you for size preference.
We are also incredibly grateful for the generosity of our amazing partners. 


E-book download and *signed* copies of "Sweetening the Pill" by Holly Grigg-Spall. This is a must-read book exploring the side-effects and broader social impact of hormonal contraceptives. It's also being made into Ricki Lake and Abby Epstein (the duo behind "Business of Being Born")'s next documentary, coming soon!
"Holly Grigg-Spall is fearless, and her courageous advocacy on behalf of
women whose stories are too often silenced is a model for others trying
to make positive change through health activism. Read the book and get inspired, get angry, and most importantly get information. Sweetening the Pill is exactly the thing needed to energize and mobilize this important women's health conversation."
-- Laura Eldridge, author of In Our Control: The Complete Guide to
Contraceptive Choices for Women.

$50 Gift Certificate for Lunapads - where we bought our first eco-friendly menstrual pads! They have menstrual cups and lunapanties, too. In partnership with AFRIpads, they support education for girls in developing countries and provide reusable menstrual pads through their Pads4Girls pad-for-pad program. 

Taboo-breaking t-shirt and buttons from unTabooed, a wonderful organization bringing reusable menstrual products to low income women. We are proud to be teaming up with them in collaboration with GladRags, a Portland-based company providing eco-friendly, reusable menstrual products. Together, with your contribution, we can provide 7 low income women with reusable products. T-shirts available in women's (S-2XL) and unisex (XS-4XL) - If you claim this perk we will reach out to you for size preference.

"The Woman's Yoga Book: Asana and Pranayama for All Phases of the Menstrual Cycle" by Bobby Clennell & "Relaxation Basics: A Doctor's Prescription For Stress Relief" (CD) by Mary Pullig Schatz, M.D, courtesy of Rodmell Press are our go-to chillaxation remedies. Pair with a bubble bath and your evening is made! New to yoga? There is no better time to get started than now. Your uterus will thank you for it.
Descriptions via Amazon:
"In The Woman's Yoga Book, senior Iyengar Yoga teacher Bobby Clennell offers a comprehensive program of asana (yoga poses) and pranayama (breathing techniques) designed to support menstrual health from menarche to menopause, along with nutritional and lifestyle information for those times off the yoga mat."
"In this comprehensive audio program [Relaxation Basics], Dr. Mary Pullig Schatz helps listeners use progressive relaxation techniques to manage stress-related conditions and illnesses, such as fatigue, muscular tension, high blood pressure, tension headaches, asthma, insomnia, ulcers, irritable bowel syndrome, chronic fatigue and fibromyalgia, allergies, and much more."

SuperFood Fudge is not only raw, organic, vegan and delicious...it's packed with superfoods! Which means it's good for you, which means it's heaaaven. Get a heart-shaped sample with your contribution of $125 or more.

The Cycledork Monthly

Announcing The Cycledork Monthly, aka The Monthly, an everything-period, membership-only monthly newsletter brought to you by the ever impassioned Red Rebels*. The Monthly is specially designed to create a safe space for women (and men) to learn about, share and discuss menstruation. As a member you will have access to exclusive content, which will not appear on our website, and you will be a part of a period-positive community that exists nowhere else.

Arriving to your inbox on the new moon each month, like nature's clockwork, you will find inspirations on how to honor your menstruating body, the ‘trashing’ of a menstrual taboo, a Q&A section (that you are invited to participate in), a beautiful piece of menstrual art or an expose on a period-positive artist, and a healthy recipe that can help keep your hormones in balance, among other features and surprises, like guest editors and giveaways.

For your FREE early bird membership (normally $10/month) you will receive a handwritten welcome note and a handmade beaded menstrual bracelet unique to The Monthly that is not only fashionable but functional (instructions included! hint: it's like a period app on your wrist...batteries not included or required).

The Monthly is curated by Cycledork contributor Amy Lembcke, in collaboration with Cycledork editors. The first issue will arrive in early 2016.

*Of the Red Rebel Menstrual Cycle Club, of course. Our other favorite nickname for The Monthly.

Who We Are

Hello! I'm Jennilyn Carson, founder of Cycledork. I started this site because I always wished something like this existed - when I was a teenager navigating all the wild changes, when I was in college trying to figure out my life (oh, 20s!), and now, in my 30s, when the possibility of having children hovers on the horizon. I was a cycledork very early on, fascinated by the menstrual cycle at a young age - who isn't, right? ;) But there were very limited resources. That list is expanding - thanks internet! - but we're still lacking the voice and attention we, as humans, women and men, girls and boys, deserve. 

Once I started learning about my cycle, my whole world opened up. And as I continue to learn, to tune in, to be aware of how powerful menstruation is not only on a personal, but a social and global level, too, the better understanding I have of body, my relationships, my passions AND my life.

I hope you will join us on this very important journey!

We are building a team and already have amazing contributors. Check them out on the beta website now. Want to be involved? Join us!

Risks & Challenges

We are fighting an uphill battle when it comes to undoing taboos and bringing positivity to periods - it's been WAY to easy to bash them all these years! 

Additionally, starting a website is no piece of delicious chocolate cake. There's a lot of work involved and there's always the risk of failure or not achieving goals. As a team, we're strong, and we'll be doing our darndest to make it all happen. Cake may or may not be involved at some point.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute monetarily? We'd love your help in other ways.

Connect with us!

  • facebook
  • twitter
  • instagram 

Please share, tweet, email our campaign. And be sure to sign up for our newsletter!

Our sincerest gratitude. Happy cycling! 

#cycledork #empoweredperiod #undothetaboo
