story:
Cycling

Cycling is amazing and free. It's fun, great exercise and can improve your standard of life. We say it doesn't matter how much you ride, how little, how far or how short, you just ride!

What is Bike Clinique?

Bike Clinique is a project to develop a mobile bike shop in an extra long, super high, and eco-friendliest Volkswagen Crafter available.  We will build a full service state of art bike workshop in the load compartment. We will use the best tool and equipment in the industry to provide the most comprehensive bike service. This project is both eco and ethical. There are a range of awesome and unique perks to choose from, all proceeds will go to developing our concept shop. The cycling industry is changing and the traditional bike shop model must evolve. Bike Clinique LTD is the evolution of the tbs. The bike shop that comes to you at your convenience with parts; accessories and expertise. One on one personal level of service, when you need it and where you need it. Just book online via our website or call us. We will be able to perform any workshop job from this mobile facility and you get your bike straight away. We come to you, fix or service your bike and you just do what you love, ride!

A little history

I’m Freddie, I am a professional bicycle technician, cycling training instructor and cyclist. I came from an engineering background where I studied electrical engineering. I realized my impact would be less profound as a conventional employee so I pursued my passion of a cycle professional and entrepreneur. I have worked in the cycling industry for over 6 years and achieved my Cytech 2 certification for about 6 years. Over these years I have developed skills and maintained relationships with many customers and industry professionals. My aspiration is to progress my skills and ability to the next level, as an entrepreneur and business pioneer. In July, I became a dad to the most awesome son and I am more determined than ever to make Bike Clinique a success. I know that no matter what obstacles I may face, I will make it in this industry.

Where will the funds go and our progress so far?

Our goal for this campaign is to raise £15K. Approximately £8000 will go towards the lease purchase of a VW Crafter.

We have some funding currently and would like to add the remaining contributions made by you to building our workshop with fixtures and fittings. These include the sunroofs, van racking and aluminum lining We will also develop a mobile electrical system. The remaining cash will go towards stocking our workshop with the best quality parts and accessories. We have secured most of tools and equipment needed for the workshop.

Note: Before the launch of this campaign, we have managed to place the order on a bright orange, super high and extra long VW Crafter equipped with euro 6 engine and blue motion technology. It's a 12 week custom build and will be delivered towards the end of May. We need your support more than ever.

Our Impact

We have two principle aims at Bike Clinique:

Firstly, we bring the convenience of safe cycling to everyone, no matter how much your bike cost; no longer waiting weeks with your bike in a repair shop. We bring to our customers’ competitive prices on parts and a full service workshop to their door. We fix your bike so you do what matters, just ride and stay healthy!

Secondly, we believe in making Britain great again. We believe in creating entrepreneurs in the bike industry. My experience working in bike shops created the awareness that professional bike technicians should earn a decent living with their skills. So, our mission is to empower certified bike technicians to own their own mobile bicycle pro-shop. Stem from a successful year with your contribution, we will be designing a franchise-like model which will be a guide for professional bike technicians to progress into entrepreneurship. We believe this country was built on such philosophy.

I love working on bikes, there's always something new to learn or problem solve.

The Perks and to conclude

In return for your support, you’ll be one of the few and first to own

-  an organic T-shirt with our logo specifically for this campaign

-  Beginners to advance cycle training

-  Basic to Elite-Pro tune up service packages

-  Gift Vouchers and discounts

We aim to launch our project for the 2016 cycling season. With your support and pledges in exchange for some amazing rewards, we will be a success.

If cycling is not your thing at the moment, please share this campaign with your cycling friends, family and colleagues. We want everyone to enjoy riding their bikes for years to come.

Thanks for all your support!

the most comprehensive bike service. This
project is both eco and ethical. There are a range of awesome and unique perks
to choose from, all proceeds will go to developing our concept shop. The cycling industry is changing and the traditional bike
shop model must evolve. Bike Clinique LTD is the evolution of the tbs. The bike shop
that comes to you at your convenience with parts; accessories and expertise. One on one personal
level of service, when you need it and where you need it. Just book online via
our website or call us. We will be able to perform any
workshop job from this mobile facility and you get your bike straight away. We
come to you, fix or service your bike and you just do what you love, ride!
A
little history 
I’m Freddie, I am a
professional bicycle technician, cycling training instructor and cyclist. I
came from an engineering background where I studied electrical engineering. I
realized my impact would be less profound as a conventional employee so I pursued my
passion of a cycle professional and entrepreneur. I have worked in the cycling
industry for over 6 years and achieved my Cytech 2 certification for about 6 years. Over these years I have developed skills and maintained relationships
with many customers and industry professionals. My aspiration is to progress my
skills and ability to the next level, as an entrepreneur and business pioneer.
In July, I became a dad to the most awesome son and I am more determined than
ever to make Bike Clinique a success. I know that no matter what obstacles I may face, I will make it in this industry.
Where
will the funds go and our progress so far?
Our goal for this
campaign is to raise £15K. Approximately £8000 will go towards the lease purchase
of a VW Crafter. 
We have some funding
currently and would like to add the remaining contributions made by you to
building our workshop with fixtures and fittings. These include the sunroofs, van
racking and aluminum lining We will also develop a mobile electrical system. The
remaining cash will go towards stocking our workshop with the best quality
parts and accessories. We have secured most of tools and equipment needed for
the workshop.Note: Before the launch of this campaign, we have managed to place the order on a bright orange, super high and extra long VW Crafter equipped with euro 6 engine and blue motion technology. It's a 12 week custom build and will be delivered towards the end of May. We need your support more than ever.

Our
Impact
We have two principle
aims at Bike Clinique:
Firstly, we bring the
convenience of safe cycling to everyone, no matter how much your bike cost; no longer
waiting weeks with your bike in a repair shop. We bring to our customers’
competitive prices on parts and a full service workshop to their door. We fix
your bike so you do what matters, just ride and stay healthy!
Secondly, we believe in making Britain great again. We believe in
creating entrepreneurs in the bike industry. My experience working in bike
shops created the awareness that professional bike technicians should earn a
decent living with their skills. So, our mission is to empower certified bike technicians
to own their own mobile bicycle pro-shop. Stem from a successful year with your
contribution, we will be designing a franchise-like model which will be a guide
for professional bike technicians to progress into entrepreneurship. We believe
this country was built on such philosophy.
I love working on
bikes, there's always something new to learn or problem solve.
The
Perks and to conclude
In return for your support,
you’ll be one of the few and first to own 
-  an organic T-shirt with our logo
specifically for this campaign
- 
Beginners to advance cycle
training
- 
Basic
to Elite-Pro tune up service packages
- 
Gift
Vouchers and discounts
We aim to launch our
project for the 2016 cycling season. With your support and pledges in
exchange for some amazing rewards, we will be a success. 
If cycling is not your
thing at the moment, please share this campaign with your cycling friends,
family and colleagues. We want everyone to enjoy riding their bikes for years
to come.Thanks for all your support!

story:
Short Summary

The goal of Archangel Armory LLC is to create affordable, recycled ammunition for range shooting.

The average case of ammo costs $350 + shipping from a big box store. Archangel Armory can produce a case of ammo for an average of $240 with shipping included, saving the average range shooter more than $1,200 dollars a year, and even more if you shoot more than a case per month.

By using state-of-the-art manufacturing methods, and only the finest quality components, we can reduce the cost of your range ammunition by a significant amount. Archangel Armory is family-owned and all our ammo is 100% Made-in-the-USA. We have our 06 FFL license secured and are ready to produce ammo in March.

Funding will go towards the growth of inventory. We want to get you your ammo and have no back orders.

What You Get 

We are offering several perks for those who assist us in getting started.

$10 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 5% off your first order. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$20 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 10% off your first 2 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$50 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 15% off your first 3 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$100 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 20% off your first 4 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$500 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 30% off your first 5 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$1000 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 40% off your first 6 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks. This is ammo at cost to YOU.

.

All donors will receive their items within 30 days of the end of the campaign.

The Gift Certificates will NOT expire. You may use them at any time you would like. As long as we are in business ALL Gift Certificates will be honored.

The Impact

Donators will be able to purchase ammunition at roughly a third of the standard cost. Every dollar of your donation comes back to you in the form of gift certificates to purchase ammunition and a great T-shirt!

Archangel Armory LLC’s long-term goal is to move into an industrial building within one year, and, in 5 years, open a shooting range and retail storefront. We plan to employ veterans and support local business.

Together we can…

  • Provide gun range enthusiasts with affordable, reusable ammunition

  • Educate the public on gun safety and offer additional safety training

  • Reduce the waste of one-time range bullets by recycling the shells into new ammunition

Risks & Challenges

After appearing in front of the City Zoning Board of Appeals, we obtained our 06 FFL license, which allows us to produce the products out of our home.

We’ve also been working with the local newspaper and a local news channels doing interviews to raise awareness.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link on your social media profiles to spread the word. Together we can reduce range ammunition costs and reduce range ammunition waste.

story:
Hello friends! 

The Santa Fe Climbing Center has heard the call that has been sounding in the Northern New Mexico climbing community for years. Climbers of all ability levels have been hoping for a bigger and better facility, which would allow for a larger square footage, greater diversity of lines, an expanded training area, increased programmatic options, and a generally awesome climbing environment. Due to the challenges of finding the right location and building, as well as the huge financial commitment this presents, this has been a work in progress and personal mission for Andre over the last few years. As many of you already know, we have secured a location for a climbing facility with over 6,000 square feet of space. We have collaborated with gym design company "Vertical Solutions" for the creation of a dynamic and challenging gym environment. In addition, we are working with a contractor to bring together all of the elements which will make this project a reality.

We have now reached a very challenging point in the process where unexpectedly higher expenses are adding a hiccup to progress.

Initial quotes for making our vision a reality were significantly lower than the amounts that will be required to bring certain elements of the gym space as we originally envisioned to fruition. Most notably, the extension of the roof poses a formidable financial obstacle.  Currently, the building's ceilings are 25 feet tall. Our goal is to raise the roof an additional 15 feet. This piece of the project alone will require an additional $135,000 more than what was originally quoted by contractors. Because of this significantly increased expense, we are seeking additional funding through several avenues to help us address this financial challenge.

Our goal in this fundraising campaign is to raise money to put toward the following elements:
  • 15 foot vertical extension of the building's roof (in one of the three bays of the building)
  • Great, seamless flooring design for bouldering areas
  • Additional holds by companies like Rock Candy Holds, Kingdom Climbing Holds, Kilter Grips, and Element Climbing to fill in the additional climbing surface that will be available.

All of these improvements amount to $190,000. Through this Indigogo campaign, we are striving to raise $110,000 in the hopes of carrying out our desired vision.

We know that regardless of whether we are able to raise this entire sum, the new gym will be an incredible climbing space. However, it is obvious that without some additional funding stream, some of the above design elements will simply not be possible and we will need to take a different approach to designing the space.

We very much appreciate the kind words, patience and support of the climbing community throughout this process. 

We are confident that this space will continue to offer a place to nurture our vibrant and caring community of friends and climbing buddies. If you are able to contribute financially to this endeavor, it will be gratefully applied to the elements described above. Please share our campaign with friends, family, climbing supporters, and anyone else who might be interested.

Contribution Perks:

Santa Fe Baldy Sponsorship: SFCC Bumper Sticker 

Truchas Peak Sponsorship: SFCC Tshirt and Bumper Sticker

Wheeler Peak Sponsorship: Individual admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, with food, fun, and of course, climbing! Be the first to try out the new space before it is open to the public.

Mount Elbert Sponsorship: Reserves you a spot on an All Day, Outdoor, Guided Group Climbing Adventure to take place in the Fall of 2016. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party.

Mount Whitney Sponsorship: Secures a 10 Punch Climbing Gym Pass. Also includes individual admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party to celebrate with us.

Mount Rainier Sponsorship: Secures an Individual Three Month Climbing Gym Membership. Also includes individual admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party to celebrate with us.

Mount McKinley Sponsorship: Offers one spot in a Small-Group Instructional Class (4 sessions total) to be offered in the Fall of 2016. An array of classes will be offered to address differing climbing abilities and interests. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Vinson Massif Sponsorship: Guarantees Three one-hour long Private Lessons to work on specific areas you would like to improve upon in the Fall of 2016. Additionally reserves you a spot on an All Day, Outdoor, Guided Group Climbing Adventure to take place in the Fall of 2016. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Mount Elbrus Sponsorship: Wanna have a party? This sponsorship will secure you a date for a 3-hour long, staffed, Private Climbing Party for up to 20 of your closest friends. May be used for a children’s event (i.e. birthday party) or an adult oriented shindig. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Matterhorn Sponsorship: Secures an Individual One-Year Climbing Gym Membership. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Carstensz Pyramid Sponsorship: Secures an Individual One-Year Climbing Gym Membership. In addition, it offers a spot in two Small-Group Instructional Classes (8 sessions total) to be used in that year. Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Mount Fuji Sponsorship: Secures a One-Year Climbing Gym Membership for Two. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Lhotse Sponsorship: Secures an Individual Two-Year Climbing Gym Membership. In addition, it offers a spot in four Small-Group Instructional Classes (16 sessions total). Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Fitz Roy Sponsorship: Secures an Individual One-Year Climbing Gym Membership, with the ability to participate in a Once a Week Small-Group Training Class during that whole year. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus one” to celebrate with us.

Mont Blanc Sponsorship: Secures a Family One-Year Climbing Gym Membership (up to 5 members). Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus four” to celebrate with us.

Denali Sponsorship: Secures an Individual One-Year Climbing Gym Membership, with the ability to participate in a Twice a Week Small-Group Training Class during that whole year. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus four” to celebrate with us.

Aconcagua Sponsorship: Secures an Individual Six-Year Climbing Gym Membership. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks,” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring “plus four” to celebrate with us.

Mount Kilimanjaro Sponsorship: Secures an Individual Lifetime Climbing Gym Membership. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks,” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring “plus four” to celebrate with us.

K2 Sponsorship: Secures a Lifetime Climbing Gym Membership for Two. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks,” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring “plus ten” to celebrate with us.

Mount Everest Sponsorship: Secures an Individual Lifetime Climbing Gym Membership, with the ability to participate in a Twice a Week Small-Group Training Class. Secures you a date for a 3-hour long, staffed, Private Climbing Party for up to 20 of your closest friends. Sponsor’s name will permanently appear on SFCC Community “Wall of Thanks.” Also includes admittance to private “Pre-Opening” Party, and you may bring a “plus ten” to celebrate with us.

story:
Short Summary

A highly analytical and focused graduate looking to work in a progressive and result oriented organisation, where performance and achievements are the basis for growth and reward. My present position as CEO of NollyviewTv is competitive and dynamic that will help me in exploring my abilities and skills. I consider myself a very motivated and keen individual who is able to use my own initiative to make a contribution in a team, am a great Team member, good with technologies, very innovative, with great management and leadership skills.

NollyView TV-Affordable Nollywood Streaming For Everyone Now & Forever Hey, thanks for visiting my crowdfunding campaign! Welcome to NollyView TV-A world full of movies and shows that will ensure a great time for family and friends. If you are a fan of IrokoTV, Netflix and any other on demand streaming media services you will definitely love NollyView TV too. Stream popular movies and exclusive content anytime, anywhere with just 6.99$ per month. Join the revolution and become part of a new streaming service that will expand your horizons and culture. Support our efforts to expand the Nollywood industry and become one of the first to gain access to special content, movies and musicals! 

NOLLYVIEWTV!

Stream popular movies and exclusive content anytime, anywhere 

with just $6.99 per month => Economical

Become one of the first to gain access to special content, movies and musicals while also having fun with family and friends! => Everyone likes "being the first"

How You Can Help: 

 1) Take a look at my pledge packages in the right sidebar of this page and choose your favorite! If I reach my fundraising goal you will receive the promised pledge – if not, then you will be charged nothing and get all your money back! 

 2) The least you could do for me – yet extremely important – is to spread the word by sharing this campaign in social media. Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+, Pinterest, your blog or wherever you want. Just by sharing it, you could literally help a lot – just a single share could make a big difference! Thank you!

Platform Development, Content Licensing fee, Marketing, and Competitors 

Firstly the Platform is almost completed which is one of the major challenges in this project, marketing this is already on as we are using all the resources available ranging from social media to P2P, Adverts on Radio and Tv stations, about the competitors majority of them still use older technologies, while we will be using the latest tech such as HTML5, basically the technologies used in the development of Netflix. the last but not the least content licensing fee which is the main reason am here to raise funds for the contents I will be acquiring.

story:
My name is Martin Leigh, the usual car nut who has worked in the motor trade since 1989, after leaving school and I jumped on the spanners as a trainee like many young lads. Spent my time at college getting my (as it was back then) City & Guilds and ever since then I had the desire to build my own car. But the funny thing is that none of the available kit cars took my fancy, they never seem to look like production cars. I think we all wish to own a true sports car and truly know for most of us that we will never afford a car with the speed and looks of the likes of Ferrari, Lamborghini or now Pagani. Even now in the time since leaving school many years ago new companies have moved supercars into a new league of hypercar like Koenigsegg and Bugatti. So I decide if I was ever going to design a car to build it needs to look and perform like a supercar for the price of a top end kit car and could be produced with an option list that would mean no two cars produced were the same. A car as individual as the owner, built to the customers budget if they have one. It would also help the local businesses of production, increase employment and also be the only car produced in Wales.

The design of the chassis itself will be in three pieces with the passenger cell being of a universal design, meaning smaller or larger 2 seater sports cars could be designed around it. Power could also come from other means like all electric or hydrogen cells, the possiblities could be endless. This is also the reason unlike many supercar companies I didn’t use my surname (one it isn’t as interesting), I wanted to inspire great thinking and one of Britian’s great thinkers was Sir Isaac Newton. Grav80 takes it’s name from this man’s greatest works and part of the cars shape is created for maximum down force, let gravity do the rest.  We have created enough CAD information to produce the body, chassis, interior and at least 4 versions which could take us 5 years down the line with plans for another 5 versions beyond that. We have rough sketches too for a hypercar, 4 cylinder roadster and family hatchback, saloon (sedan) and estate.

But Grav80 is where the adventure begins, we would be using Ford Motor company as our parts bin using trusted engines, gearboxes and brakes from the top end performance models in their stable. We have a list of companies ready to supply us with all the bespoke items needed to make Grav80 happen and make them as individual as the customer wishes. Please enjoy the images we have created for you and the information we feel makes sense of our goal.

Original design sketches by Ernesto Freitas of Lusomotors in Portugal
www.lusomotors.com

story:
Welcome Original Wrenchers!

Hello! We're Brandy and Gene Stovicek and we are looking for our piece of the American Dream and we would like your help! We have spent the last 15 years in the bicycle, and service industries. We are now looking to embark on our own dream to do what we love.

Cab & Feed will be a pedicab service/bicycle rental shop catering to the tourists visiting the quaint town in the US (Location undisclosed to keep a competitive edge). The shop will provide traditional bicycle shop services, retail goods and accessories as well as bike rentals for the tourists looking to get around town without the use of a car. Additional services offered will be pedicab and food delivery services in the historic downtown district. 

What We Need 

We have raised a modest sum for our start up capital but now we need an additional $20k to help with equipment, material and startup operating costs.  Listed below are a few of the initial costs we will incur to give you some semblance of where your contribution will be going.

 

  • Pedicab $3,900
  • Rental bikes & Accessories $6,000
  • Retail Items $3,600
  • Shop Tools $3,000
  • Shop furnishings $1,000
  • Marketing and Licensing $1,000
  • Initial tertiary costs (Rent, Elec., etc.)

The Impact

Help give us the chance to do what we love while providing a unique service in the historic district of classic, middle-America- meeting tourists needs by way of bicycles.

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks involved in any startup and we are looking forward to working hard to make our dream come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute financially? Quite alright! Please share!

story:
All elected San Francisco officials,from the Board of Supervisors to City department chiefs, thanks to open government laws, must make their work calendars public but no statute mandates posting the calendars online.

Not a single Supervisor or department chief posts his or her calendar on the web. That must change.

The Govt Access Project will enhance transparency expanding the public's access to govt information, making our leaders fully accountable to voters and taxpayers by showing how they spend their time, issues on their agenda and who they meet with.

GAP needs funding to create a calendar database just a few clicks away for the public and press to access. We're prepared to upload dozens of calendars in our possession.

Here's how GAP will disrupt City Hall's data darkness:

Phase 1 - Gather and store calendar data from Supervisors and other public servants, solicit donations and support: Now till January 15.

Phase 2 - Standardize monthly requests to City Hall officials, follow-up when records are withheld, late or incomplete, develop layout and navigation of database site: Now and ongoing.

Phase 3 – Launch the site with Supervisors' calendar data on January 18; other officials' calendars published January 25.

Phase 4 – Keep calendars flowing from City Hall and quickly posted to our database, raise funds to sustain the project: February onward.

This valuable sunshine effort is a time-intensive project. Funds raised go toward a much-needed computer hardware upgrade and technical assistance, already costing us $1,000, high speed web access, time spent requesting and archiving calendar data.

With your contribution, GAP will deliver enhanced open government and democracy in San Francisco. Tell your friends to also donate, please!

Here is the list of thirty-four public servants whose calendar data will be collected and shared:

Board of Supervisors:

Avalos, John

Breed, London

Calvillo, Angela (Clerk of the Board)

Campos, David

Cohen, Malia

Christensen, Julie (Term ended in November)

Farrell, Mark

Kim, Jane

Mar, Eric

Peskin, Aaron (Term started in December)

Tang, Katy

Yee, Norman

Other Elected Officials and Department Chiefs:

Arts Commission, Tom DeCaigney

Assessor-Recorder, Carmen Chu

Budget and Legislative Analyst, Harvey Rose

City Administrator, Naomi Kelly

City Attorney, Dennis Herrera

City Controller, Ben Rosenfield

Department of Public Health, Barbara Garcia

Department of Public Works, Mohammed Nuru

District Attorney George Gascon

Ethics Commission, LeeAnn Pelham

Fire Department, Joanne Hayes-White

Mayor Ed Lee

Planning Department, John Rahaim

Police Department, Greg Suhr

Office of Citizen Complaints, Joyce Hicks

Recreation and Parks, Phil Ginsburg

San Francisco Airport, John L. Martin

San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency, Ed Reiskin

San Francisco Unified School District, Richard Carranza

Sheriff, Ross Mirkarimi (Term ends in December)

Sheriff, Vicky Hennessy(Term begins in January)

Treasurer, Jose Cisneros

Vice Mayor, Steve Kawa

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Please help us by supporting our campaign. We are offering a huge discount on all our membership packages.
 

For a growing business: BASIC PACKAGE $5 per year

5 QR codes

Up to 1000 Scans

Visual QR Codes

Mobile landing pages

Download as PNG

Dynamic QR Codes editing

QR Code Tracking

Most Popular: ADVANCED PACKAGE $10 per year

 

Most popular

50 QR codes

Unlimited Scans

Visual QR Codes

Mobile landing pages

Download as PNG

Dynamic QR Codes editing

QR Code Tracking

Ads Free QR Codes

 

 

All you'll ever need: ADVANCED PACKAGE $20 per year

150 QR codes

Unlimited Scans

Visual QR Codes

Mobile landing pages

Download as PNG

Dynamic QR Codes editing

QR Code Tracking

Ads Free QR Codes

 

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

By using the visual qr code generator you can promote your brand and product by embedding the qr code into your company logo or any image which will attract more customers as well as making your qr code secure. It's really easy to replicate a qr code with any free online qr codes generators as they all look the same. With our online visual qr code generator you can secure your qr code as it will be unique to your product or company and customers would more likely be encourage to scan your qr code.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have developed a website which generates visual qr codes in 4 easy steps. I was finally able to launch it this year. With any campaign we need people to come visit our website and get the word out about our amazing product. In order to do so we need to do a a lot of marketing and thus need your help. We will be running a Facebook campaign and Google Ad-Words Campaign including printing out brochures and handing them out to the public. We have already designed the brochure and with your help we will be bringing the qr code back to life. No more black and white qr codes. We have created perks in the form of discounted memberships and  discount vouchers,  you can create your beautiful visual qr code, edit, track and manage your qr code campaign.

 

Visual Qr Codes

 

 

  • Let’s face it, we are attracted by colors and by things that look flashy and beautiful. The QR code as it was originally made, is a black and white square that has a static like design and no visual appeal at all. This is the reason why a visual QR code with colorful and noticeable designs has been created and it will completely change the way in which QR codes are advertised.
  • The use of a visual QR code will provide the best branding and conversion results with a serious increase on the amount of scans that people will do. It’s quite natural that this codes world be much more appealing to people. When something is in black and white, it never provides the right kind of impact because people find black and white to be boring when it comes to advertisement.
  • The appeal of the QR code has been enhanced entirely now that companies can use clever images or their own logos in their QR code prints and this truly makes a world of difference. The visual attraction has always been an extremely important part of any kind of marketing strategy and this brings a vast number of opportunities that have never been available for the QR code.
  • All marketing experts have recommended that any business that has used QR codes in their marketing strategies, should consider the importance of switching to a visual QR code. The reason for this is that the increase in scans can be incredibly large and there is no logical reason to continue using the old boring black and white QR codes that bring no appeal or beauty to any design.
  • QR codes have been used for a while now and they have been quite successful in allowing people to get information on a company by scanning these codes and receiving information on them. The only problem is that the codes that most people get from free generators cannot be edited and this is the main reason why someone needed to come up with a dynamic QR code that could be changed when needed. This is going to be extremely practical for any business.
 

Direct and Dynamic Qr Codes

 
  • The dynamic QR code is a revolutionary version of this practical marketing strategy and there is no way to deny the power that it has and how it can be extremely useful for anyone who is constantly changing the offers, discounts and special deals they have available. The use of the dynamic QR code is going to make it a lot easier for things to be edited as soon as needed without having to get a new QR code because you forgot some information or you made a mistake. Now you can fix anything and make any changes you want and you are not going to need to replace the entire code to do it.
  • There is no question that the only smart choice in the modern world is to get a dynamic QR code that is always going to be useful for you and you can print it on any campaigns you have without worrying that it will no longer be of use to you in the future. The investment of getting a dynamic code done for your business is going to be worth every single dollar and you should look for a company that is going to provide an easy method for you to be able to make changes without having to contact them every time you need a modification on the information.

Visual Qr Code
  • Create beautiful visual qr code with any image or logo. 
  • Edit your existing qr codes with our dynamic qr code generator.
  • You can create any type of qr code such as text, url, facebook, twitter etc.
  • Track how many times your qr code has been scanned.
  • You are able to manage your qr codes in the my qr codes section.
  • Once published on paper, any other physical support, people with a QR App can scan your QR Code.

 

Create your visual Qr Code in 4 easy Steps

  • Choose among different QR code types according to your requirements.
  • Customize your QR code design, upload logo or any image to create your visual QR code.
  • Once you are done with your QR code design, you can download and print it.
  • Track your QR code and manage your campaign.

 

Risks & Challenges

The hardest part is informing the public and letting people know about what we have to offer.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able contribute to the campaign we would appreciate it if you could like and share our page so more people can view our amazing product. Please like and share our Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/QrCraze

story:
Goal

To raise funds of $50,000 to open our tasting room in downtown Walla Walla Washington.  The tasting room and distillery will be a community place to stop in and have warm conversation, meet new friends and indulge in extraordinary experiences.

Our Story

     The RiverSands and the Walla Walla Whiskey Company (our two brands) story is truly about quality in our Craft.  We are not novices at doing this, we have devoted more years then we will admit to, perfecting our recipes to be the finest sipping spirits. One Lady and two Men who believe its all about the process, the love and commitment in making the best Spirits that will have the privilege of sliding past your lips. 
     RiverSands Distillery began in 2011 with the goal, as with any new business, to be successful with our craft.  The devoted crew produced our first bottle of Vodka and Gin in 2013.  Its now been three years since we started producing and we have expanded our products to include whiskey and liqueurs.  In 2015 we won Bronze for our Honey and Rosemary Liqueur in the national SIP competition. 
      We do have distribution in the State of Washington, but it's not enough.  We need to have walk-in business also and this is where you can help.  It is now time to expand our product offerings and build our tasting room in Downtown Walla Walla, located right in the middle of wine country.  We humbly need your help to make this a dream come true.  All the folks involved with the day to day operations have proven we can successfully manage this company however, we just don't posses the  additional capitol to take it to the next level that will secure our brand success.  With your help, this can become a reality.
New  Home Downtown Walla Walla

Current Location - Kennewick Industrial Area - No Walk-in Business


Current Location & History

     We have been located for 3 years in Downtown Kennewick Washington which is a very quaint area of an extremely pro-growth modern town.  We chose to open at this location because the cost was affordable for a start-up.  The issues with this location is there is very little traffic on a daily basis, most of the population migrates to the malls and leaves "old town" empty.  For start-up companies like ours, we need strong retail business to increase our margins and fund future expansion. Our new tasting room and distillery in Walla Walla will do this for us.

Our Products

     Our process and formulas have been perfected over the years using Washington State Columbia Valley Grapes and Cascade Mountain Spring Water for our Gins and Vodka. This has ultimately created a very special Spirit you'll Love to indulge, plus creates a very refreshing taste experience when compared with your typical large industrial distillers. 

     The Walla Walla Whiskey Company products are produced using Washington State Barley for our Single Malt Whiskey that is aged to smoothness like no other.  Additionally we have a Rye Whiskey being released this coming spring along with our all natural Banana liqueur.

      We are offering a selection of these products and other items as perks for you helping us achieve this life long goal.

Our Products use 100% Washington Grown.


Our Equipment

     We have three stills, one for whiskey, one for vodka and one for experimental products.  Our whiskey still uses the latest technology with re-flux of 4 plates which produces a very tasteful and smooth whiskey at 160 proof.  Our pride and joy is our 30 plate vodka still that strips it to almost complete purity at 192 proof from the still.  Most start-up distilleries do not have this ability.

About Craft Distilling

     The terms "craft distillery" and "craft distilling" are becoming more common in the nomenclature of North American beverage industry. The term "craft" brings to mind the idea of smaller batches of distilled liquors being made in a family setting, by a small or medium distiller,  with high quality standards.   An emerging movement in the USA generally refers to the concept of craft distilling as batch distilling process using raw materials and methods for alcohol distillation, maturation, and blending that are true to North American homesteading tradition, but which draws on modern distilling techniques which places great emphasis on quality ingredients, sourced locally.  We as a Craft distiller are actively involved in every aspect of the distillation of the spirit, from ingredient selection to bottling and labeling.  Also we possess a strong commitment to staying true to the Craft!

How Will We Spend

70% Facility improvements
20% Tasting Room Inventory
10% Promotion and Marketing
story_txt:
Goal To raise funds of $50,000 to open our tasting room in downtown Walla Walla Washington.  The tasting room and distillery will be a community place to stop in and have warm conversation, meet new friends and indulge in extraordinary experiences.   
Our Story
 
     The RiverSands and the Walla Walla Whiskey Company (our two brands) story is truly about quality in our Craft.  We are not novices at doing this, we have devoted more years then we will admit to, perfecting our recipes to be the finest sipping spirits. One Lady and two Men who believe its all about the process, the love and commitment in making the best Spirits that will have the privilege of sliding past your lips.       RiverSands Distillery began in 2011 with the goal, as with any new business, to be successful with our craft.  The devoted crew produced our first bottle of Vodka and Gin in 2013.  Its now been three years since we started producing and we have expanded our products to include whiskey and liqueurs.  In 2015 we won Bronze for our Honey and Rosemary Liqueur in the national SIP competition.        We do have distribution in the State of Washington, but it's not enough.  We need to have walk-in business also and this is where you can help.  It is now time to expand our product offerings and build our tasting room in Downtown Walla Walla, located right in the middle of wine country.  We humbly need your help to make this a dream come true.  All the folks involved with the day to day operations have proven we can successfully manage this company however, we just don't posses the  additional capitol to take it to the next level that will secure our brand success.  With your help, this can become a reality.
New  Home Downtown Walla WallaCurrent Location - Kennewick Industrial Area - No Walk-in Business



Current Location & History

     We have been located for 3 years in Downtown Kennewick Washington which is a very quaint area of an extremely pro-growth modern town.  We chose to open at this location because the cost was affordable for a start-up.  The issues with this location is there is very little traffic on a daily basis, most of the population migrates to the malls and leaves "old town" empty.  For start-up companies like ours, we need strong retail business to increase our margins and fund future expansion. Our new tasting room and distillery in Walla Walla will do this for us.   
Our Products



     Our process and formulas have been perfected over the years using Washington State Columbia Valley Grapes and Cascade Mountain Spring Water for our Gins and Vodka. story:
Short Summary



Hey there folks! We are Intergalactic Brewing Company and we are starting this campaign to gain funding for new equipment in our tasting room, but we want to do this while crafting beer side by side with those that are contributing to our campaign. If we meet this goal, we are going to use the funds to add things that will allow us to improve our customers’ experience and our craft, by broadening the types of beer we can serve and the way we serve them in our tasting room. Not to mention this is a great opportunity for people who contribute to leave their mark on the San Diego beer community and get to know us better! Intergalactic Brewing Company started as a passion project of self professed nerd and award winning homebrewer Alex Van Horne on April 17th 2013. What began as a single unit dual purpose tasting room/brewery with one employee has evolved into a seven person operation spanning several units through out the original business park. As we have grown, we have strived to contribute to the world’s craft beer scene here in San Diego while still having fun. Now we are at a point where we want to continue doing that by adding a Cask program, a Crowler machine and even a Randall, if possible. All of these items are going to be used in the tasting room to create a better experience for all who visit! What we need to take the tasting room to the next level is $10,000, with all the money we raise going towards your perks and our new equipment. Any money that is extra will be put towards additional brewery equipment expansion and tasting room improvements. If we don't reach our full goal we will use our funds that were raised to purchase what we can (if it's just enough for the cask program, we will just get the cask program until we can purchase the Crowler machine as well and vise versa). Your contribution will help one of San Diego's smallest breweries provide some of the unique experiences that until now only the bigger breweries could provide! Even if you can't donate a lot just sharing our campaign can be a huge help in us getting to where we need to be! Thank you for your contributions each one no matter what size means a-lot to all of us.

story:
Memfizz, by Otherlands Coffee Bar

Well, we're taking the plunge: we at Otherlands Coffee Bar are going all in on launching the all-natural, deliciously fizzy soda we've developed. 

Already a big hit with our customers, we want to bring this new drink - we're calling it "Memfizz" - to the world. Memphis has given us so much over the years, and we want to give back by launching a drink we can all call our own. But, we need your help!

What is it?

Memfizz is an all-natural fizzy soda that's made from a process called "water kefir." Sure, it's healthy, but we drink it 'cause it's delicious! 

The ingredients are simple: an all-organic mixture of lemons, figs, and other fruits added for flavoring. The carbonation is all naturally-occurring and no extra sugar is added.

Memfizz is made with water pulled straight from our own world-famous aquifer. 

Why are we fundraising?

Right now, you can only buy Memfizz at Otherlands. We already have some great partners on board ready to distribute it for us (hint: one rhymes with "Whole Moods") but we need to invest in some better production equipment to get things off the ground.

With $5,000, we'll be able to:

  • Buy refrigeration space (each bottle has to be refrigerated for 3 weeks!)
  • Upgrade our filters to keep your Memfizz silky smooth
  • Apply for organic certification
  • Invest in awesome branding and packaging to make Memfizz a success

The Vision

Memphis people love Memphis, and it shows: from the Grizzlies to blues, you can't find more passionate people. But, we don't have a drink to call our own yet. 

We're launching in Memphis, but we want to quickly expand regionally and beyond. Help us put Memphis on the map!

Who's making this happen?

Memfizz is backed by 20 years of delivering amazing food and customer experience at Otherland's Coffee Bar in the heart of Midtown Memphis. 

We haven't launched a drink like this before, though, so to help we've partnered with Southern Growth Studio, a Memphis-based business strategy company that's excited to bring their expertise to Memfizz.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? No problem. Here's how you can help:

  • Post about us on the interwebs! Facebook, Instagram, you name it.
  • Tell your friends!

story:
Short Summary

Women and children among the global poor are extremely vulnerable to human trafficking. Without the ability to provide for themselves they often resort to the sex industry for income or in many cases are tricked into it. Providing viable sources of income among people living on $1 to $2 per day is essential to combating modern day slavery. We are launching Freegrance Products LLC in order to create jobs in these communities. 

Freegrance Products is an eco-conscious social enterprise selling quality products. The first product we are bringing to market is a handmade premium natural soap. We have other products, like handmade jewelry, in the pipeline. 

Freegrance is committed to using 10% of sales, about 40% of profits, for poverty alleviation and development projects to meet immediate needs and help women start businesses and bring their products to market under the Freegrance brand. We emphasize projects among women who are vulnerable to human trafficking. We work in partnership with Living Bread Ministries, a 501(c)3 with over 12 years experience working in some of the poorest communities on the planet. www.livingbread.org 

What We Need

We need to raise $10,000 to be used on the following:

  • E-commerce website
  • Initial order of 5oz bars of handmade premium natural soap in various Thai influenced fragrances
  • Packaging for 5oz bars of handmade premium natural soap
  • Shipping for handmade premium natural soap
  • General expenses 

The Impact

Freegrance Products will have a significant impact:

  • 10% of sales (40% of profits) for poverty alleviation & development projects 
  • Starting businesses in desperatley poor communities around the world and bringing their products to market under the Freegrance brand
  • Empowering women to support themselves, their families, and their communties 
  • Providing job opportunities for women who are vulnerable to human trafficking
  • Meeting basic needs by providing food, education, medicine

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you cannot contribute but you can still help.

  • Share this campaign with others on social media and personally
  • Pray for us!!!!

story:
"The best damn pale I've ever had. Hands down."


Local malt

Local hops

Beer from here

\

So fresh you want to slap it. 

This is YOUR Homefield

Local veggies and artisanal cheese

Fresh breads, fermented pickles, kraut, and more


Music that's fresh and local just like you

Join us in making this real

A few of the of the luscious Homefield batches made at our partner breweries and enjoyed by many:

And yes we hope to continue collaborating with our many great friends in the brewing community, but we need a base of operations in order to keep this beer in on tap. Help us build a place to call home for truly local beer.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In short we need money. We could open as a tasting room selling bottles to go, but our space is so cozy and rustic we want folks to be able to relax and enjoy. 

But to pour pints, as well as world class northeast grown wines and ciders, and serve soups, and cheese plates and other farm to table grub, we need to install a lot more plumbing. In fact, plumbing will be our most expensive budget item. 

  • $5,000 allows us to install four big kitchen sinks, prep tables, additional refrigeration and seating. With all that, plus our state of the art 1 barrel brew kettle, four 2 barrel fermenters, a brite tank and other brand new equipment, we will have a truly unique place - authentic farm to table and sustainable in every way.

  • If we fall short of our entire goal, we will still honor all of our perks. The rest of the funding will be used toward our ultimate goal. It will just take us a little longer to get there. 

The Impact

When we say this is your Homefield, we mean that you could and should take pride in what we make with local farm goods. From the beginning, Homefield has connected with our sense of community. Meeting farmers, walking the fields, smelling the freshest of malts, offering the chance for folks to buy into the harvest long before the beer is even made. We own it. But you own it too. This beer is ours. Let's do this together. Joining the jug club puts money in the farmers pockets so they can assure that our malt and hop supplies will keep filling our kettle. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is opening without a full pouring license, which we will do if we fall short of our funding goal. This will amount to a slower start, but we will pour revenue into the the remodeling required to get our taproom. Since we make great beer with the freshest ingredients, patience will be well rewarded. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute, you will feel great that you're helping build a community asset. If you can't, but you still want to help, please share our campaign with your friends. And thank you.

story:
I'm Justine White. My partner in crime Seth Ortiz and I are launching an eco tourism business on the Southern Oregon Coast called The Oregon Coast Experience in June 2016. We are launching this campaign to kick off our business. 

We would be delighted for you to be a part of our adventure, so we're offering some awesome deals and perks. We're Oregonians on the brink of 30 and we're ready to follow our passions. You can learn more about us if you scroll to the bottom. We're leaving our jobs behind to share the beauty and adventure that the Oregon Coast has to offer. Try one of our packages, and you'll see what we mean.

I have travelled through Europe and Central America and have been all over the United States, and I have to say I've found my heart in North Bend, Oregon. Coos County is an amazing place to work, play and live surrounded by stretching sand dunes, lush green forests, the Pacific Ocean, a well protected bay and wonderful people.

We love Coos Bay, North Bend, Charleston, and we're going to showcase it to the world through inclusive and do-it yourself tours of the area. More information about all of these trips are below and photos of the area are in the gallery.

We are working to be a green certified company. We are both CPR and First Aid certified. We plan to use local products (beer, food) and services when and wherever possible. 

If you have any questions about us, our campaign, our company or our tours, email us at theoregoncoastexperience@gmail.com and we'll get back to you as quickly as possible.

PROJECT PROGRESS

Our business plan, market research, competitive analysis, operating plan, marketing plan are complete and launching within the coming weeks. Our website theoregoncoastexperience.com is up and running and nearing completion, all other tasks are coming together.

WHAT WE NEED

Kayaks, paddles, personal flotation devices, bicycles, helmets, are a few of the things we need right off the bat which we have covered through a combination of our savings. We also have a few start-up business costs. Ultimately we'd love to launch TOCE without debt, so we're looking to raise $10,000.

We're confident that we will reach our goal, but if we don't all funds from this campaign will still go to the project. We'll just supplement the rest with traditional funding.

PERKS OF CONTRIBUTING

Contributions of any dollar amount will get you updates through various social media. There's also some cool TOCE swag like stickers, growlers, and a coffee table photo book.

Our best perks are packages and discounts off tours that allow you to experience and visit this amazing area including gorgeous scenery, local beer and wine, local cheese and meats, and fresh seafood. We are happy to customize tour options and bookings. If you want to focus on scenery and food, we will build you a package. If you want to book a day tour or secure a business retreat, we can do that too. If you don't see what you need in the perk list, contact us and we'll work something out together.

IMPACT

Your contribution to this campaign will have several impacts. A successful campaign for us will mean no borrowing, and will allow us to relocate from Portland, OR to North Bend quickly to take care of the final details. For Coos County, it will mean economic development through our use of local supplies and services including products, breweries, labor and food. It means exposure of this thriving ecosystem, and with our help preservation of these areas as well.

CHALLENGES

Starting a new company is never easy, but Seth and I are up to the challenge. We've been stepping up our workout game daily. Keeping up with social media,  developing a brand, and maintaining web presence are full time jobs on top of  current full time jobs added to the stress of moving.  

We're on a race against time this summer. We are trying to get everything secured and up and running by June 1st in order to capture the most summer tourism. 

We have a great team between the two of us, and we have a handful of trusted advisors, and marketing experts. We aim to grow and create more jobs in Coos County.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US

There are many ways you can help us with this campaign besides monetary funding. You can spread the word in your network, like us/share us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and follow our Fox and Bear blog. Forward a link to this campaign to people you think might be interested. Anything you can do to help us reach a larger audience, including using the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you everyone that took time to read and help us with our endeavor.

LET'S GET PERSONAL

 Hi! I'm Seth! 

LIKES: Cats, coffee, hitting baseballs, craft brews, photography and wood working, loves cooking and enjoying food. You can find a wild Seth browsing and gawking at food at the local grocery stores. His social interaction of choice is Instagram. You can follow him @sethragram.

BACKGROUND: Grew up in Grass Valley, CA born in Eugene, OR. Mainly worked in construction and bartending. Enjoys creating things for people whether it be a fun cocktail, or an elegant coffee table. This guy can do it all.

Well, hello there! I'm Justine.

LIKES: Justine loves sunshine, food, polaroid photography, traveling, and coffee too. She can rock climb and loves all water sports. She is also pretty fond of Instagram and Snapchat. You can follow her @gingerbluee on both.

BACKGROUND: Other than traveling the world and attending business school  in Denmark, Justine has lived in lovely PDX the majority of her life. She has a Bachelors in Marketing.

CHALLENGES
Starting a new company is never easy, but Seth and I are up to the challenge. We've been stepping up our workout game daily. Keeping up with social media,  developing a brand, and maintaining web presence are full time jobs on top of  current full time jobs added to the stress of moving.  
We're on a race against time this summer. We are trying to get everything secured and up and running by June 1st in order to capture the most summer tourism. 
We have a great team between the two of us, and we have a handful of trusted advisors, and marketing experts. We aim to grow and create more jobs in Coos County.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US
There are many ways you can help us with this campaign besides monetary funding. You can spread the word in your network, like us/share us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and follow our Fox and Bear blog. Forward a link to this campaign to people you think might be interested. Anything you can do to help us reach a larger audience, including using the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you everyone that took time to read and help us with our endeavor.

LET'S GET PERSONAL




 Hi! I'm Seth! 
LIKES: Cats, coffee, hitting baseballs, craft brews, photography and wood working, loves cooking and enjoying food. You can find a wild Seth browsing and gawking at food at the local grocery stores. His social interaction of choice is Instagram. You can follow him @sethragram.
BACKGROUND: Grew up in Grass Valley, CA born in Eugene, OR. Mainly worked in construction and bartending. Enjoys creating things for people whether it be a fun cocktail, or an elegant coffee table. This guy can do it all.



Well, hello there! I'm Justine.

LIKES: Justine loves sunshine, food, polaroid photography, traveling, and coffee too. She can rock climb and loves all water sports. She is also pretty fond of Instagram and Snapchat. You can follow her @gingerbluee on both.
BACKGROUND: Other than traveling the world and attending business school  in Denmark, Justine has lived in lovely PDX the majority of her life. She has a Bachelors in Marketing.

story:
This is Occasion Favorz!

Hi everyone! My name is Desirae Ross.  Owner of Occasion Favorz, the heart and sole of my creativity.  I enjoy the pleasure of helping other create the perfect theme of their event.  From baby showers and birthdays to graduations and weddings.  Being creative has always been in my genes and I am always excited at the ability to be able to create something using my hands.  Right now I work out of a small space of my basement.  So just imagine a 12'x9' space with tons of supplies from favors, balloons, a helium tank, gift baskets, accessories and a mini workstation for my creations.  I do what I can with what I've got but Occasion Favorz needs a real home.

The ideal store front for Occasion Favorz is a nice location in my Queens neighborhood on a block with everyday foot traffic from potential customers needing supplies, decorations and services to plan their special occasion.  There are a few locations that I have found for rent now whose monthly rent is between $1,500 and $2,400 a month.  Taking in account about $1,000 for insurance costs and a 2-month security deposit between $3,500 and $4,800 and $15,000 for renovations, inventory and cash flow for the first 6 months.  We're looking at between $20,000 and $25,000.

Right now, I have about $4,000 saved up but I still have a long ways to go. Yeah, I've got my work cut out for me but I just know that acquiring a store front will give Occasion Favorz the exposure it needs for customers to see up close our creative ability and the services we offer.  And...ultimately what I also want to establish within Occasion Favorz is a solid event planning service, balloon and gift basket deliveries and the opportunity maybe once or twice a year, to have a contest where we offer someone the chance to have us sponsor their event at no cost.  Having that ability to make the connection with potential customers on a regular basis just makes what I do more rewarding and fun.  You get to hear and be a part of the excitement of their events before and after.  I would definitely have a greater ability to sell seasonal items where the variety is right in front of you as you pass by. Having this store brings all of my inventory to one place, provides the space to work and allows customers to browse. It definitely would be enough space for balloon displays, event planning ideas and eventually giving our customers a how to session so that they too can use their creative instinct.  An absolutely solid space to operate and create...the right way!

What I Need & What You Will Get

So what do I need.  I know it's a lot to take in but I'm looking to raise between $20,00 and $25,000 to get the ball rolling.  This can potentially cover most costs for up to 6 months.  What would this include: monthly rental space, business insurance costs, inventory, cash flow and minor renovations that are necessary right now for the business to operate properly.  Any additional funds will be retained for additional cash flow, marketing and promotions.

Without a doubt any funds that come in will help towards my business.  Even if we fall shy of our goal we will continue to push forward and grow. So, business will continue, any funds that come in will definitely help with inventory (space may be limited but where there's a will there's a way), marketing, promotions and the ability to create more.

And you?  Of course none of this would be possible without your help.  That's why we have perks, perks and more perks for you to benefit from.  Now of course, if you are local in Queens, Brooklyn, and the Bronx, New York, you would be able to experience the perks that would involve balloon decorating for occasions and balloon deliveries but there are many other perks that can be received world wide, like our custom gift baskets, discounts on custom party favors, ribbons and supplies, Occasion Favorz promotional items like stickers, coasters, coffee mugs, cups, key chains and more.

Your Impact..My Growth!

Yes. Every little bit counts, every little bit helps.  Your contributions will help Occasion Favorz grow tremendously. Whether it goes towards a new location, more supplies, better marketing or more promotions. Everyone wants the opportunity to either have something unique for their event and have that one place that they can get it all done at. That's what Occasion Favorz was created to do. Having the ability to be a part of someone's special occasion or event and even if for one day make a difference in their lives, is something that is far more rewarding.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously a new venture like a store front comes with risks and challenges.  Some things that come to mind is pricing coupled with variety of inventory. Visual presentation, local area preference, convenience and customer satisfaction. These risks are something that will happen everyday when opening any business, to answer the question why should I purchase from you and not them? Then there is also the risk of not achieving the funds necessary.  While there's always the possibility of not achieving, you still continue to move forward.  You can always utilize what you receive somewhere to help your business grow. Although not necessarily a challenge but a necessity, being able to provide excellent customer service both in store and online.  One of the key aspects of any business is listening to what the customer wants, bringing out their vision and being responsive. Right now, its primarily myself handling all the aspects of the business but I know that I do have the help of family to help with the physical aspects of setup and making the store front operational.

My background in office administrative definitely gives me an edge on being able to structure and operate my business.  Through many years of working with different industries and being the leader in administrative support, computer information systems and marketing, I have no doubt that my experiences, knowledge and drive will allow me to provide the ultimate setting for my store front that will help my business succeed, prosper and grow beyond limitations. I continue to learn and grow through mini online courses in business and finance, in addition to friends who currently have and are also running their own business. Overcoming these hurdles and challenges will take countless hours of planning, strategizing, guts and drive.  These things that will not happen over night and will continue to happen over the course of time which is why having a business plan will help to not only keep structure but focus.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight and I understand.  In today's world almost every penny has been allocated somewhere.  So, what do you do when you can't donate...Like Us! That's right.  Like us, friend us on Facebook, Visit Our Blogspot, Tweet About Us, Share our Pinterest Photos and Ideas...Help us spread the word about Occasion Favorz and use the Indiegogo Share Tools.  Occasion Favorz is on the rise and we need your help!  All support is welcomed support!
